loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali has been selling perfumes, accessories and clocks for the past 15 years. He used to travel in his town and its surroundings to sell his products. Over the years, he devloped  a large customer base.  In 2007, he opened a small shop specializing in beauty products, perfumes and all kinds of accessories. Ali is very happy with his new business because it allows him to make a good income. Today, Ali is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase his business merchandise.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice T. is 36 years old and married with a husband who is a policeman. She has 2 children who go to school.  Alice is currently in the business of selling food in a hotel. She is requesting a loan to purchase tables,chairs and more sodas to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase tables,chairs and more sodas to sell.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Cheikh F. est un professeur d’éducation sportive dans un collège de Thiès ville située à 70 Kms de Dakar.  Il a embrassé ce métier depuis 1979 et  depuis 3 ans il s’est investi dans l’aviculture grâce à l’influence d’un ami. Il vit avec sa femme et ses 5 enfants dans sa maison qui est toujours en travaux. C’est une maison qu’il a bâti par le concours de ses nombreux prêts octroyés au niveau de la mutuelle de l’U-IMCEC où il est membre depuis l’ouverture. Il a contracté 13 crédits qu’il a soldés sans problèmes. Ainsi pour les finitions de son batiment, il sollicite un prêt de 150 000 FCFA  qu’il espère payer avant la date d’échéance.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheikh F. is a sports instructor in a secondary school of Thiès, a town located 70 kilometers from Dakar. He has embraced this profession since 1979, and for the past three years has invested in aviculture following the advice of a friend. He lives with his wife and five children in a house that is still under construction. It is a house built thanks to repeated loans from U-IMCEC, where he has been a member since its conception. He was granted thirteen loans, all reimbursed without problems. To finish his house, he is requesting a loan for 150,000 FCFA he hopes to pay off before the due date.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase lingerie in bulk.

loans.name: Madelina

texts.en:
Madelina W. is 25 years old married woman whose husband is a driver. They have 3 children who go to school. Madelina is currently in the business of selling beer and sodas at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and sodas to sell.   With the extra profits from her loan, Madelina hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Mayacine

texts.fr: Monsieur Mayacine Guèye demeurant à Thiès Darou Salam est chauffeur de camion  depuis plus de 20  ans grâce à l’influence de son oncle qui lui a formé dans ce métier. Il travaille actuellement  dans une société de travaux routiers à Tambacounda au Sud Est du Sénégal. Agé de 41 ans Monsieur Guèye vit avec ses 2 femmes  et ses 6 enfants  dans sa maison en cours de finitions. Cependant étant  membre de U-IMCEC depuis Mai 2008, il  souhaite un  financement  pour  terminer les travaux au niveau de sa maison. Ainsi, il demande un prêt de 300 000 FCFA pour  carreler sa véranda et réfectionner la maison.
texts.en:
Mr. Mayacine Guèye lives in Thiès Darou Salam and has been a truck driver for over 20 years. It was his uncle who trained him for this line of work. He currently works for a road construction company in Tambacounda in the South of Senegal. Aged 41 years, Mr. Guèye lives with his two wives and his six children in his house which is in the process of being built. While being a member of U-IMCEC since May of 2008, he hopes to secure a loan to finish the work on his house. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 300,000 FCFA in order to tile his veranda and to make repairs to his house.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to make repairs to his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase frozen food in bulk.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina A. is currently in the business of selling beans, posho (maize flour) and rice in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase bags of rice and posho to sell. Sabina is 25 years old and married to a doctor. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a rice store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC, a Kiva partner, has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase bags of rice and posho to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of kitchenware and household appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of foodstuffs and other products

loans.name: Perina

texts.en: Perina B. is currently in the business of selling maize at the market and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of maize to sell. Perina is 40 years old and is married to a carpenter. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of some barbering tools

loans.name: Wilfried

texts.en:
Wilfried H. is single and does not have children. He sells corn in Lomé, Togo. He works in a bustling market area and is able to take advantage of this high-traffic area.

Wilfried began his business this year and is asking for a loan from WAGES to help him purchase twenty more sacs of corn. With your help, he will prosper both personally and professionally.

loans.use: To purchase twenty more sacs of corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of groceries and basic necessities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of work equipment and tools, as well as fresh supplies for her workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hardware items and construction material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell spare parts

loans.name: Leya

texts.en: Leya K. is currently in the business of selling fish and green vegetables at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase dried and fresh fish to sell. Leya is 30 years old and is married to a businessman. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for renting. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase dried and fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rent a workshop, buy sewing machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase bags of beans, sorghum, sugar and cans of oil

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old single man living with his mother. He has owned a phone shop since 2002 where he sells and repairs all kind of mobiles phones in addition to buying rechargeable phone cards. Thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his mother's needs.

Today, Ahmad is requesting $1,200 to buy the new phone models available in the market and phone cards in order to increase his sales and so his income.

loans.use: To buy the new phone models available in the market and phone cards

loans.name: Victoria Isabel

texts.es:
Victoria M. de 59 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, es madre soltera con 3 hijos ya todos mayores de edad.

Victoria empezó con una maquina de coser pequeña, cociendo las prendas que les entregaban sus vecinos, poco a poco tubo ingresos necesarios para poder comprar otra maquina mas grande.

Ahora Victoria trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano cociendo pantalones, camisas, vestidos etc. Una de las complicaciones que ella tiene para trabajar es aveces las enfermedades que le da.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una maquina de coser grande para tener a otra persona trabajando con ella. En el futuro quiere tener ya empleados fijos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria M., 59, lives on the outskirts of Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement, and she has all of the basic services. She is a single mother with three grown children. Victoria started with a small sewing machine; she made clothes that she delivered to her neighbors. Little by little she got enough income to be able to buy another, larger sewing machine. Now Victoria works everyday, and she starts very early. She makes pants, shirts, and dresses, etc. One of the complications that she has with her work is that she sometimes gets sick. She wants to use the loan to buy a large sewing machine in order to have another person working with her. In the future she wants to have fixed employees for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a large sewing machine

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas has owned a spare-parts shop in his town since 2005. He is 26 years old, single, and has four brothers and sisters.

Firas is a hardworking man and that's the reason why he has a great demand for his spare parts. Thus he wants to buy more spare parts in order to be in demand by his clients.

Firas wants to take a loan of $1,200 to buy more spare parts and to enlarge his shop to meet the requirements of his clients and to make a good income.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Élisabeth D. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8 ans et a eu 16 expériences avec le crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce de pagnes tissés. Elle contribue à l'amélioration des condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Elisabeth D. is a 53-year old woman who is married with three children. She has been a member of the Village Bank for eight years and has had 16 loans. She is building up a small woven "pagnes" (a West African term for highly decorative and colourful fabric) business. She is contributing to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her business

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is a married woman, 27 years old, and has one baby. Four years ago, after having her first child, she started working as a home-based hairdresser. She receives her clientele at her home where she has prepared a speciA. room for this purpose.

Today, Zeina is requesting $1,000 to buy more hairdressing tools and beauty products to offer new beauty services to her clients so that she is always their preference.

loans.use: To buy more hairdressing tools and beauty products

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is married with four unemployed children. He has an auto repair shop and he is the one supporting his family with this business. He has been involved in this business for more than nine years, repairing all type of cars.

Today, Said is requesting $1,000 to buy more spare parts and mechanic’s tools needed because he's planning to expand his business after having a growing number of clients. He’s sure that he will reach this goal with the loan he will take.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and mechanic's tools

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
El grupo con el nombre de Las Flores, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de mancuernas pertenece al municipio de S. Pinotepa Nacional Oaxaca; está integrado por 10 personas todas necesitan apoyar economicamente al gasto de sus familias ya que tienen hijos pequeños y su principal preocupación es que tienen que proporcionarles eduación escolar sin dejar de considerar los gastos de subsistencia normal, razón por la cual tienen que trabajar en la elaboración de chorizo de puerco para venderlo en la misma comunidad y de ese modo ontener ingresos, el dinero del credito otorgado por Fundación Realidad lo utilizarón para comprar ingredientes como son: chiles seco, sal, ajo, pimienta, carne molida de puerco, tambien pagan a las personas que apoyan a realizar estas actividad, transporte para realizar las compras que generalmente acuden ala Cd. de Pinotepa Nacional y transporte cuando acuden a realizar sus ventas a comunidades cercanas ó cuando se trasladan para vender a la Cd.de Acapulco Guerrero.
Un día a la semana apoyan a la Sra. Gelasia Alberta S. ya que esta persona distribuye mayor volumen de chorizo en la Cd. de Acapulco Guerrero por esta actividad tambien obtienen ingreso economico.
En el caso de la Sra. Luz Maria S. N. ademas de la venta de chorizo se dedica a la elaboración de blusas de algodon con bordado de chaquira para vender (Ropa Tipica).
Todas ellas comentarón que van a poner todo lo que esté a su alcance para que paguen bien su credito en tiempo y forma y así continuar recibiendo los beneficios que Fundación Realidad les puede ofrecer.
texts.en:
The Las Flores group is in one of S. Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca’s affiliated communities. It is composed of 10 members who all need to contribute to the support of their families because they have small children and their main worry is to provide them an education while not ignoring basic household expenses either. This is the reason that they have gone into chorizo making as a way to earn income. The funds from the Foundation were used to buy ingredients like: dried chili, salt, garlic, pepper, ground pork. They also pay labor costs for the people that help them do the work, transportation costs to the city of Pinotepa Nacional to buy ingredients and transportation costs to nearby towns and to Acapulco, Guerrero, which is where they do their sales. Gelasia Alberta S. goes to Acapulco once a week; she has the highest volume of chorizo sales; this activity generates economic income. Luz Maria S. N. not only sells chorizo but she also manufactures beaded cotton blouses (Typical Costumes). All of them stated that they will do everything in their reach to repay their loan on time so that they can continue to receive whatever help Fundación Realidad can offer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for chorizo and supplies to make typical costumes.

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en:
Bassem has worked in construction for the past 12 years. He started in this field when he was very young, as soon as he finished school. He's now 30 years old and the father of one child. 

Bassem is grateful for his business, because it allows him to have a good life. Today, Bassem is requesting a loan $1,000 to buy the lumber that he needs to manage a large construction project.

loans.use: To buy lumber for a large construction project

loans.name: Anny Magdalena

texts.es:
Anny tiene 25 años de edad, se casó recientemente y tiene 2 hijos de 5 años de edad y nueve meses de nacido. Vive junto a su esposo y a su suegra en el anexo Guayaquil, distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace cuatro años aproximadamente. Ella nos comenta que la idea del negocio nació debido a la necesidad de instalarse definitivamente en la zona por los problemas de salud que presentaba su hijo mayor.

Anteriormente viajaba constantemente a la ciudad de Lima para traer mercadería y comercializarla en base a pedidos que le realizaban, pero ahora se dedica exclusivamente a la crianza de animales y a una pequeña bodega que está empezando a instalar.

Usualmente cría aves de corral y cuyes para luego venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona en donde vive. Eventualmente también los comercializa entre sus vecinos. Su cría de patos ha aumentado recientemente. Por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de ampliar su negocio. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Anny es una mujer activa y muy trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es poder ampliar su negocio para terminar de construir su casa y ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Anny, 25, was married recently; she has two children: a 5-year-old and a 9-month-old. She lives with her husband and her mother-in-law in Guayaquil Annex, Cayaltí district, which is an hour-and-a-half from Chiclayo. For approximately the last four years, she has raised small farm animals. She needed to establish herself in this line of work because she had to move to this area due to her oldest son’s health problems She used to travel to Lima constantly to bring merchandise to fill orders she had. However, now she is exclusively dedicated to raising animals and to a small store that she is starting to set up. She usually raises barnyard fowl and guinea pigs, which she then sells to merchants that visit the area where she lives. She sometimes sells to her neighbors, as well. Her duck production has increased recently so she needs to expand. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for an initial loan of 1000 new soles that she will use to buy nutritionally balanced feed. Anny is an active, very hard-working woman. Her greatest wish is to have her business grow so that she can finish building her house and offer her children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en: Koffi D. was born in the outskirts of Lomé, Togo in a district called Baguida. He now sells used clothing in a more centrally located area. He started this business in 2007. After purchasing his stock, Mr. D. often tailors the clothing and makes any necessary repairs before putting his items on display. He is asking for a loan from WAGES to resupply his stock of clothing. He is single and has no children.

loans.use: To buy used clothing for repair and resale

loans.name: Alba

texts.es: La Sra. Alba S. L. es la directora de un colegio de villa el Carmen  el dinero los solicita para la construcción remodelacion del area de a cosina compra de materiales como arena, cemento, bloque y pago de la mano de obra, ya tiene cuatro años de trabajar con nosotros es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos uno menor en edad escolar y el otro ya termino sus estudios universitarios trabaja.
texts.en:
Alba S. L. is the principal at a school in Villa el Carmen. She is asking for funds to remodel her kitchen. She needs sand, cement, and concrete block and she will need to pay labor costs, too. She has collaborated with us for 4 years. She's a single mother of two children, one of whom is still a school-aged minor and another who has graduated from college and is employed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud has been working as a farmer for the past 12 years. He's a 32-year-old single man who lives alone. He learned his occupation from his father. He grows all types of vegetables, each in its season, and he also has an agriculture tent (like a greenhouse) to facilitate the cultivation. He sell his harvest in the market. 

Today, Mahmoud is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy supplies, such as fertilizer, seeds and equipment, that he needs to increase his productivity and raise his income.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as fertilizer, seeds and equipment

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es:
Víctor Tómala de 45 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, cuenta en su casa con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa es ama de casa con ella tiene 3 hijos.

Víctor empezó con un vehiculo muy viejo haciendo fletes, poco a poco tubo capital suficiente para comprar un auto nuevo.

Ahora Víctor es taxista ambulante, trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 20h00 todos los días. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es la desconfianza de sus clientes al coger los taxistas ambulantes por la delincuencia que hay en las calles.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar aceite y amortiguadores para el taxi. En el futuro quiere una compañía de taxis.
texts.en:
Victor T. is 45 years old and lives in the greater urban area of Paraiso de Guayaquil. He lives in a house with his wife and their 3 children. They have all the basic services in the home. Victor began making deliveries with a very old car, but little by little he had enough capital to buy a new vehicle. Now Victor is an independent taxi-driver. He works from 6:00am to 8:00pm every day. One of the disadvantages that he has is the distrust of his customers to use independent taxis because of the delinquency that there is in the streets. With the loan he would like to buy oil and shock absorbers for the taxi. In the future he would like to own a taxi company.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: oil, shock absorbers

loans.name: Brigida Matilde

texts.es: La señora Brígida Matilde S. es maestra de educación secundaria donde cada día tiene que viajar hasta su lugar de trabajo, es madre de un hijo en edad escolar antes de iniciar a tener prestamos con CEPRODEL no tenían casa propia y con los prestamos han logrado tener su propia casa y hacer mejoras de la casa desde la instalación del agua, servicio eléctrico que han mejorado su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Brigida Matilde S. is a secondary school teacher where every day she has to travel to her place of work. She is a mother of a school-aged son. Before she started having loans with CEPRODEL she didn’t have her own home and with the loans she has managed to her own home and to make improvement such as the installation of water and electrical service that have improved their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cement, wood, paint and tin for home improvement

loans.name: Nueva Luz Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal NUEVA LUZ está formado por 10 clientes, pertenecen a la Zona D. San Antonio, Villa Copacabana, que están ubicados alrededor del hospital Escobar Uria las socias se dedican a la venta D. perfumes, aretes, collares, ollas, servilletas, reposteria, venta D. juguetes, Durante su permanencia en Emprender, que son 6 ciclos se reestructuro en un 10% D. las socias, manteniéndose conformada por  todas las socias fundadoras del banco.

La Sra. Rosse Es la líder, presidenta y una D. las fundadoras del banco, este es su 6to ciclo y asume el cargo D. presidenta del banco, la señora es vendedora desD. muy joven, se dedica a la venta D. bisutería, como también cosméticos y otros, Tiene tres hijas, D. las cuales la del medio le ayuda en las ventas, como también tiene su esposo quien no genera muchos ingresos económicos, es por esa razón que tiene que seguir trabajando para el sustento D. su familia y así poder ayudar a su esposo para que no falte nada en el hogar y poder brindarles el apoyos en el estudio D. sus hijos y en el futuro sus hijos tengan una mejor situación económica con su profesión, su participación como socia fue gracias a sus compañeras que le invitaron a participar en el grupo. 
Los créditos obtenidos fueron para invertir en su capital como también para viajar a vender, a ferias en otros departamentos como Santa cruz y Cochabamba

La Sra. Patricia es una D. las organizadoras y fundadoras del banco D. emprendimiento que dio origen al banco Nueva Luz, trabaja con nuestra institución durante 3 años, Desempeña el cargo D. tesorera en el banco, es una D. las socias bastante dinámica en el grupo, exigente con sus compañeras durante el tiempo D. permanencia en el grupo.

La Sra Patricia se dedica a la venta D. variedad D. productos D. bisutería con su carrito , D. manera ambulante ofrece sus productos en ferias, mercados, al igual que su esposo trabajan juntos, tiene tres hijas su hija mayor tiene 12 años la menor 8 y una D. 3 años, el crédito obtenido le ayudo bastante para poder mejorar su estado económico en su familia y darle una mejor vida para sus hijos y generar mayores ingresos económicos y aumentar el capital D. trabajo.

La Sra. Patricia el crédito lo invertirá en la compra D. una tienda o un puesto D. venta en uno D. las ferias, su deseo es poder tener una casa propia y una tienda en el futuro deseando que sus sueños se hagan realidad.

La Sra. Cristina Es una D. las fundadoras del Banco actualmente se dedica al comercio ambulante con su carrito donD. ofrece productos entre ellos cosméticos, calcetines, anillos billeteras, etc.
La señora Cristina tiene dos hijas es una mujer sola emprendedora quien mantiene a sus dos hijas, Llego a conocer la institución Financiera Emprender gracias sus compañeras que le invitaron a formar el grupo, con el que accedió a un crédito, que le ayudo a aumentar su  mercadería, el crédito le ayudo mucho, gracias al crédito pudo pagar sus estudios D. su hija que estudia.
Como también doña cristina es sus tiempos libre hace costura a mano como edredones, sabanas, etc.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.

OJO. En la foto se encuentran mas integrantes porque una D. las socias vino con sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nueva Luz" (New Light) is maD. up of 10 members who are from the San Antonio neighborhood of Villa Copacabana, near the hospital Escobar Uria. The members sell perfume, earrings, necklaces, pots, napkins, pastries and toys. During their time with Emprender they have participated in 6 loan cycles; the founding members of the bank have remained, and they have expanded their membership by 10 percent. Senora Rosse Es is the leader, president, and one of the founding members of the bank. This is her 6th loan cycle, and she is taking on the position of bank president. She has been a merchant since she was very young; she sells jewelry and other miscellaneous items, including cosmetics. She has 3 daughters; the middle daughter helps her with the sales. Her husband does not generate much income, and for this reason she must continue to work to support her family so that she can help her husband so that the family lacks for nothing in the home, and so that she can proviD. support for the education of her children so that in the future they can have a profession and a better economic situation. Her participation in the group came about thanks to her companions who invited her to join the group. The loans they obtained were invested in their capital and were also used to allow the members to travel to sell in markets in other regions of the country such as Santa Cruz and Cochabamba. Patricia is one of the organizers and founders of a group that evolved into the communal bank Nueva Luz; she has worked with Emprender for 3 years. She is the treasurer of the bank, and is one of the most dynamic members of the group; she has been very demanding of the other members during the time she has been with the group. Patricia sells a variety of products (jewelry and other consumer goods) with her cart. She travels with her products to markets and fairs to sell her goods. She works with her husband in this business. She has 3 daughters; her oldest daughter is 12, and the younger ones are 8 and 3 years old. The loan she obtained helped her substantially in being able to improve the economic status of her family, and to proviD. a better life for her children, as she was able to generate an increased income by increasing her working capital. Patricia will use this loan to invest in the purchase of a store or sales post in one of the markets. Her wish is to be able to have her own home and a store. She hopes that these dreams will become reality in the future. Cristina Es, one of the founders of the bank, currently sells cosmetics, socks, rings, wallets and other items from a cart. Cristina is an enterprising woman who supports her 2 daughters on her own. She came to know the financial institution Emprender thanks to her companions, who invited her to become part of the group. In this way she was able to access a loan, which helped her to increase her merchandise. This was a great help to her, as thanks to the loan, she was able to pay for the education of her daughter who is in school. In addition, Cristina makes quilts and bed sheets by hand in her free time. All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have provided in granting this loan. Note: In the photograph you see more members because one of the members came with her three children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 32 años, ella es profesional en turismo, ella trabaja en una agencia de viajes como recepcionista, ya son 5 años que trabaja en la agencia. Rocio también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de joyas de material de oro y plata, ella nos cuenta que elabora las joyas en su pequeño taller que implemento es su domicilio. Rocio forma parte del banco Comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa, desde hace un año, ella requiere el préstamo de los 1300 soles, que invertirá en la compra de oro y plata. Rocio se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
Rocio is an enterprising woman and worker. She lives in the city of Cusco, is 32 years of age and is a professional in the tourism industry. She has been working in a tourist agency as a receptionist for 5 years. Rocio also has a small business selling jewelry and gold and silver. She tells us that she makes the jewelry in her small workshop that she created in her home. Rocio has belonged to the community bank, Inti (a word from the Quechua language that means “Sun”) of the Arariwa Association for one year. She needs a loan of 1300 PEN that she will invest in the buying of gold and silver. Rocio is thankful for the opportunity through this means and is committed to paying back her loan on time and according to the payment plan.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying gold and silver for the making of jewelry

loans.name: Pedro Moises

texts.es:
Moises tiene 55 años, es casado y tiene 9 nuevos hijos. Moisés pertenece al banco comunal “Las hijas de Maria” de la Asociación Arariwa.
Moisés se dedica a la producción de artesanía, el nos cuenta que hace escultura de la cultura Inka y pre Inka en miniaturas con piedra serpentina por ejemplo hace replica de la ciudad Machu Picchu. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más material como la piedra serpentina que lo trae de la ciudad de aguas calientes y así esta forma ayudar a su familia. (La ciudad de Aguas Calientes esta ubicado a 110 kilómetros del Cusco).  
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Moises is 55 years old, married, and has nine children. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Hijas de Maria” (The Daughters of Mary), which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

Moises works as an artisan. He produces miniature sculptures out of serpentine stone that reflect Incan and pre-Incan culture. For example, he made a replica of the city of Machu Picchu. Moises has been making these handicrafts for 25 years and has done very well because of his commitment to his business. He is requesting a loan to purchase more materials, such as serpentine stone, which he brings in from the city of Aguas Calientes. This will help him support his family. (The city of Aguas Calientes is located 110 km from the city of Cusco.)

Moises is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase serpentine stone for making miniature sculptures

loans.name: Leticia Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Leticia Guadalupe S. H. es soltera y desde que inicio los créditos con Ceprodel ha venido comprando materiales para construir su casa propia casa con este ultimo crédito va a comprar madera para entechar así como zinc ya que la temporada de invierno se aproxima.
texts.en:
Sra. Leticia Guadalupe S. H. is single. Ever since she started receiving loans from CEPRODEL, she has used to proceeds to purchase materials necessary to build her own home. This latest loan will be used to buy wood and zinc roofing in order to prepare for the upcoming winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood & zinc roofing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata tiene 47 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos (Rocio tiene 25 años, Edit tiene 23 años y Genera tiene 20 años, ellos son independientes). Fortunata vende artesanía en la puerta de los hoteles, en la Plaza de Armas y en los monumentos arqueológicos de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella ofrece a los turistas chompas, chalinas, guantes todo de material de lana. La socia nos cuenta que ella compra sus productos de los mayoristas de la Av. Tupac Amaru que se encuentra al lado del Mercado “San Pedro”. Ya son 30 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Fortunata es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora que con el pequeño negocio de venta de artesanía saco adelante a sus hijos. Fortunata requiere el préstamo para comprar más  chalinas, chompas y guantes de lana. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Fortunata pertenece al banco comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
Fortunata is 47 years old, married, and has three grown children: Rocio (age 25), Edit (age 23), and Genera (age 20). She sells various handicrafts at hotel entrances, the Plaza de Armas, and different archaeological monuments around the city of Cusco. Fortunata sells to tourists articles made of wool such as sweaters, scarves, and gloves. She acquires her products in bulk along Tupac Amaru Avenue next to the San Pedro Market.

Fortunata has been in business for 30 years and has done very well as a result of her efforts. She is a determined and hardworking woman who manages a small handicraft business so that her children can get ahead. Fortunata is requesting a loan to buy more wool products such as scarves, sweaters, and gloves. She is thankful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments on time.

Fortunata is a member of the “Inti” Communal Bank, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. (“Inti” means “sun” in the Quecha language.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase woolen articles such as sweaters, scarves, and gloves

loans.name: David Fernando

texts.es:
El Sr. David es Nacido en la ciudad de Cochabamba se vino a la ciudad de Santa Cruz a los 21 años de edad en Busca de mejores dias, ciudad donde conocio a la que actualmente es su esposa Natali con la cual ya tiene  3 hijos de edad uno de 6 años y los mellizos de 3 años de edad, la familia cuenta con un microbus y son dueños de una linea en la asociacion linea 55 con lo cual sustentan a la familia, ademas cuentan con un auto modelo 90 que lo utilian para uso personal los. Los dos son clientes antiguos de nuestra institucion.

El Sr. David es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, el destino del credito sera para la compra de un motor para su micro. ya que le esta fallando cada vez y hay dias que por esa causa no puede salir a trabajar y esto le perjudica ya que no puede llevar el pan a su casa ya que es su unica fuente de trabajo. 

Esta agradecido con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
David was born in the city of Cochabamba. When he was 21 years old, he came to the city of Santa Cruz in search of better opportunities. Santa Cruz was the place he met the woman who is now is wife. They have 3 children, one is 6 years old, as well as 3 year old twins. The family counts on David's minibus service to sustain them. They also have another car for personal use. They are long standing clients of the communal bank. David is a very responsible and hardworking person. This loan will be used to purchase a new engine for his mini bus, since the current engine keeps quitting and often prevents David from doing his work. Everybody suffers when this happens as it it the family's only source of income. David is grateful to the organization Emprender, and Kiva, for granting loans.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get a new engine for his minibus.  This business is the family's only source of income.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señorita Verónica G. le esta haciendo falta el techo de enfrente de la casa. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para poder comprar el material y poder construir el techo de concreto ya que es más duradero y seguro.
Verónica G. trabaja en un clínica de el departamento de enfermera, con este ingreso planea pagar el crédito ya que los gastos familiares los cubrirá su mama quien vive con ella. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la mama de la señorita Verónica ya que se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
The home of Srta. Verónica G. is currently missing a roof at the front of the house. She is requesting a loan to purchase the materials needed to build a concrete roof that is the most durable and secure.

Verónica works in the nursing department of a clinic and plans to repay this loan with her salary. Her household expenses are covered by her mother who lives with her.

Verónica’s mother appears in the photograph since she was away at work on the day of our visit.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to install a concrete roof

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: La señora Maria Esther B. se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas suaves. Desde muy temprano se levanta para ir al molino dejando  el juego encendido para luego hacer las ricas tortillas que ofrece en la zona .antes de tener este negocio ella era ama de casa y los ingresos eran mínimos pero con los créditos que Ceprodel les brindo se le dio la oportunidad de generar nuevos ingresos en la unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Esther B. earns a living making soft tortillas. She wakes up early to go the grain mill so that she can later prepare the scrumptious tortillas that she makes available in her area.

Prior to operating this business, Maria was a housewife who had minimal income prior to receiving loans from CEPRODEL. She is thankful for being given an opportunity to generate a new source of income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for making tortillas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of unhulled rice

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maricela C. le está haciendo falta algunos acabados pero ella desea mejor colocar el vitropiso.
Tiene poco tiempo que le entregaron su vivienda, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora, está solicitando un préstamo, ya que su pequeño hijo tiene pocos días de nacido. Desea darle lo mejor. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una fábrica en el aria de producción, ya que los gastos familiares se encargara su esposo el señor José Israel Martinez quien trabaja para una maquiladora en el departamento de elaboración.
texts.en:
Sra. Maricela C.'s house needs lots of improvements but the one that she most wants is a new floor. She only moved to the house recently but she doesn't have the money to make the improvements so she's applying for a loan. She wants to give her new baby, only days old, the very best that she can. She plans to repay the loan with her income from her factory job. The bulk of the family's expenses are paid by her husband, Sr. Jose Israel Martinez, who also works in a factory.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Flooring.

loans.name: Los Andes Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Andes, inicia su cuarto ciclo con 16 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. frutas, quesos, verduras, salchipapas, abarrotes en general, helados, leña, ropa, cereales, tubérculos y transporte D. pasajeros.

Como es el caso D. la señora Irene que es casada y tiene 47 años, Irene venD. frutas en el mercado 12 D. abril, actividad que realiza todos los días, Irene necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. frutas.

Mientras que Jeorgina es conviviente y tiene 47 años, Jeorgina se dedica a la venta D. quesos D. manera ambulatoria en el puente nuevo. Jeorgina necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. quesos.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles  haciendo un total D. 11,700 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. frutas, quesos, verduras, arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, papa, helados, leña y trigo.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y sean profesionales, tener casa propia, ampliar su negocios.
texts.en:
The Los Andes community bank is starting its fourth cycle with 16 members. The members engage in a range of businesses selling products and services such as fruits, cheeses, vegetables, salchipapas, miscellaneous grocery products, ice cream, firewood, clothing, grain and taxi services.

Irene, for example, 47 and married, sells fruit in the 12 D. abril market, work that she does every day. She needs a 300-soles loan to buy fruit for resale. Her fellow member, Jeorgina, 47 and partnered, works as a street vendor, selling cheeses at the new bridge. Jeorgina needs a 300-soles loan that she will use to buy cheese for resale.

The members need different amounts of credit--300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles--that add up to a total of 11,700 soles, the amount the community bank is applying to borrow. The loan will be used to buy fruit, cheeses, vegetables, rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, potatoes, ice cream, firewood and wheat for resale.

The members dream of seeing their children finish school and start professional careers; owning their own homes; and expanding their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Elizabeth vende picarones de manera ambulatoria en el parque Santa Teresa, actividad que realiza todos los días por las tardes, también vende golosinas.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, aceite.
Los sueños de Elizabeth son tener una tienda, que sus hijos sean profesionales y brindar una buena alimentación y vestido a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Juanito community bank. She is 37 years old and partnered. She works as a street vendor selling quick snacks in Santa Teresa Park, work that she does every afternoon. She also sells candy. Elizabeth needs a 600-soles loan to buy wheat and cooking oil. Elizabeth's dreams are to own her own shop, see her children adopt professional careers and make sure in the meantime that they have the food and clothing that they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
El señor José Guadalupe H. tiene ya más de seis años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes. 
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario y comprar la mercancía que se necesita ya que sus clientes le están solicitando mas variedad de productos. 
Solicita el préstamo para la inversión y planea pagarlo con una parte de las ganancias del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia, tiene tres hijos adolescentes que les quiere dar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose Guadalupe H. has made a living selling general merchandise for more than six years now. He needs to stock a wider range of merchandise for the business but he doesn't have the money he needs to buy the products that his customers are asking for. He is applying for a loan to make the necessary investment. He plans to repay it with part of the earnings from the business which is also the sole source of income for his family. He has three children who he hopes will eventually adopt professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 40 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, es profesora de manualidades, ya son 3 años que trabaja en el colegio. La socia también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de manualidades para compromisos sociales como matrimonios, bautizos y confirmaciones, ella nos cuenta que hace sus manualidades en su pequeño taller que implemento es su domicilio. La socia forma parte del banco Comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa, desde hace un año, ella requiere el préstamo de los 800 soles, que invertirá en la compra de materiales como detentes. La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
The member is a hard-working, entrepeneurial woman. She is 40 years old, married, has 3 children, and lives in the city of Cusco. She teaches others how to make handicrafts, work that she's been doing for 3 years. She also has a small business selling handicrafts for social events such as marriages, baptisms and confirmations. The member told us that she makes her handicrafts in a small workshop that she set up at home. The member has been a member of the Asociacion Arariwa's Inti community bank for one year. She needs an 800-soles loan that she will use to buy materials such as "detentes" (a patch or emblem of the Cross, often worn over the heart). The member is grateful for the opportunity that she's been given this way and, with that in mind, she is committed to repaying the loan on time. (Inti is a Quechua word that means "sun".)

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for handicraft business.

loans.name: Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es:
LA SRA DONATILA, INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO "SIEMPRE ADELANTE" FORMADO POR 8 PERSONAS RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO D. COMAS, HA SIDO ELEGIDA POR SUS COMPAÑEROS COMO PRESIDENTE DEL GRUPO, EN RECONOCIMIENTO A SU DEDICACIÓN, RESPONSABILIDAD,PUNTUALIDAD Y TRABAJO CON EL GRUPO.
LA SRA. DONATILA TIENE 44 AÑOS D. EDAD, TIENE 2 HIJOS. ELLA SE DEDICA HACE 20 AÑOS A LA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS ALIMENTICIOS QUE TRAE D. PROVINCIA Y  OFRECE A SUS FAMILIARES Y AMIGOS COMO TAMBIÉN A BASE D. UNA LISTA D. PEDIDOS.
CON ÉSTE TRABAJO ELLA HA PODIDO EDUCAR A SUS HIJOS Y APOYAR ECONÓMICAMENTE A SU ESPOSO. APOYARÁ PROXIMAMENTE A SU HIJO MENOR CON LOS GASTOS PARA INGRESAR A UNA UNIVERSIDAD.
LE AGRADARÍA MUCHO EN UN FUTURO CERCANO ESTUDIAR UNA CARRERA PROFESIONAL.
texts.en:
Donatila is a member of the Siempre Adelante group, which is comprised of eight residents of the Comas district. She was elected president of the group by her colleagues in recognition of her dedication, responsibility, punctuality, and work with the group. Donatila is 44 and has two children. She has been selling food products for 20 years. She gets them in Provincia, and she offers them to her relatives and friends. She also sells by orders. By this work she has been able to educate her children and help her husband economically. Soon she will support her youngest child with the costs of enrolling in a university. It would really please him to study for a professional career in the near future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food to sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.es:
La señora Merlinda es una persona joven que se dedicaba a la venta de comida pero dejó esta actividad ya que ella estaba terminado sus estudios de la universidad como odontóloga. Después de dejar la venta de comida compró un minibus y actualmente ella y su esposo, el señor Santos, tienen dos minibuses. Santos maneja uno de los minibuses y el otro trabaja con chofer, de este último Merlinda recibe una renta diara. Ahora los minibuses que ellos tienen trabajan en el Sindicato Simon Bolivar, un sindicato muy importante y reconocido en la ciudad. Merlinda y Santos son personas muy trabajadoras y responsables. El crédito que ellos solicitan es para la reparación del motor y compra de caja de cambios para uno de los minibuses.

Estan muy agradecidos con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Merlinda is a young woman who used to make a living by selling food, but she quit that activity since she was finishing her college studies to be a dental surgeon. After she stopped selling food, she purchased a minibus, and currently she and her husband, Santos, have two minibuses. Santos drives one of the minibuses, and the other is used for chaffeuring, for which Merlinda receives daily rent. Now their minibuses are used in the Sindicato Simon Bolivar, a very important and well known union in the city. Merlinda and Santos are very hardworking and responsible people. The credit that they are requesting is for the repair of the motor and purchase of a gearbox for one of the minibuses. They are very appreciative of Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided to them through this loan grant.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the motor of and purchase a gearbox for their minibus

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es: Maria Virginia tiene 52 años, su actividad económica es panadería ella tiene 5 hijos pero ninguno está a su cargo pues todos trabajan de manera independiente. Por lo que ha sido de mucha pues esto fue lo que hizo necesario para proporcionarle los estudios necesarios. Ella es muy reconocida en su vecindario por la calidad de sus productos y además la atención que a diario ofrece donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como harina, mantequilla, aceite, queso bolsas entre otros productos. Su deseo es que su negocio siga creciendo lo suficiente para mejorar sus condiciones la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Virginia is 52 years old, has five children, and operates a bakery. Her children work independently in order to provide for their own education. Maria is well recognized in her neighborhood for the quality of her products as well as the service that she offers on a daily basis. Her shop carries everything that a housewife needs and she attends to each customer with her charming personality.

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase materials such as flour, butter, oil, cheese, bags, and other products. Her wish is to sufficiently keep her business growing so that she can improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies

loans.name: Rosa Venturana

texts.es: CLIENTE RECURRENTE QUE CANCELO EN FORMA PUNTUAL SU CREDITO SOLICITA UN NUEVO CREDITO PARA CAPITAL  D. TRABAJO CUENTA CON TRES PUESTOS EN LA ASOCIACION D. COMERCIANTES  DEL MERCADO D. LA TINGUIÑA UNO FUNCIONA LA VENTA D. COMIDA, OTRO D. ABARROTES, UNO DEL SERVICIO D. ARREGLO D. CALZADOS, SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA IMPLEMENTAR SU TERCER PUESTO D. LA VENTA D. ABARROTES , CUENTA CON EXPERIENCIA CREDITICIA CON CREDITOS VIGENTES EN LA CMAC 3 CREDITOS EL CUAL PAGA PUNTUALMENTE, Y UNO EN EL SCOTIABANK, EL CUEL FUE INVERTIDO EN  SU NEGOCIO EN MEJORAS DEL LOCAL Y CAPITAL D. TRABAJO, SE PROPONE EL CREDITO POR CONTAR CON BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO D. PAGO.
texts.en:
Rosa is a returning client who paid her previous loan on time. She is requesting a new loan to use as operating capital. She manages three vending posts at the market of La Tinguiña as part of the local merchants’ association: from one she sells food, from another she sells groceries, and the from the third she provides shoe repair services.

The loan she is requesting will be used to keep her grocery stand in operation. She has credit experience since she repaid three existing loans with CMAC on time and another one with ScotiaBank. The proceeds from these loans were invested in capital improvements to her business. She was recommended for this loan because of her excellent loan repayment history.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for her grocery business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama S. is a single parent who has two children. She has no formal education. Ama prepares rice and stew and sells them in Elmina. She has been doing this for some time now. Ama uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase more raw rice, beans and other ingredients to prepare the food that she sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, and other ingredients

loans.name: Yliane

texts.es:
Yliane es soltera, tiene 42 años de edad y vive junto a su madre y hermana en el distrito de Nueva Arica, ubicado a dos horas y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales desde hace más de 20 años, cría cabras para venderlas a los negociantes que visitan la zona constantemente. Este negocio es la fuente más importante de ingreso económico de su hogar por lo que da todo de si para mantenerlo y sacarlo adelante.

Yliane distribuye su tiempo entre el cuidado de los animales que cría y el ayudar a su hermana en el cuidado de los niños que llegan a su casa. Su vivienda funciona como wawa – wasi (guardería de niños ubicada en zonas rurales del país) y todas las tardes ella, su hermana y su madre, les brindan el mejor cuidado y les enseñan con juegos y dinámicas.

Yiliane desea mejorar el ambiente de su vivienda que funciona como wawa-wasi, ya que no tienen piso y el contacto con la tierra puede ser un foco infeccioso para los niños. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en hacer las mejoras necesarias para hacer del wawa-wasi un lugar más seguro.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora, honesta y muy entregada a sus labores. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Yliana is 42 years old, single, and lives with her mother and sister in the District of Nueva Arica, which is located two hours and fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Yliana has been raising animals for more than twenty years. She sells goats to merchants who constantly pass through the area. Her business is the most important source of household income because it provides everything she needs to support her family and move forward.

Yliana divides her time between caring for her animals and helping her sister manage a day care center in their home. Every afternoon, she assists her sister and her mother with providing the best care for the children and engaging them in games and other activities.

Yliana wants to make improvements to her home since it also functions as a day care center. There is no flooring in her house and direct contact with the ground can be a source of infection for the children. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles in order to make the necessary improvements that will make the day care center a safer place.

Yliana is hardworking, honest, and fully engaged in all of her business activities. Her greatest desire is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so that she can improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to the day care center in her home

loans.name: Mujeres Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. SEGUNDINA NELI (A QUIEN APRECIAMOS EN LA FOTOGRAFÍA AL MEDIO DE SUS COMPAÑERAS), TIENE 44 AÑOS, ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 4 HIJOS QUE JUNTO CON SU PAREJA LA APOYAN EN TODAS LAS ACTIVIDADES QUE REALIZA.
ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO "MUJERES SIN FRONTERAS" FORMADO POR 10 PERSONAS QUE VIVEN EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS, Y HA SIDO ELEGIDA POR SUS COMPAÑERAS COMO PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO.
HACE 6 AÑOS INICIÓ SU NEGOCIO DE CABINAS DE INTERNET DE NOMBRE "INTERNET ATLANTIC" UBICADO EN SU DOMICILIO, CON TAN SOLO 4 COMPUTADORAS, CON UN PEQUEÑO AHORRO QUE TENÍA Y UN PRÉSTAMO QUE SE HIZO EN UNA ENTIDAD BANCARIA. HOY EN DÍA HA AMPLIADO SU NEGOCIO, CUENTA CON MAS EQUIPOS DE COMPUTO Y ADEMAS HA IMPLEMENTADO UN LOCUTORIO.
QUIERE AGREGAR A SU NEGOCIO LA VENTA DE BOLSAS PLASTICAS,PARA LO CUAL HA SOLICITADO SU PRÉSTAMO.
TIENE COMO PROXIMA META AMBIENTAR EL TERCER Y CUARTO PISO DE SU CASA PARA OFRECER SERVICIO DE HOSPEDAJE.
texts.en:
Sra. Segundina Neli (who is appears in the photo sitting in the middle of the group) is 44 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is supportive of all of her activities. She is a member of the group “Mujeres Sin Fronteras” (Women Without Borders), which consists of ten people living in the District of Comas. Segundina was elected by her peers to serve as President of the group.

Six years ago, she started an Internet café in her home called “Internet Atlantic”. She only had four computers and used the small amount of her savings and a loan that exhausted her entire credit limit. Today, her business has expanded. She has more computers and also started a call center. Segundina wants to add another business selling plastic bags, which is why she is requesting this loan. Her next goal is to finish the third and fourth floors of her house so that she can offer lodging services.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plastic bags to sell

loans.name: Liliana Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Liliana tiene  49 años de edad, es madre soltera con un hijo de 10 años de edad, actualmente estudiando en primaria. La señora se dedica al negocio de compra-venta de ropa usada, negocio que ejerce de forma ambulante distribuyendo a sus clientes, además de que tiene ropa de exhibición en su casa de habitación. La señora dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 10 años, cabe señalarse ella empezó en este negocio con apenas media paca de ropa usada, sin embargo señala la señora, en aquel tiempo era mucho más la ganancia debido a que no habían tantos negocios de lo mismo. Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de ropa usada, ya que pese a todo, el negocio es rentable y brinda sustento a su familia. El sueño siempre ha sido tener una tienda de venta al por mayor de pacas que ayuden a su familia a mejorar económicamente.
texts.en:
Sra. Liliana is 49 years old and a single mother of a 10 year old child attending elementary school. She manages a business buying and selling used clothing. In addition to being a traveling merchant, Liliana also exhibits her merchandise at her home. She has been in business for ten years and says that she started with just half a bale of used clothing. However, she was able to earn more back then because there were not as many businesses that sold the same types of products. Despite these obstacles, her business is profitable and enables her to support her family. Her dream is to open a sales location where she can sell bales of clothing wholesale and help her family improve financially.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for her clothing business

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee es socia del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Aydee es soltera, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Aydee vende mazamorra de manera ambulatoria en una calle transitada de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días por las tardes.
Aydee necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar y leche.
Los sueños de Aydee son construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Aydee is a member of the Juanito communal bank She is single, 34, and has 2 children. Aydee sells mazamorra (a pudding) as a street vendor on a busy street every afternoon. Aydee needs a loan of 600 soles ($225.00), money that she will use to buy sugar and milk. Her dreams are to build a house and that her children can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and milk

loans.name: Viccia Ester

texts.es:
Viccia Merchán de 56 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo es chofer de un colectivo, con el tiene 3 hijos de 25, 26, 28 años.

Viccia empezó con un puesto de chifles y caramelos afuera de su casa, poco a poco con los ingresos que obtuvo implemento más productos.

Ahora Viccia tiene en su casa tiene su propia tienda, trabaja todos los días desde las 05h00 hasta el anochecer vendiendo azúcar a $0.28 la libra, arroz a $0.35 la libra, aceites a $1.25, bebidas etc. Una de las frecuentes complicaciones que ella tiene son los borrachos de su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, legumbres, arroz para tener más productos para su tienda. En el futuro quiere agrandar el local.
texts.en:
Viccia M., 56, lives on the outskirts of the Ecuadorean city of Guayaquil, in a house with all basic services. Her husband drives a bus and they have 3 children, 25-, 26-, and 28-years old. Viccia started out with a stall, outside her house, selling candy and snacks and, over time, she used the money that she earned to add new products. She now has a store, in her house, where she works every day from 5:00 in the morning to late in the evening. She sells sugar for $0.28 a pound; rice for $0.35 a pound; cooking oil for $1.25, bottled drinks, etc. One of the regular obstacles that she faces is the many drunks in the neighborhood. With the loan, she will buy bottled drinks, vegetables and rice so that she will have more products to sell. In the future, she wants to expand the store.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Martha es casada, tiene 44 años y 10 hijos, Martha junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración D. tejidos artesanales, como pasadizos, fajas, bolsas, sus ventas los realiza a las diferentes tiendas y también venD. en la ciudad D. Lima.
Martha necesita un préstamo D. 400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. lana.
Martha sueña con tener una tienda artesanal en su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Juanito community bank. She is 44 years old, married and has 10 children. Martha makes a living, along with her husband, making and selling hand-maD. textiles: rugs, sashes, bags, etc. She sells the products she makes in Lima and various local stores. Martha needs a 400-soles loan to buy wool. Her dreams are that she can one day have a store of her own in her house and that her children adopt professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool for crafts business.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es:
Isaac es socia del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Isaac es viudo y tiene 70 años, Isaac es empresario radial, tiene una radio, además Isaac es periodista radial,  actividad que realiza todos los días.
Isaac necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de un equipo para la radio.
texts.en:
Isaac is a member of the Juanito community bank. He is 70 years old and a widower. Isaac is a radio entrepeneur. He has a radio set and works as a radio journalist, work that he does every day. Isaac needs a 2000-soles loan to buy radio equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy radio equipment for radio station business.

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
Noemí es socia del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Noemí es soltera, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Noemí vende abarrotes en general y ropa variada, sus ventas los realiza en la feria del Distrito de Tambo a donde viaja semanalmente.
Noemí necesita un préstamo de 200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medias y ropas interiores.
Los sueños de Noemí son tener una tienda estable en Tambo y que su hija de 9 años grabe su primer disco musical.
texts.en:
Noemí is a member of the communal bank Juanito. Noemí is single, 28, with 2 children. She sells general groceries and a variety of clothing in the Tambo District Market that she travels to weekly. Noemí needs a loan of $75 to buy stockings and underclothing. Noemí's dream is to have a permanent stand in Tambo and that her 9-year-old daughter could record her first music album.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of socks and underclothing

loans.name: Martha Luisa

texts.es: La señora Martha tiene 51 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, ya que vive con su familia. La señora tiene un negocio de venta de ropa interior, productos lovable, los cuales distribuye de forma ambulante. La señora dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 10 años, ella inicio viajando a Honduras a traer mercadería, la cual venia a distribuir a Nicaragua a personas conocidas por ella como buenos clientes. Poco a poco fue invirtiendo en cosméticos, hasta tener el capital que posee ahora. Ella actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para satisfacer unos pedidos de clientes, los cuales a la fecha son bastantes sin embargo la señora posee una parte y necesita ajustar el capital para hacer un solo viaje a Panamá, que es donde viaja actualmente. Ella siempre ha soñado con tener una tienda grande que este localizado en el centro para no tener que vender sus productos de forma ambulante, sino que sea un negocio más serio y que brinde mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Señora Martha, 51, is single and without children, still living with her family. She has a business selling underclothing, adorable items that she sells door to door. She started this business 10 years ago, traveling to Honduras to get merchandise that she brought to Nicaragua to distribute to persons she knew to be good clients. Little by little she began investing in cosmetics, until she accumulated the capital she now has. She is requesting a loan in order to fulfill clients' orders, which currently are substantial. She has part of the capital needed and needs to increase it so that she can make a single trip to Panama, where she currently goes to buy. She has always dreamed of having a large shop located in the center of town so that she will no longer have to sell door-to-door--this would be a more serious business that would provide greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw leather material and marketing material

loans.name: Janett

texts.es:
Janett es socia del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Janett es soltera, tiene 32 años y 1 hija, Janett vende ropa a pedido, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, además vende cosméticos por catálogos, la mayoría de sus ventas son al crédito.
Janett necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones y polos.
El sueño de Janett es tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Janett is a member of the communal bank Juanito. She is single, 32, with 1 daughter. She sells clothing by order, things that she presents to friends and family members. She also sells cosmetics from catalogs. The majority of her sales are by credit. Janett needs a loan of $225 to invest in the purchase of pants and polo shirts. Janett's dream is to have her own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pants and shirts

loans.name: Tomas Alberto

texts.es:
Tomas es socia del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Tomas es casada, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, Tomas es técnico relojero, tiene un kiosco en el mercado magdalena en donde brinda sus servicios, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Tomas necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos de reloj.
Los sueños de Tomas son mejorar su negocio e implementar otro negocio.
texts.en:
Tomas is a member of the communal bank Juanito. Tomas is 43, married with 2 children. He is a watch repair technician with a kiosk in the Magdalena market where he provides his services, an activity that he does every day. Tomas needs a loan of $225 to invest in the purchase of watch spare parts. Tomas dreams of increasing his business and of starting another business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of watch spare parts

loans.name: San Andres Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento "SAN ANDRES " es uno del los grupos  màs antiguos D. la agencia , se encuentra en su octavo ciclo., el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco  esta representada por las siguientes socias: 

La Sra. Martha es la lider y fundadora del grupo, tiene el negocio D. venta D. hamburguezas  en la calle Pedro Ceballos en villa Pagador . Esta casada y tiene 1 hija que se encuentra en edad escolar y la Sra Martha corre con todos los gastos del hogar.

Como Tesorera esta la  Sra Silvia ella es viuda  su esposo murio en un accidente D. transito y tiene 6 hijos su negocio es  venta D. empanadas  en la Av. Petrolera ,es una persona muy responsable y puntual, su deseo es ver a sus hijos profesionales ya que ella trabaja duro para dar una  vida mejor a sus hijos.

La secretaria es la Sra Rielmy ella soltera no tiene hijos y  tambien tiene el negocio D. venta D. empanadas  ella es joven muy  activa y responsable.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Andres" is one of the agency's oldest groups, maD. up of responsible and hardworking people. This bank is currently in its eighth loan cycle and is represented by the following members: Martha is the leader and founder of the group. She has a hamburger business on Pedro Ceballos street in the town of Pagador. She is married and has one daughter, who is of school age. Martha takes care of all the domestic expenses. The secretary's name is Silvia. She is a widow whose husband was killed in a traffic accident. She has six children, and for a living she sells empanadas on Petrolera Avenue. Silvia is a very responsible and punctual person, and her desire is to see her children become professionals, since she works really hard to give them a better life. Rielmy is the bank's secretary. She is single with no children, and also has an empanada business. She is young, very active, and responsible. All of the members are appreciative of Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided to them through the grant of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial es socia del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Marcial tiene 60 años y 7 hijos, Marcial junto a su esposa tienen un puesto en el mercado mayorista de frutas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende frutas variadas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Marcial necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de plátano.
Los sueños de Marcial son tener un restaurante en su casa y un hotel en la selva ayacuchana.
texts.en:
Marcial is a member of the communal bank Juanito. He is 60 with 7 children. He and his wife have a stand in the wholesale fruit market in the city of Ayacucho, where they sell various fruits, an activity that they do every day. Marcial needs a loan of $425 to invest in bananas. Marcial's dream is to have a restaurant in his home and a hotel in in the Ayachuchan jungle.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bananas

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza.
Luz es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 1 hijo, Luz tiene una tienda en el centro de la ciudad en donde brinda servicio de fotocopias, ploteos de planos, actividad que realiza con su esposo.
Luz necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papeles.
El sueño de Luz es ampliar y equipar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the communal bank Granito de Mostaza. She is 38 and lives with her spouse and 1 child. She has a shop in the center of the city where she provides photocopying and blueprint-plotting, an activity she shares with her husband. Luz needs a loan of $1050 to invest in the purchase of paper. Her dream is to enlarge and equip her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paper

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza.
Juana es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Juana vende hierbas medicinales, sus ventas los realiza de manera ambulatoria en el mercado F. Vivanco que se encuentra en el centro de la ciudad.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hierbas.
Juana sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank Granito de Mostaza. She is 35 and lives with her spouse and 4 children. She sells medicinal herbs as a street vendor in the F. Vivanco market located in the center of the city. Juana needs a loan of $1050 to invest in the purchase of herbs. Juana dreams that her children will become professionals, and of increasing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of herbs

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 41 años, se dedica a la venta y elaboración de comida ella ofrece los platillos como gallo pinto, cuajada, queso frito, refrescos naturales, empanadas de maduro, pollo frito, carne asada, enchiladas y tacos la buena calidad de sus productos la hacen muy famosa con sus clientes, pues ella cocina delicioso y el ambiente es las afueras de su viviendas pues algunos clientes solo piden comida para llevar y en algunas circunstancias se quedan a comer ahí en su negocio, por lo que dio inicio por cuenta propia no fue fácil pero ella es una persona muy admirable. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y comprar los productos básicos necesarios. Ella sueña en convertir su pequeño negocio en un restaurante.
texts.en:
Rosario, 41, creates and sells meals such as chicken with beans, cottage cheese, fried cheese, natural soft drinks, plantain pastries, fried chicken, roast beef, enchiladas and tacos. The top quality of her products have made her famous with her clients, because her cooking is delicious. The setting is outside her home. Some clients come to order a meal to take out, and sometimes they stay to eat at her business. She says that starting up was not easy for her, but she is an admirable person. This financing is for working capital, to buy the necessary basic products. She dreams of converting her small business into a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es casada, tiene 63 años de edad y tiene 5 hijos ya independizados. Vive junto a su esposo en el anexo La Viña, distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora y cincuenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde que se casó, ella nos explica que tuvo que empezar a trabajar en este negocio debido a que los ingresos que su esposo percibia como trabajador de una empresa agrícola de la zona no eran suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares. Durante todo este tiempo su negocio ha sido de mucha ayuda para sacar adelante a su familia.

Juana cría aves de corral, cerdos y cuyes, para venderlos a los comerciantes que usualmente visitan la zona en donde vive. Eventualmente los vende a sus vecinos.
