Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Juana desea a ampliar su negocio para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. Ella es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y muy entregada a su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una mujer ejemplar.
texts.en:
Juana, 63, is married and has 5 adult children. She lives with her husband in the La Viña annex, Cayaltí district, which is an hour and 50 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has raised barnyard animals since she got married. She explains that she needed to go into this business because the salary her husband earned as a field hand for an agricultural company in the area was insufficient to meet family expenses. Income from her work through these years has been very helpful in getting her family ahead in life. Juana rasies barnyard fowl, pigs and guinea pigs to sell to merchants that visit the area where she lives. Sometimes she sells to her neighbors as well. She wants to increase the number of animals she raises so is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first loan of 500 new soles. Juana wants to improve her quality of life by enlarging her business. She is a hard-working, responsible woman, who is very dedicated to her family. Her neighbors and acquaintances think highly of her and consider her to be an exemplary woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy barnyard fowl.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
Pelagia es socia del Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza.
Pelagia es casada, tiene 41 años y 5 hijos, Pelagia viaja a las ferias en donde compra cereales que comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho, en algunas oportunidades vende panes típicos.
Pelagia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Pelagia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Pelagia, 41, is a member of the Granito de Mostaza (Little Mustard Seed) communal bank. Pelagia is married and has 5 children. She travels to the various markets to buy cereals that she sells in the city of Ayacucho; sometimes she also sells typical bread. Pelagia needs a 1000 sol loan to buy cereals. Pelagia dreams with her children becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Pamela Sandra

texts.es:
La Srta. PAMELA, es una cliente que ingreso a la institucion el 2008, es una cliente que trabaja exclusivamente con la Institucion, de ahí que se lo toma en cuenta para que ingrese al programa Kiva, para cubrir sus nesecidades de estudios, ella se encuentra estudiando y trabajando a la ves es una persona responsable y trabajadora, tambien ayudar con la manutención de sus hermanos menores ya que ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, de su familia es la unica que trabaja, ella corre con todos los gastos del hogar.

El destino del credito sera para la compra de material escolar que le  ayudara para el crecimiento de su actividad, y fortalecimiento en su capital de trabajo.

La Srta. Pamela esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Pamela is a client who joined the institution in 2008 and works exclusively with us. She joined the Kiva program to cover her necessities for her studies. Currently, she is studying and working at the same time. She is a responsible and hardworking person who also helps support her younger brothers, who are of school age. In her family, she is the only one who works and takes care of all of the domestic expenses.. This credit will be used for the purchase of school materials, which will help her grow and strengthen her working capital. Pamela is very appreciative of Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided to her through the grant of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school materials

loans.name: Eudomilia

texts.es:
Eudomilia es socia del Banco Comunal Granito D. Mostaza.
Eudomilia es casada y tiene 65 años, Eudomilia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Eudomilia necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. bebidas, golosinas y arroz.
texts.en:
Eudomilia, 65, is a member of the Granito D. Mostaza (Little Mustard Seed) communal bank. She is married and runs a store in her home where she sells groceries and beverages every day. Eudomilia needs a 2000 sol loan to buy beverages, sweets and rice.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages, sweets and rice.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. is married and has three children. She has received a junior-high education. Efua sells corn, cassava and plantains, and other food in Elmina. She has been running this business for some time now. Her husband is a driver. Efua uses her income to help her husband to pay for school fees and utility bills. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase more cassava and plantains in addition to the corn she sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save and reinvest in her business.

On the table in the picture is a bowl of corn and plantain beside her. She was demonstrating how she measures the corn to her costumers.

loans.use: Efua will use the loan to purchase more cassava and plantains to sell

loans.name: Rosa Alejandrina

texts.es:
La ciudad de Azogues  es la capital de la Provincia del Cañar, se halla localizada en la Hoya del río Paute, goza de un clima templado  por su ubicación  geográfica favoreciendo al cultivo de frutas y verduras, además podemos disfrutar de la belleza del Santuario Franciscano y su arquitectura  colonial  haciéndola una  ciudad  muy hermosa, su gente cordial y  amable acogen al turista nacional y extranjero, además se caracterizan por ser personas  muy luchadoras y firmes para salir adelante y siempre brindarles lo mejor a su familia como nuestras socias.

La señora  Rosa Arévalo es socia del banco comunal Barrio Nuevo, es una persona  muy alegre y por eso mantiene una  amistad muy linda con todas sus amigas y compañeras de su banco,  tiene 45 años de edad  y con su primer compromiso procreo 5 hijos que se encuentran entre 28 y 12 años,  tanto su primera hija q se encuentra fuera del país como la segunda trabajan  y ayudan económicamente para los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hermanos menores;  de su nuevo compromiso concibió un hijo que se encuentra de 7 años, su esposo trabaja  realizando varios oficios como chofer, albañil o el trabajo que le ofrezcan, aún no tienen casa propia  por lo que viven en casa de sus padres.

Rosa es comerciante vende  papas fritas en fundas, helados y muchas golosinas  más, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad, éstos productos los vende en los pueblos que tengan fiestas por cualquier motivo esto es tres veces a la semana  y nos comenta que le va bien y gracias a su trabajo ha logrado salir adelante con su familia. También se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo siendo su compañera Anita quien le incentivo a que forme parte del banco comunal y los prestamos que ha recibido le han servido para la elaboración de sus artesanías, con el nuevo préstamo que reciba va a  comprar mesas, sillas, un congelador para alquilar un local y montarse un bar y además expender sus otros productos y arteanias.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con sus negocios a pesar de todos los obstáculos.
texts.en:
The city of Azogues is the capital of Del Cañar province. It is located at Hoya del Río Paute. It enjoys a temperate climate thanks to its geographic location that is appropriate for fruit and vegetable farming. In addition, one can enjoy the beauty of the Franciscan Sanctuary and its colonial architecture, which make it a very beautiful city. Its residents are cordial and welcoming, receiving tourists from both home and outside the country. The residents are noted for being very hard-working and steadfast in their desire to succeed and provide the best for their families. Among the residents are the following group members: Rosa Arévalo, 45, is a member of the Barrio Nuevo communal bank. She is a very cheerful person and she cultivates a beautiful friendship with all her friends and fellow group members. In her first relationship, she had 5 children, who range in age from 28 to 12 years. Both her oldest daughter, who lives outside the country, and her second daughter work and contribute to pay household expenses and help pay for the educational expenses of their younger siblings. In her new relationship, she has a 7-year-old son. Her husband works at various trades: driver, bricklayer, or whatever other jobs he’s offered. They still don’t have their own home; they share their parents’ home. Rosa sells a variety of items: paper cones of potato chips, ice-cream treats, sweets, etc. She has been in this line of work for 30 years. She sells these products in towns that have fiestas for one reason or another; this happens about three times a week and she tells us that she has done well and has been able, through this work, to get her family ahead in life. She also manufactures handicrafts. This is her third loan cycle; it was her fellow-member, Anita, who motivated her to join the communal bank. The loans she has received have helped her with her crafts-making. The new funds will be used to buy tables, chairs and a freezer and to pay for the lease of a locale to set up a bar. She also wants to sell her other products and her crafts. Her greatest wish is to succeed with her businesses despite all obstacles.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and a freezer.

loans.name: Mariétou

texts.fr: Marétou W. est âgée de 50 ans, elle et mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle fait un petit commerce de poissons fumés, d'huile de palme et de produits halieutiques. Elle vise à améliorer les conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Marétou W. is 50 years old. She is married and the mother of four children whom she cares for. She trades smoked fish, palm oil, and fishing products for a living. She is striving to better the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promotion of commercial activity

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA OLIVIA, INGRESO A LA INSTITUCION EN FECHA  MARZO DEL 2004 CON EL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LAS ABEJITAS. ACTUALMENTE TRABAJA CON CREDITO INDIVIDUAL YA MAS DE 5 SECUENCIAS, POR SU BUEN HISTORIAL CREDITICIO SE LE HACE INGRESAR AL PROGRAMA KIVA, ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA REALIZA SUS PAGOS PUNTUALMENTE  A LA INSTITUCION. ES UNA SEÑORA DEDICADA  A SU FAMILIA Y ADEMAS HACE ESTUDIAR A SUS 3 HIJOS QUE ESTAN EN ESTUDIOS SUPERIORES Y SU DESEO ES VER A SUS HIJOS PROFESIONALES.

LA ACTIVIDAD DE LA SRA. OLIVIA ES LA VENTA DE HELADOS DE CANELA HECHOS MANUAL Y ARTESANALMENTE QUE SON MUY TRADICIONALES EN LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ.

EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO SERA PARA LA COMPRA DE INSUMOS PARA LA ELABORACION DE LOS HELADOS DE CANELA.

LA SRA. OLIVIA ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DLE CREDITO.
texts.en:
Olivia joined our institution in March of 2004 with the solidarity group "Las Abejitas". Currently she is working with individual credit and has gone through more than five loan cycles. Due to her good credit history, she has been able to join the Kiva program. She is a responsible and hardworking person who follows through with her payments to the institution in a punctual manner. She is a woman who is very dedicated to her family and furthermore, she makes her three children study. They are in higher studies, and her desire is to see them become professionals. Olivia's activity is selling hand-made cinnamon ice cream, which is very traditional in the city of La Paz. This credit will be used for the purchase of supplies for making cinnamon ice cream. Olivia is very appreciative of Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided to her through this loan grant.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for making ice cream

loans.name: Juan Carlos Joel

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es un padre de familia de 21 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija de dos meses de nacida en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Nueva Arica, a dos horas y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años trabaja junto a su padre en un pequeño negocio que brinda servicio de televisión por cable en la zona donde vive. El nos comenta que se trabaja en la parte técnica del negocio, instalando redes y manteniéndolas. Estudió computación en un instituto de la ciudad de Lima y se vale de sus conocimientos para trabajar a diario.

Juan Carlos desea hacer mejoras en la construcción del local en donde funciona su negocio, ya que está construido de material rústico, por ello está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio para poder construir su casa propia y ofrecerle a su joven familia una mejor calidad de vida. El es muy conocido en la zona donde vive. Sus vecinos lo consideran un joven honesto y trabajador.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a 21-year-old father, who lives with his wife and two-month-old daughter, in his parents' house, which is located in the Nueva Arica district, two hours and fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last three years he has worked alongside his father in a small business that provides cable TV service to the area where he lives. He tells us that he works in the technical side of the business installing and maintaining networks. He studied computer skills in an institute in Lima and he uses what he learned every day at work. Juan Carlos wants to make some structural improvements to the building where his business is located because it is made from not very sound materials. He is, therefore, asking Edpyme Alternativa for his first, 1000 new sol, loan to reach this goal. His greatest wish is to enlarge the business so that he can build his own house and offer his young family a better quality of life. He is very well-known in his neighborhood. His neighbors consider him to be an honest and hard-working young man.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make some structural improvements to his place of business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer E. is married and has four children. She received a junior-high education. Jennifer operates a grocery store where she sells sugar, Milo (chocolate milk powder), milk powder, rice and other items in Elmina. She has been running this business for some time. Her husband is a mason. Jennifer uses her income to help her husband pay for school fees and utility bills. 

Jennifer will use the loan to buy second hand-clothes in addition to the groceries she already sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, Jennifer plans to save so she can reinvest in her business and improve her capital base.

loans.use: Jennifer will use the loan to buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Gloria Estebana

texts.es: En el municipio de Villanueva la señora. Gloria R. se dedica a laborar como maestra de educación primaria. Ella es madres soltera de dos hijos que mantener y el crédito lo esta solicitando para la compra de materiales para mejorar su vivienda ya que esta en malas condiciones por lo tanto necesita brindarle un techo digno a sus hijos. Con el crédito se beneficia ella y su familia.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Villanueva, Gloria R. works as an elementary school teacher. She is the single mother of two children that she takes care of. The loan is requested for purchasing materials to improve their life since it is in bad condition. Most of all, she needs to give her children a decent roof. With the loan she and her family will benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama D. is married and has four children. She has no formal education. Ama sells okra, garden eggs (eggplant), and other foods in Elmina. She has been running this business for some time now. Her husband is a cleaner. Ama uses her income to help her husband pay school fees and utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase more food items to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save for building a house.

loans.use: Ama will use the loan to purchase more food, such as okra, to sell

loans.name: Theresah

texts.en:
Theresah A. cooks and sells food in Elmina, such as banku and okra stew, and fufu with varieties of soup. Theresah received a junior high education. She is a single parent and has two children. Theresah has been selling cooked food for some time now. She is responsible for paying of school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. 

Theresah will use her loan to buy more cassava, plantains and other goods to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to educate her children.

In the photo, she is preparing a traditional dish called "fufu" (cassava dumplings) . It is one of the nation's favorites.

loans.use: To buy more cassava, plantains and other goods to sell

loans.name: Clavecitos 1 Group

texts.en:
Lucia is the coordinator of her group, which is called "Clavecitos" (the little keys), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial zone where running water is not potable and electricity is unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and her child.

Lucia is excited to be taking her first loan from Esperanza and she is excited to have the opportunity to expand her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her small beauty salon by purchasing hair products such as shampoos, dyes, and rinses. She will use the profits to educate her child. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Hair products

loans.name: Manuel Ignacio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Villanueva en el caserío el jicarito el señor Manuel Ignacio Q. tiene su propio negocio de taller de reparación de mecánica, en donde trabaja arduamente para la manutención de su familia y la mejora de su vivienda.
El crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de laminas de zinc, ya que el techo de la vivienda se encuentra en mal estado y para temporada de invierno se quiere alistar ya que necesita brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su  familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Villanueva in the El Jicarito neighborhood, Mr. Manuel Ignacio Q. has his own car repair shop, where he works very hard in order to maintain his family and improve their home. The loan he is asking for is to buy sheet metal, since his home's roof is in very bad condition. Winter is coming and he wants to get ready so he can provide the best quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheet metal for his roof

loans.name: José Andrés

texts.es:
En el municipio de Villanueva el señor Andrés D. se esfuerzo trabaja  como docente con el fin de llevar el sustento a su hogar y beneficiar a sus 4 hijos que dependen de el en edad escolar.
Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de útiles escolares  para sus hijos  ya que se avecina la época escolar y es de mucha importancia que sus hijos vayan a escuela para ser grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Villanueva, Señor Andrés D. works as a teacher in order to earn a living for his home and to benefit his 4 school-age children who depend on him. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of school supplies for his children, since the school term approaches and it is very important that his children go to school to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies for his children

loans.name: Wuinston Saúl

texts.es: El Sr. Wuinston C. trabaja en la alcaldía municipal tiene un cargo de inspector de las personas que barren las calles y las personas que atienden los viveros de la alcaldía, estudio hasta cuarto año de secundaria y después se dedico a trabajar. El crédito lo solicita para comprar cemento y piedra para empezar a construir su casa ya que el no tiene donde vivir y alquila un cuarto y ahí vive solo los créditos que a tenia con nosotros le han ayudado mucho ya que el primer crédito pudo comprar el lote de terrero y con este otro los materiales, esta divorciado y le tienen una niña de 4años  y se siente muy agradecido con Ceprodel ya que estos financiamiento le han venido a ayudar en su vida ya que asi va a tener un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
Señor Wuinston C. works in the municipal city hall. He has the duty of inspector of the people that sweep the streets and the people that attend the landscaping of the city hall. He completed school through the fourth year of secondary school and then he went to work. The loan that he requests is to buy cement and stone to begin to build his house, since he does not have anywhere to live and rents a room where he lives alone. The previous loans that he has had with us have helped him a lot, since with the first loan he was able to buy the lot and with another the materials. He is divorced and has a girl of 4 years. He feels very grateful to Ceprodel since the financing has been a help in his life and in this way he is going to have a worthy place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement and stone for building his house.

loans.name: Termitas Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal TERMITAS está conformado por 10 clientes, 7 mujeres y tres varones, el 70% D. las socias pertenecen a la Zona D. Villa Copacabana, que están ubicados antes D. llegar a la zona Valle Hermoso  y también por el Hospital San Gabriel, el 30% las socias viven por Escobar Uría, a tres cuadras D. la parada del microbús D. la línea 15. se dedican a la venta D. comida, venta D. ropa, cosméticos, costura D. ropa y otros, pese a tener actividades muy distintas se conocen muy bien entre sí asistieron a todas las charlas y escucharon con atención porque la mayoría ingreso por primera vez a un banco comunal.

La Sra. Lourdes Representa a su banco en  el cargo D. Presidenta del banco se dedica a la costura D. ropa, edredones, cubrecamas, en su propio taller D. la ciudad D. El A. cerca D. la avenida cívica, cuenta con esta actividad hace 10 años, el préstamo será destinado a la compra D. insumos (tela por rollo, esponja, algodón, store). Vive en la zona Escobar Uría con sus familiares, no tiene esposo, es madre soltera y ella sola mantiene el hogar.
 
Ha sido elegida por su gran capacidad D. manejo D. personas y D. conocer a todas sus compañeras, responsable y dinámica desD. el inicio en las capacitaciones brindando su apoyo a todas sus compañeras coordinando en la conformación del banco 

La Sra. Maria Socia que asume el cargo D. Tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta D. comida y refrescos  a pedidos para las instituciones públicas y privadas se dedica a esta actividad hace 5 años en su propio domicilio el préstamo esta destinado a la compra D. víveres por mayor  para sus pedidos. Casada con el señor Javier que trabaja D. Medico General en el hospital Holandés  D. la ciudad D. El A., tiene 2 hijos.
 
El Sr. Hernando, Ha sido elegido como Secretario, por su desenvolvimiento en las relaciones públicas dentro y fuera del grupo, dinámico para la redacción y coordinación, es chofer D. Radio taxi (propietario)en empresa "GOLD" D. la zona Tembladerani, también se dedica al negocio D. alquiler  D. Radios D. Comunicación, el préstamo esta destinado para la compra D. equipos D. Comunicación(radios y otros). Casado con la señora Sidney que es una ama D. casa y atienD. a sus dos hijos menores D. 12 años.

Todos los socios son personas responsables y trabajadoras, el destino del credito lo utilizaran para el incremento D. capital D. trabajo y compra D. mercaderia.

Todos los socios estan agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The communal bank, TERMITAS, is maD. up of 10 clients: 7 women and 3 women. 70% of the members live in the zone of Villa Copacabana, which is located in an area before arriving in the zone of Valle Hermoso and also near the San Gabriel Hospital. The other 30% of the members live around Escobar Uria, three blocks away from the line 15 bus stop. They make a living by selling food, clothing, and cosmetics, and sewing clothing, among other things. Despite performing different activities, they know each other very well and attend all of the meetings, listening with great attention because the majority have joined a communal bank for the first time. Lourdes represents her bank as its president. She makes a living by sewing clothing, comforters, and bedspreads in her own workshop in the city of El A., near Civic Ave. She has been carrying out this activity for 10 years. This loan will be used for the purchase of supplies, such as rolls of fabric, sponges, and cotton. She lives in the zone Escobar Uria with her family. She does not have a husband, is a single mother, and maintains her home by herself. She was elected because of her great capacity for managing people and getting to know all of her partners. Responsible and dynamic since the start of training, she has been providing her support to all of the members that make up the bank. Maria occupies the position of the bank's treasurer. She makes a living by selling food and drinks by request for public and private institutions. She has been doing this activity for 5 years in her own home. This loan will be used for the purchase of wholesale supplies for her orders. She is married to Javier, who works as a primary care physician in the hospital Holandes, in the city of El A.. The couple has two children together. Hernando was elected secretary of the bank for his development in public relations, within and outsiD. of the group. Also, he is dynamic in writing and coordinating. He is the chaffeur of Radio taxi for the company "Gold" in the zone Tembladerani. Additionally, he earns money renting out two-way radios. He will use this loan to purchase communication equipment (radios and others). He is married to Sidney, who is a housewife and takes care of their two 12-year-old children. All of the members are responsible and hardworking people and will use this credit to increase their working capital and for the purchase of merchandise. They are very grateful for Emprender and Kiva, for providing them confidence through this loan grant.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.en:
Tatiana is a 34-year-old mother of four who lives in Goicoechea Canton of San Jose, in the central valley of Costa Rica.
 
This will be Tatiana’s 3rd loan from Fundacion Mujer. In the past, she has maintained an excellent repayment record. The loan consultant that has been working with Tatiana describes her as a hardworking entrepreneur with a fighting spirit. 

Tatiana has a retail business in her community where she sells items such as clothing, household and health products, and facial treatments. After performing her daily domestic tasks, she dedicates six hours to her business from Monday to Saturday. Going door to door, she offers her clients various household products, clothing and cosmetics among other items. This loan will be used as working capital so she can buy clothing and facial treatment products.

Tatiana has been working in sales for the past ten years. In a good month, she can earn 500,000 colones; in a bad month, only 150,000. She says her main obstacle is fluctuations in demand. For example, because the schools open on February 10th, most Costa Rican families are spending money on school supplies for their children, rather than retail products. As a result, Tatiana’s business takes a hit in February.

In the past, Tatiana worked as an administrative assistant while also running her sales business. Recently, she has decided to dedicate all her energy to her business, because it allows for a more flexible schedule. As her own boss, she can allocate the hours of the day she needs for domestic tasks and taking care of her children, while allotting other hours for her sales activities. 

Tatiana hopes to combine her increased investment of time with the money from this loan to increase sales and expand her business. By the end of the year, her goal is to buy a car, which would allow her to expand operations further and facilitate her daily activities. Some of Tatiana’s long term goals are to buy a house and be able to invest in a university education. Tatiana would like to study business administration with a concentration in marketing.

loans.use: For the purchase of retail products.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: El sr, Roberto   M. es trabajador activo de la alcaldía municipal trabaja de conductor, el dinero lo solicita para la terminación de un cuarto, compra de materiales como perlines, zinc, cemento y arena, y si los crédito que Ceprodel me ha financiado me han ayudado mucho ya que he podido cumplir mis metas propuestas y espero que siempre nos estén brindando esta ayuda de financiarnos créditos. Soy casado, padre de 4 hijos ya mayores y una bebita de 4 años. Ya es el segundo crédito con Ceprodel.
texts.en:
Señor Roberto M. is an active worker in the municipal city hall. He works as a conductor. The money he requests is for finishing a room, to purchase materials such as tiles, zinc, cement and sand. The loans that Ceprodel has given him have helped a lot since he has been able to meet his proposed goals and he relies on the availability of this aid to finance loans. He is married and the father of 4 already grown children and a young child of 4 years. This is his second loan with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tiles, zinc, cement and sand for finishing a room in his house.

loans.name: Esperanza En Fe Group

texts.en:
Rafael is the coordinator of his loan group, "Esperanza en Fe" (Hope in Faith). His story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. His group is located in the Samana Peninsula, a rugged, lush area with a nascent tourism industry where running water is not potable and electricity is unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his extended family.

Rafael is excited to be taking his first loan from Esperanza and he is excited by the opportunity to expand his business. He sells tennis shoes, women's shoes and used clothing. He plans to use this loan to buy more merchandise to sell. He will use the profits to make his home more livable and to purchase some animals to raise for food. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Women's shoes, tennis shoes, and clothing

loans.name: La Trinite De Grand Basin Group

texts.en:
“La Trinite de Grand Basin” is comprised of fifteen male and female entrepreneurs. After successfully repaying their first loan, they are looking forward to continued success and growth in their businesses with their second loan. 

Roseline D. is one of three representatives for the group. She is a married woman with 4 children ranging from 9 to 20 years old. This hard-working mom is a long time business person who splits her time between two business activities. She sells unprepared food, including rice, beans, oil, and sugar, in the local marketplace. Then, in the evening, she sells fried foods in the town square. 

She is thankful for the presence of Esperanza in the area because they have allowed many people to get back on their feet. She dreams of being able to build a house with her increased business profits and leave something behind for her children. On behalf of Roseline, La Trinite de Grand Basin, and Esperanza, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil, and vegetables

loans.name: Glendis Ivelia

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Cinco Pinos, Departamento de Chinandega, la señora Glendis P. es propietaria de su propia pulpería donde vende los productos tales como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, aceite entre otros.
Esta solicitando un credito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos tales como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, aceite entre otros, con el propósito de surtir su pulpería para generar ingresos para el bienestar de su familia y seguir adelante con el negocio.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Cinco Pinos, Chinandega Department, Glendis P. owns her own general store, selling products such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, and oil. She requests a loan to invest in buying commodities such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, and oil, to stock her store and generate income for her family’s well being and to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy items such as school supplies, display cases, and grains

loans.name: Perlitas Blancas Group

texts.es:
Banco comunal PERLITAS BLANCAS está formado por 10 personas, pertenecen a la Zona de Pampahasi, que están ubicados alrededor de SAMAPA (empresa de aguas) las socias se dedican a la venta de perfumes, venta de celulares, repostería, venta de comida, atención de licorería, etc. Este grupo de socias ingresa a su segundo ciclo en bancas comunales durante su permanencia demostraron ser personas responsables con sus pagos.

La Sra. Maria Es su segundo ciclo asume el cargo de presidenta del grupo es la líder  y es tambien una de las fundadoras del banco, la señora Maria se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Es una persona casada tiene 3 hijos su esposo trabaja como agente de parada en el sindicato señor de mayo que es una parada de minibuses Tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar.

El destino del credito es para invertir en la compra de mercadería y poder aumentar su mercadería durante el tiempo que trabajo todo préstamo obtenido fue invertido en la compra de mercadería y así poder aumentar su capital.

Durante su permanencia con sus compañeras de grupo demostró ser una persona solidaria con sus compañeras siempre ayudándolas, a seguir adelante con trabajo, muy exigente con sus cuotas,  muy estricta con sus compañeras a la hora de pago.

El Sr. Alan Trabaja actualmente en su segundo ciclo, en este ciclo asume el cargo de secretario del grupo, Alan se dedica a la costura al igual que su mama tiene un taller en su domicilio, como también estudia por las noches, durante su permanencia en el grupo demostró ser responsable con sus pagos al igual que con su compañeras al momento de exigir las cuotas.

Los prestamos obtenidos en nuestra institución fueron invertidos en la compra de materia prima para el taller siendo que por estas fechas tienen mayor pedido. 
Es un socio soltero no tiene hijos su deseo es poder implantar una empresa de costura propia para apoyarle a su mamá.

El Sr. Jheovany Es un socio nuevo que se integra a la banca es invitado por una socia, a participar de las bancas comunales se dedica al manejo de movilidad, el crédito solicitado fue para invertir en la compra de herramientas de trabajo es soltero no tiene hijo su deseo es poder comprar una movilidad para su uso personal y otra para poder trabajar y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Estan muy agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Perlitas Blancas Community Bank is made up of ten people who belong to the Pampahasi zone which is located around SAMAPA (a water company). The members are dedicated to selling perfumes, cell phones, baked goods, food, liquor, etc. This group of members is entering its second cycle as a community bank during which time they have proved to be people who are responsible with their repayments. For Maria, this is her second loan. She fills the roll of group president and is the leader. She is also the bank's founder. Maria is dedicated to selling beauty products. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a minibus union rep. He has two children who are school age. This loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise and used to be able to enhance their merchandise. During the time the loan was made, they invested in the purchase of merchandise and, in this manner, increased their capital. During her tenure with her group colleagues, she has shown to be a person who is united with her colleagues, always helping them to get ahead with their work, successful with their repayments, and strict with her colleagues at payment time. Alan is currently working on his second round (of loans). In this round, he has taken the role of group secretary. Alan is dedicated to tailoring, like his mother, and has a shop in his home. Additionally, he studies at night. During his tenure with the group, he has proven to be responsible with his repayments as well as with his colleagues at repayment time. The loans obtained from our institution were invested in the purchase of raw materials for the shop, since at this time, he has more orders. He is a single member and does not have children. His wish is to be able to start his own tailor company so he may support his mother. Jheovany is a new member who joined after being invited by another member to participate in the community bank. He is dedicated to driving. The loan that he is requesting was to invest in the purchase of tools. He is single and does not have children. His wish is to be able to buy a vehicle for personal use and another for work and to improve his quality of life. They are thankful to Emprender and to Kiva for the confidence provided by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital.

loans.name: La Solución 7 Group

texts.en:
Teresa is the coordinator of her loan group, "La Solucion," (The Solution), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the Samana Peninsula, a rugged, lush penninsula with a nascent tourism industry where running water is not potable and electricity is unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Teresa is excited to be taking her second loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She runs a small cafeteria. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing the ingredients necessary to make toast, empanadas (delicious Dominican-style "Hot Pockets"), soft drinks, and coffee. She will use the profits to buy her children shoes and notebooks, to occasionally take them out to get ice cream, and to add a window to her home. Her long term goal, however, is to move her cafeteria out of her rented home to its own location, and to purchase her own home. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy toast, juice, empanadas, soft drinks and coffee

loans.name: Calixta Eduvis

texts.es:
Calixta Cedeño de 33 años, vive en la casa de sus padres en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.

Calixta trabajaba en una peluquería, pero decidió renunciar para poner su propio salón de belleza con los conocimientos aprendidos. 

Ahora ella trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 23h00 todos los días en su salón de belleza haciendo cortes de cabello, tratamientos, tinturados, etc. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es la delincuencia que hay en el sector del negocio.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar silla peinadora, shampoo y tratamientos para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener ya empleados en su negocio.
texts.en:
Calixta Cedeño is 33 years old, and lives with her parents in the semi-urban area, Paraíso (Guayaquil), where they have basic services. Calixta used to work in a hair salon, but decided to leave, using what she had learned to set up her own beauty salon. She now works in her salon every day from 8 in the morning to 11 in the evening, with hair cuts, hair treatments, coloring, etc. One of the complications in that line of business is delinquent payment. She would use the loan to buy a hairdresser’s chair, shampoo, and hair-treatment products for her business. She would like to have employees for her business in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Salon chair, shampoo, gel

loans.name: Edis Ramón

texts.es:
El señor  Edis V. siempre se ha dedicado ala actividad ganadera por medio de la crianza de vacas las que alimenta, cuida, con el fin de extraer la leche para comercializarla en el municipio de cinco pinos y así obtener los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar.
Está solicitando el crédito para la compra de tres vacas para aumentar el hato y así extraer mas leche para beneficio de su familia que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Edis V. has always worked with livestock, raising cows that he feeds and cares for in order to get milk. He sells the milk in the town of Cinco Pinos and the income he gets goes towards supporting his household. He is asking for this loan in order to buy three cows to increase his herd. This will let him produce more milk and it will benefit his family, who he loves very much.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cows to increase his herd

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA SALOME INGRESO A TRABAJAR CON PRESTAMOS EN NUESTRA INSTITUCION DESDE EL 4 DE FEBRERO DE 2004, TRABAJANDO CON CREDITOS CASI 6 AÑOS. SIENDO LA CLIENTE EXCLUSIVA DE EMPRENDER, QUIEN VIVE EN LA ZONA DE VILLA VICTORIA DE NUESTRA CIUDAD. TIENE COMO NEGOCIO VENTA DE CARNE, UBICADA SU CARNICERIA EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO, ELLA ATIENDE EL NEGOCIO DESDE LAS 7:00 A.M. HASTA 12:00 a.M. YA TIENE UNA ANTIGUEDAD EN EL NEGOCIO DE 15 AÑOS Y MOSTRO MUCHO CRECIMIENTO EN MAQUINARIA. ELLA ESTA MUY FELIZ DE TRABAJAR CON LA INSTITUCION E INGRESAR A NUESTRO PROGRAMA KIVA YA QUE TAMBIEN LE AYUDA A COLABORAR CON LOS ESTUDIOS DE SUS 3 HIJOS MENORES QUE SE ENCUENTRAN ESTUDIANDO Y UNO DE SUS DESEOS ES DE PODER VER A SUS HIJOS PROFESIONALES Y TAMBIEN COMPRARSE UNA CASITA.

ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salome began working with loans from our institution on the 4th of February, 2004. She has worked with loans for the past 6 years. She is the exclusive client of "Emprender" (To Start) and lives in the Villa Victoria zone of our city. She sells meat from a butcher’s shop located within her own home. She works in her business from 7:00am to 12:00am. She has owned the business for 15 years and has shown much growth in machinery. She is very happy to work with the institution and has joined our Kiva program which also helps her contribute to the schooling of her 3 young children. One of her wishes is to be able to see her children become professionals and also to buy herself a little house. She is very grateful to "Emprender" and Kiva for the trust they bring to the awarding of loans.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat

loans.name: La Fe 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Rosaura is the coordinator of her loan group, which is called "La Fe" (The Faith). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the Samana Peninsula, a lush, rugged area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water is not potable and electricity is unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure. She is a single mother with 8 children.

Rosaura is excited to be taking her sixth loan from Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to expand her clothing business by purchasing skirts, shoes and pants to sell to her well-developed clientele, and a sewing machine to do alterations and repairs. She will use the profits to purchase food for her children, and a computer for them to learn on. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Skirts, pants and shoes to sell and a sewing machine

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Somotillo el señor Juan A. se dedica desde ase mucho tiempo a la crianza de ganado con el propósito de obtener los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar.
Es padre de tres hijos a los que tiene que mantener y por esto se esfuerza grandemente.  El crédito lo solicita para la compra de una vaquilla para su crianza para extráele la leche y comercializarla en su local.
texts.en:
In the Somotillo municipality Juan A. has reared cattle for a long time in order to earn income to support his household. He is the father of three children who he has to support and therefore he strives extremely hard. He is asking for a loan to buy a heifer to rear for milk that he can sell at his premises.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a heifer

loans.name: Gerardo Manuel

texts.es:
La ciudad de Azogues  es la capital de la Provincia del Cañar, se halla localizada en la Hoya del río Paute, goza de un clima templado  por su ubicación  geográfica favoreciendo al cultivo de frutas y verduras, además podemos disfrutar de la belleza del Santuario Franciscano y su arquitectura  colonial  haciéndola una  ciudad  muy hermosa, su gente cordial y  amable acogen al turista nacional y extranjero, además se caracterizan por ser personas  muy luchadoras y firmes para salir adelante y siempre brindarles lo mejor a su familia.

El señor  Gerardo V. es socio del banco comunal Barrio Nuevo, vive  con su esposa y su hijo de siete años en el barrio del mismo nombre de su banco, tiene 28 años  no tiene un trabajo fijo por lo que no desaprovecha ninguna oportunidad  de trabajo en el oficio que le soliciten,  su esposa  es comerciante ambulante  vende una gran variedad de productos como papas fritas, helados, etc.,  no tienen casa propia por lo que viven  en casa de sus suegros.

Gerardo tiene gran amistad con todas sus compañeras del banco comunal al ser el único varón del grupo, se encuentra en su segundo ciclo en la institución gracias a  su amiga Anita que le hablo de los beneficios que ofrece ESPOIR, con el préstamo que reciba va a invertir en el negocio de su esposa para que compre papas, helados, etc..

Su meta es superarse cada día más y así brindarle una vida mas digna a su familia.
texts.en:
The city of Azogues is the capital of the Cañar province. It is located in the Paute River basin and enjoys a moderate climate favorable for growing fruits and vegetables. The city is very picturesque, and its citizens enjoy the beauty of the Franciscan Sanctuary and the colonial architecture. Its residents are very kind and welcoming to foreign and local tourists. They are also known to be very hardworking and committed to getting ahead and providing the best for their families. Gerardo V. is a member of the Barrio Nuevo Communal Bank and lives with his wife and seven-year-old son in the Barrio Nuevo neighborhood. He is 28 years old and although he does not have fixed employment he never passes up the opportunity to perform whatever job he is offered. His wife is a street vendor selling a variety of items, including french fries and ice cream. They live in his wife's parents home as they do not have their own house. Gerardo is the only man in his communal bank and has a very good relationship with all of the other members. This is his second loan cycle and he is grateful to his friend Anita who introduced him to the benefits offered by ESPOIR. He will invest this loan in the purchase of supplies for his wife's business, including potatoes, ice cream, and other items. His goal is to get ahead a little more every day and thereby provide a more decent life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase french fries and ice cream

loans.name: Juan Santiago

texts.es:
El sr. Juanito es un cliente muy antiguo de la institución, trabaja con nosotros desde el año 2005, y es cliente exclusivo de Emprender. Se dedica al lavado de arena y piedra, en su terreno ubicado en la comunidad de Chinchaya, de la ciudad de La Paz, de ahí saca arena corriente, arena fina, piedra bruta y piedra manzana, que van a recoger los camiones para llevarlos a las construcciones. Vive en la misma comunidad en su casita que está a la orilla del río, con su esposa que se dedica a las labores de la casa, y en ocasiones le ayuda a sacar las piedras. Sus hijos ya son mayores y son independientes, pero siempre están con ellos. 

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de carretillas y palas, y además comprará una cañería para la bomba de agua que le ayuda a lavar la arena.

Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mr. Juanito is a longtime client of the institution and has been working with us since the year 2005. He is the exclusive client of “Emprender” (To Start). For a living, he washes sand and rock obtained from his land located in the community of Chinchaya near the city of La Paz. From this land he takes out fine sand, coarse rocks and other rocks that are transported by truck to construction sites. He lives in the community in his small house on the riverbank with his wife who is a homemaker and occasionally helps him obtain rocks. His sons are grownup and independent but he is always with them. The loan that he is soliciting will be used to buy wheelbarrows and shovels and also to buy a hose for the water pump that helps him wash the sand. He is very grateful to “Emprender” and to Kiva for the trust they place in him by extending credit.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Edwin William

texts.es:
En el municipio de somotillo el señor Edwin R., es propietario de su propia pulpería que atiende todos los días con el fin de obtener los ingresos para el sostén de su hogar.
Esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los productos tales como granos básicos, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite y abarrotería en general con el fin de comercializarlos en su pulpería y así mantener a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Edwin R. is the owner of a small grocery store in the city of Somotillo. He works hard seven days a week to earn enough money to sustain his family. He is requesting a loan to purchase items such as staple grains, rice, beans, sugar, oil, and general merchandise to sell in his shop and thereby take care of his small son.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple grains and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Popsicle sticks, fruit

loans.name: Confianza Group

texts.es:
Banco comunal CONFIANZA está formado por 10 personas, pertenecen a la Zona D. KUPINI, que están ubicados en kupini Central las socias se dedican a la venta D. perfumes, trabajos en tejidos a mano, venta D. comida, venta D. papa, venta D. perfumes, venta D. material escolar, etc. Este grupo D. socias ingresa a su 11 avo. Ciclo con la reestructuración del 40% quedando un 60 % D. socias fundadoras. 

La Sra. Maria  Es su tercer ciclo en este ciclo asume el cargo D. presidenta del grupo es la líder y representante D. la banca, es una socia estricta a la hora D. pago D. cuotas con sus compañeras, este es su 4to ciclo se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos. 
Es una mujer casada tiene 2 hijos su esposo trabaja como empleado en la superintendencia D. pensiones. 
 
Los créditos obtenidos durante su permanencia fueron para invertir en la compra D. materia prima para la confección D. polleras, siendo una actividad que le solventa a su familia y le apoya a su esposo para poder seguir mejorando su calidad D. vida económica.

Durante su permanencia con sus compañeras D. grupo demostró ser una persona solidaria con sus compañeras siempre ayudándolas, a seguir adelante con trabajo, muy exigente con sus cuotas,  muy estricta con sus compañeras a la hora D. pago.

La Sra. Silveria Es una D. las fundadoras del banco asume el cargo D. tesorera, Es una socia alegre dinámica siempre manteniendo la alegría en su banca haciendo gozar a sus compañeras, responsable con sus cuotas, exigente con sus compañeras.

La socia se dedica a la venta D. dulces refrescos y variedad D. dulces, en su puesto D. venta que se ubica al frente D. un colegio, también aprovecha su tiempo realizando tejidos a mano, tiene 1 hija.
El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería para su puesto D. venta, siendo que ya se capitalizo con el anterior, sus deseo es poder comprarse una movilidad para trasladar su mercadería.

La Sra. Juana  En este ciclo asume el cargo D. tesorera del banco, Es una socia que se dedica a la venta D. vajilla D. porcelana como también, tiene una tienda D. barrio, durante su permanencia demostró responsabilidad siendo que su mamita se encuentra delicada D. salud es por eso que se esfuerza para seguir adelante.

Es una socia soltera, ya trabajo tres ciclos con nuestra institución, durante su permanencia aprendió a ser responsable, y comunicativa con sus compañeras, con el grupo gracias a su mama que  trabajo anteriormente con nuestra institución.
Su deseo es poder aumentar su capital D. trabajo y poder comprase una casa


Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Confianza Community Bank is maD. up of 10 members from the Kupini Zone which is located in Kupini Central. The members earn a living by selling perfumes, creating handmaD. weavings, selling food, selling potatoes, selling school supplies etc. This group of members is entering their 11th lending cycle with a 40% restructuring resulting in 60% of founding members remaining. Mrs. Maria: This is her third loan in this cycle and she has assumed responsibility as president of the group. She is the leader and the representative of the bank. She is a member who is very strict on timely repayment of her groups’ loans. This is her fourth cycle dedicated to cosmetic sales. She is a married woman with 2 children. Her husband works as a superintendant of pensions. The loans obtained previously were used to buy basic materials to make skirts. This activity helps pay her family’s debts and helps her husband continue to better their economic quality of life. Throughout her term with her group, she has demonstrated she is a team-player and always helps out in order to advance in the group’s work. She is very demanding with their repayments and very strict with her companions at the time of repayment. Mrs. Silveria: She is one of the bank’s founders and treasurer. She is a cheerful, dynamic member who maintains the joy in the group and takes delight in her companions. She is responsible for their repayments and strict with her companions. This member sells sweet drinks and a variety of desserts from her stall which is located in front of a school. She also spends time creating handmaD. weavings. She has one daughter. Her previous loan was used to buy groceries for her stall. Now that she has capitalized on that, her dream is to be able to purchase something to transport her groceries. Mrs. Juana: In this cycle she has assumed responsibility as treasurer of the bank. She is a member who earns a living selling chinaware. In addition, she has a neighborhood store. During her term, she has demonstrated responsibility. Her mother is in delicate health and for this reason she strives to progress. She is a single member and has now worked three cycles with our institution. During her term she has learned to be responsible and communicate with her companions. She is with the group thanks to her mother who used to work with our institution. Her dream is to be able to augment her working capital and to be able to buy a house. All the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in them by extending credit.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To augment working capital

loans.name: Irma Gudelia

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes está integrado  por un grupo de mujeres luchadoras que están dispuestas a salir adelante en su trabajo y vida cotidiana para entregarles un mejor porvenir a sus familias,  todas viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, urbe  hermosa por su cultura,  arquitectura, su gente, tradiciones  y su rica gastronomía.

Irma M. tiene 33 años  es socia del banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes,  vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca con sus  hijas  de 14, 11 y 3 años y su esposo  que trabaja como chofer de un camión en una ferretería, la casa en la que viven es arrendada.

Nuestra socia dedica  a la venta de confites y frutas a las afueras de una escuela y colegio lleva seis años realizando esta actividad teniendo días buenos y malos para  la venta pero siempre agradece a Dios,  por otro lado los fines de semana vende salchipapas en  cualquier localidad que haya fiestas o programas.

Irma  se encuentra  dos  años trabajando con los prestamos de la fundación  y éstos le  ayudaron a cancelar los gastos de una operación de  apéndice que le realizaron, ahora con el nuevo préstamo va a  comprar  caramelos, chupetes, papas en fundas, mangos y los ingredientes para la elaboración de espumilla.

Su sueño es llegar  a tener su casa propia
texts.en:
The “Nuevos Horizontes” (“New Horizons”) Communal Bank is made up of very hardworking women committed to getting ahead and providing a better future for their families. They all live in the city of Cuenca, a beautiful city known for its culture, architecture, traditions, and food. Irma M. is 33 years old and a member of Nuevos Horizontes. She lives in Cuenca with her husband and her three children, ages 14, 11, and 3. Her husband is a truck driver for a hardware store and they rent their home. For six years, Irma has sold sweets and fruit outside of a school. She has good days and bad days with her business, but she is always grateful to God. During the weekends she sells “salchipapas” (hot dogs and french fries) wherever there are parties or other public activities. Irma has worked with the Foundation for two years and previous loans helped her repay the expense of an appendectomy. She will use the current loan to purchase candy, lollipops, french fries, mangoes, and ingredients to make meringue. Her dream is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, lollipops, french fries, mangoes, and ingredients to make meringue

loans.name: Willian Hernán

texts.es:
Willian Hernán G.  tiene 18 años, vive en unión libre,  no tiene   hijos.  Viven en el recinto Santa Deriana Parroquia San Jose del Tambo perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “Juntos Venceremos”.  La misma que esta conformada por 11 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.
Willian  trabaja en la agricultura como actividad económica para ayudar a su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son la naranja, maíz,  cacao, yuca y verde. También  Willian  se dedica a la crianza de animales en pequeña cantidad. Para el consumo propio.
Willian solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de los cultivos.  Su meta es construir una casa de cemento armado.  Los desafíos que enfrenta  es de que hay muchas enfermedades de la familia y existe  plagas a los cultivos, por lo que gasta mucho dinero en insecticidas y pesticidas para el cuidado de sus productos.
En su tiempo libre, Willian  le gusta  jugar, escuchar música, pensar en el futuro para sus hijos que vengan.
texts.en:
Willian Hernán G. is 18 year old, lives with his partner, and does not have any children. He lives in the Santa Deriana development in the San Jose del Tambo district, Chillanes county, Bolívar province. He is a member of the “Juntos Venceremos” (“Together We Win”) Communal Bank. The bank has eleven members, most of who work in agriculture and cattle ranching. Willian is a farmer working to support his family. The crops that are most successful in his region are oranges, corn, cacao, yuca, and greens. Willian also raises a few animals for his family's consumption. Willian is requesting a loan for the maintenance of his crops. His goal is to build a reinforced concrete house. He faces such difficulties as illnesses in the family and pests in his fields. He ends up spending a lot of money on insecticides and pesticides to take care of his crops. In his spare time, Willian likes to play, listen to music, and dream of the lives of his future children.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crop maintenance

loans.name: Angel Marcelo

texts.es:
Angel Marcelo C. tiene 26 años, es soltero,  no tiene   hijos.  Viven en el recinto Santa Deriana Parroquia San Jose del Tambo perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “Juntos Venceremos”.  La misma que esta conformada por 11 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.
Angel  trabaja en la agricultura desde hace algunos años como actividad económica para ayudar a su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son la naranja, maíz,  cacao, yuca y verde. También Angel se dedica a la crianza de animales en pequeña cantidad.
Angel  solicita el crédito para incrementar sus sembrios.  Su meta es con el tiempo dedicarse al negocio de ganado.  Los desafíos que enfrenta  en la zona son las permanentes plagas a los cultivos, por lo que gasta mucho dinero en insecticidas y pesticidas para el cuidado de sus productos.
En su tiempo libre, Angel le gusta el deporte, escuchar música, ayudar en los quehaceres de la casa a su mama.
texts.en:
Angel Marcelo C. is 26 years old, single, and does not have children. He lives in the Santa Deriana precinct, Parish of San Jose San Jose del Tambo, belonging to the Chillanes Canton, Province of Bolívar. He is a member of the rural solidarity group, “Juntos Venceremos” (Together We Will Conquer). This group consists of 11 members, the majority dedicated to agriculture and stockbreeding. Angel has worked in agriculture for some years as a means of helping his family economically. This region excels in the cultivation of oranges, corn, cocoa, yucca and vegetables. Angel also breeds a small quantity of animals. Angel requests the loan to increase his sown land. In the future, his goal is to devote more time to the cattle business. In this region, he faces the challenge of ongoing infestations to his crops, requiring spending large sums on insecticides and pesticides to control them. In his free time, Angel enjoys sports, listening to music, and helping with chores at his mother’s home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sown land

loans.name: Bolivia

texts.es:
Bolivia P. A. tiene 46 años, es casada,  tiene  3 hijos que se llaman Boris de 21, Klever de 16  y Shirley de 12 años.  Viven en el recinto Santa Deriana Parroquia San Jose del Tambo perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “Juntos Venceremos”.  La misma que esta conformada por 11 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.
Bolivia trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son la naranja, maíz,  cacao, yuca y verde.   Vende los productos los días viernes, sábados y domingos en Bucay.
Celinda solicita el crédito para comprar un terreno y seguir incrementando sus sembrios.  Su meta es  construir una casa de cemento armado y que sus hijos sigan adelante con sus estudios.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son las permanentes plagas a los cultivos, por lo que gasta mucho dinero en insecticidas y pesticidas para el cuidado de sus productos.
La zona donde viven es  subtropico con diferentes variedades de productos. Bolivia en sus tiempos libres le gusta estudiar la Biblia y ayuda también a la comunidad a organizar algunos eventos.
texts.en:
Bolivia P. A. is 46, married, and has three children. Boris is 21, Klever is 16, and Shirley is 12. They live in the Santa Deriana precinct, Parish of San Jose del Tambo, which belongs to the Chillanes Canton, Province of Bolívar. She is a member of the Junto Venceremos Communal Bank, which is comprised of 11 members. Most of them are devoted to agriculture and livestock. Bolivia has worked in agriculture all of her life. It is the main source of income for her family. The crops that stand out the most in the region are oranges, corn, cocoa, yucca, and vegetables. She sells her products on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays in Bucay. Bolivia is asking for a loan to buy a piece of land and keep increasing her crops. Her goal is to build house of reinforced concrete and that her children continue on with their education. The challenge that she faces is the persistent pests in the fields. She spends lots of money on insecticides and pesticides to take care of her products. The area where she lives is subtropical and has a variety of different products. In her free time Bolivia likes to study the Bible. She also helps organize events in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a piece of land and keep increasing her crops

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es:
Luis Armando P. A. tiene 35 años y vive en la comunidad de Santa Deriana de la provincia Los Rios.  Su estado civil es union libre y vive con su compromiso y dos de sus tres hijos.  Sus tres hijos se llaman Evangelina, Jose y Angela.

El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Juntos Venceremos Comunidad" la cual está ubicada en la comunidad de Santa Deriana perteneciente al cantón Chillanes.  La mayoría de los socios cultivan arroz, maíz, naranja, y cacao en el clima subtrópico como la principal fuente de ingresos.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura y cultivos casi toda la vida.  Crece cacao, naranja, maiz, y yuca.  También se dedica a la crianza de animales como ganado, patos, y gallinas.  Sus ventas las realiza en la Parroquia Matilde y hace las compras de sus productos en el cantón Bucay.  Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de dos cabezas de ganado.

Luis tiene muchos sueños y metas en la vida, unos de ellos son construir su casa de cemento armado y darles la educación a sus hijos.  En sus tiempos libres, le gusta hacer deporte y salir de paseo.
texts.en:
Luis Armando P. A. is 35 years old and lives in the Santa Deriana community in the Los Rios province. He is in a common law marriage, and he lives with his life partner and two of their three children. His children are Evangelina, Jose, and Angela. He is a member of the Juntos Venceremos communal bank. It is located in the Santa Deriana community, which belongs to the Chillanes canton. Most of the members grow rice, corn, oranges, and cocoa in its subtropical climate. It is their main source of income. Luis has devoted himself to agriculture and crops almost his whole life. He grows cocoa, oranges, corn, and yucca. He also raises animals like cattle, ducks, and hens. He sells in the Matilde parish, and he buys products in the Bucay canton. He is asking for the loan to buy two head of cattle. Luis has a lot of dreams and goals in his life. One of them is to build a house from reinforced cement and to give his children an education. In his free time he likes to play sports and go for walks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two head of cattle

loans.name: Alexandra Lourdes

texts.es:
Alexandra Lourdes C. S. tiene 33 años de edad y su estado civil es union libre.  Vive con su compromiso y uno de sus hijos, Alexandra de 16 años.

El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Juntos Venceremos Comunidad" la cual está ubicada en la comunidad de Santa Deriana perteneciente al cantón Chillanes.  La mayoría de los socios cultivan arroz, maíz, naranja, y cacao en el clima subtrópico como la principal fuente de ingresos.

Alexandra se dedica a la agricultura y siembra cacao, maiz, verdes, naranja, y yuca. Asimismo crece animales domesticos como chanchos y gallinas.  A veces el desafío de trabajar en trabajar en la agricultura es el hongo y la lancha que afectan los cultivos de cacao.  Hace las ventas y las compras de quimicos en el canton de Bucay. Solicita el crédito para la compra de terreno para la agricultura.  Su meta es tener su casa propia y educar a sus hijos para que sean todos unos profesionales.

En sus ratos libres le gusta mucho leer y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Alexandra Lourdes C. Silvia is 33 and in a common law marriage. She lives with her life partner and one of her children, 16 year old Alexandra. She is a member of the Juntos Venceremos Communidad communal bank. It is located in the Santa Deriana community, which belongs to the Chillanes canton. Most of the members grow rice, corn, oranges, and cocoa in its subtropical climate. It is their main source of income. Alexandra devotes herself to agriculture, and she plants cocoa, corn, vegetables, oranges, and yucca. She also raises domestic animals like pigs and hens. Sometimes the challenge of working in agriculture is the fungi that affect the cocoa crops. She makes her sales and purchases of chemicals in the Bucay canton. She is asking for a loan to buy a piece of land for agriculture. Her goal is to have her own house and to educate her children so that they will all become professionals. In her free time she likes to read and play sports.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a piece of land for agriculture

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 59 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos. Norma tiene un pequeño negocio D. crianza D. pollos actualmente tiene 500 pollos, ella nos cuenta que compra pollos pequeños para hacerlos crecer y después venderlos. 
Norma forma parte del banco Comunal “Inti” D. la Asociación Arariwa, ella requiere el préstamo D. los 1000 soles, que invertirá en la compra D. alimentos  y vitaminas para los pollos. Norma se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
Norma is an entreprenurial and hardworking woman. She lives in the city of Cuzco. She is 59 years old, married, and has three children. Norma has a little business raising chickens. Right now she has 500 chickens. She tells us that she buys small chickens and raises them to later sell them. Norma is a member of the communal bank "Inti" of the Asociacion Arariwa. She needs the loan of 1000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of feed and vitamins for the chickens. Norma is grateful for the opportunity offered this way and she is commited to making the payments according to the schedule. ("Inti" is a word from the Quechua language which translated to Spanish means "Sol")

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Norma needs the loan to purchase feed and vitamins for the chickens.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena Z. O. tiene 32 años y vive con su compromiso y 5 hijos de 4 años a 14 años.

El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Juntos Venceremos Comunidad" la cual está ubicada en la comunidad de Santa Deriana perteneciente al cantón Chillanes.  La mayoría de los socios cultivan arroz, maíz, naranja, y cacao en el clima subtrópico como la principal fuente de ingresos.

Crece animales para incrementar la economía de su familia. Actualmente tiene 5 puerco y 10 gallinas.  Hace las compras de los animales de un mes en la ciudad de Bucay, crece los animales, y los vende cuando se gordan y se crecen.  La crianza de chanchos es una profesión dura.  La limpieza diaria y la mantención le absorben mucho tiempo.  Solicita el crédito para alimentación de los chanchos.

Desea construir una casita para los chanchos y aumentar la cantidad de chanchos que tiene para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Cuando no está trabajando, le gusta colaborar y participar en las actividades en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Elena Z. O. is 32 years old. She lives with her life partner and her five children, who are from 4 years old to 14 years old. She is a member of the Juntos Venceremos Communidad communal bank. It is located in the Santa Deriana community, which belongs to the Chillanes canton. Most of the members grow rice, corn, oranges, and cocoa in its subtropical climate. It is their main source of income. She raises animals to increase the family income. She currently has five pigs and ten hens. She buys the animals in the city of Bucay when they are one month old. She raises the animals and sells them when they are fattened and grown. Raising pigs is a hard job. The daily cleaning and maintenance takes a lot of time. She is asking for the loan for food for the pigs. She wants to build a small house for the pigs and increase the quantity of pigs that she has. She wants to do this in order improve the family’s quality of life. When she is not working she like to collaborate on and participate in the community activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food for pigs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria I. R. tiene 58 años de edad y vive con unos compañeros, su esposo y nieta.  Tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya son adultos.

El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Juntos Venceremos Comunidad" la cual está ubicada en la comunidad de Santa Deriana perteneciente al cantón Chillanes.  La mayoría de los socios cultivan arroz, maíz, naranja, y cacao en el clima subtrópico como la principal fuente de ingresos.

Gloria es agricultora y crece naranjas, cacao, plátano, y café.  Asimiso se dedica a la crianza de animales.  Tiene cuyes, gallinas, patos, y pavos para consumir y vender.  Compra y vende sus productos en las ciudades de Matilde y Bucay los fI. de semana.  Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas y comprar materiales para una secadora y hacer un baño en su casa.

Desea construir su casita propia pero todavía no alcanza.  Podría hacerlo cuando haga plata y salgan más cultivos.

Cuenta que vive en una comunidad muy unida y le gusta ver los partidos de volei en la comunidad y ver los programas en la tele.
texts.en:
Gloria I. R. is 58. She lives with some friends, her husband, and her granddaughter. She has six children, who are now adults. She is a member of the Juntos Venceremos Communidad communal bank. It is located in the Santa Deriana community, which belongs to the Chillanes canton. Most of the members grow rice, corn, oranges, and cocoa in its subtropical climate. It is their main source of income. Gloria is a farmer, and she grows oranges, cocoa, bananas, and coffee. She also raises animals. She has guinea pigs, hens, ducks, and turkeys to consume and to sell. She buys and sells her products on the week ends in the cities of Matilde and Bucay. She is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies, to buy materials for a dryer, and to make a bathroom in her house. She wishes to build her own house, but she cannot do that yet. She could do that when she makes money and has more crops. She says that she lives in a very united community. She likes to see the volleyball games in the community and watching television.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy farming supplies and materials to improve her house

loans.name: Maria Doroliza

texts.es:
Maria Doroliza C. tiene 36 años de edad, su estado civil es union libre, y vive con sus 6 hijos.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Juntos Venceremos Comunidad" la cual está ubicada en la comunidad de Santa Deriana perteneciente al cantón Chillanes.  La mayoría de los socios cultivan arroz, maíz, naranja, y cacao en el clima subtrópico como la principal fuente de ingresos.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura desde hace casi toda la vida.  Siembra yuca, cacao, maiz, verde, naranja.  Enfrenta mucho desafíos en trabajar en la agricultura, uno de ellos es el hongo que a veces afecta a los cultivos de cacao.  También se dedica a la crianza de animales domesticos como gallinas, patos, y chanchos.  Realiza las ventas de sus productos en la parroquia Matilde.  Solicita el crédito para invertir en la siembra de cacao.

Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y darles a todos sus hijos el estudio para que sean todos unos profesionales.  Cuando no está trabajando, le gusta ir de visita a la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Maria Doroliza C., 36, is in a common law marriage and lives with her six children. She is a member of the Juntos Venceremos Communidad communal bank. It is located in the Santa Deriana community, which belongs to the Chillanes canton. Most of the members grow rice, corn, oranges, and cocoa in its subtropical climate. It is their main source of income. Maria has devoted herself to agriculture for almost her entire life. She plants yucca, cocoa, corn, vegetables, and oranges. She faces many challenges in her agricultural work. One of them is the fungus that sometimes affects the cocoa crops. She also raises domestic animals like hens, ducks, and pigs. She sells her products in the Matilde parish. She is asking for the loan to invest in planting cocoa. Her dream is to improve her home and give all of her children an education so that they will become professionals. When she is not working she likes to go to her parents’ house to visit.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in planting cocoa

loans.name: Angela Ramona

texts.es: Ángela Ramona tiene 69 años de edad, su actividad económica es la elaboración y venta de comida. Hace más de 5 años en  donde poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, y nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas, hoy ya es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes, por la rica sazón que le pone a sus comidas. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y a través de los tiempos ha mejorado cada día sus ingresos para mantener a sus 2 hijos que son muy importantes para ella. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado en la compra de carnes, verduras, maduro, granos básicos, queso entre otros productos. Su deseo es mantener siempre su negocio activo.
texts.en:
Ángela Ramona, 69, makes and sells food. It has been over five years since she gained experience, little by little, in this type of work. She tells us that her sales are going very well. She is now very well known, and she is well-liked by her customers for the delicious seasoning she adds to her food. She is a very enterprising woman. Everyday she has improved her income to support her two children, who are very important to her.
