The loan is for working capital to buy meat, vegetables, basic grains, and cheese, among other products. Her wish is to always keep her business active.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Nieves

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes está integrado  por un grupo de mujeres luchadoras que están dispuestas a salir adelante en su trabajo y vida cotidiana para entregarles un mejor porvenir a sus familias,  todas viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, urbe  hermosa por su cultura, arquitectura, tradiciones,  su gente  y su rica gastronomía.

 María V. es socia del banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes hace tres  años, con éstos   ha incrementado poco a poco  su negocio pues ella  se dedica a la agricultura cultiva legumbres, hortalizas desde  las 8 a.m. hasta las 12 p.m., también cría  pollos, cuyes y tiene una vaca pero la leche es para el consumo de su hogar o a veces vende a sus amigas en la  comunidad y lo poco que cultiva lo vende en la feria libre (mercado de Cuenca).

Nuestra socia vive en la parroquia Sayausi en el barrio Ramales, tiene 46 años de edad y se encuentra divorciada hace 20 años por infidelidad de su esposo, con él concibió cinco hijos que se encuentran  entre  27 y 20 años de edad,  sus hijos  primero y último trabajan  y le ayudan  con los gastos del hogar mientras que las tres hijas ya son casadas y viven independientes,  de su otra relación tiene dos hijos que ahora tienen 11 y 8 años de edad, con sus cuatro hijos viven en su casa propia.

Con el préstamo que recibirá de la institución  va a comprar abono para sus tierras y potreros para cultivar otros productos para la venta y el consumo familiar.

 su sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Horizontes (New Horizons) Communal Bank is made up of a group of feisty women who are determined to be successful in their work and their daily lives in order to obtain a better future for their families. They all live in the beautiful city of Cuenca, known for its culture, architecture, traditions, people and rich gastronomic delights. María V. has been a member of the Nuevos Horizontes Communal Bank for three years. Little by little she has grown her agricultural business cultivating vegetables, farming from 8am until 12pm. She also raises chickens, guinea pigs and she has one cow whose milk is for household consumption, although, occasionally she sells it to her friends in the community. She sells what little she grows in the Cuenca’s marketplace. Our member lives in the parish of Sayausi in the Ramales neighborhood. She is 46 years old and has been divorced for the past 20 years due to the infidelity of her husband. With him she has 5 children between the ages 20 and 27 years old. Her oldest and youngest children work and help her with the household costs. The other three children are married and live independently. From her other relationship, she has two children who are currently 11 and 8 years old. She lives with her four children in her own house. With the loan that she will receive from the institution, she will buy fertilizer for her fields and pastures in order to grow more produce to sell and for her family to eat. Her dream is to stay healthy in order to continue to work.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her fields and pastures

loans.name: Segundo Roberto

texts.es:
Segundo Roberto C. G. tiene 28 años de edad y vive con su esposa y dos hijos que se llaman Tatiana de 2 años y Anthony de un año.

El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Juntos Venceremos Comunidad" la cual está ubicada en la comunidad de Santa Deriana perteneciente al cantón Chillanes.  La mayoría de los socios cultivan arroz, maíz, naranja, y cacao en el clima subtrópico como la principal fuente de ingresos.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura desde que era muy joven y siembra los cultivos de cacao, yuca, y maíz.  Vende las cosechas en Matilde y compra los insumos agrícolas en Bucay como abonos para el cacao, maiz y yuca.  También se dedica a la crianza de chanchos y los vende en su propio domicilio. Solicita el préstamo para comprar el cacao.

En en futuro, piensa hacer su propia casa cuando haga plata y aumenten sus cultivos.  En su trabajo, se tiene que gastar liquidos para luchar a las enfermedades en la plantas como hongos y lanchas.

Le gusta salir al deporte, escuchar música, ayudar en la casa, y ver películas en las tardes en sus tiempos libres.
texts.en:
Segundo Roberto C. G. is 28 years old and lives with his wife and two children, Tatiana who is 2 years old and Anthony who is 1 year old. He is a member of the Juntos Venceremos Comunidad (Together We Will Overcome) Rural Bank which is situated in the community of Santa Deriana, part of the Chillanes territory. As the principle source of income, the majority of the members cultivate rice, corn, oranges and cocoa in the subtropical climate. Segundo has worked in agriculture since he was very young and grows cocoa, rice and yucca. He also raises pigs and sells them from his home. He is soliciting the loan in order to buy cocoa. In the future, when he has money, he hopes to have his own home and expand his farming. He needs to spend money on chemicals to fight plant diseases such as fungus and insects. In his spare time, he enjoys sports, listening to music, helping around the house and watching movies in the afternoon.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cocoa

loans.name: María Alicia

texts.es:
María Alicia tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos dependientes. Vive junto a su familia en el caserío Huaca de Barro del distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Al igual que la mayoría de mujeres de la zona, María Alicia recurre al negocio de crianza y venta de animales de corral para poyar la economía del hogar. Su esposo trabaja como obrero agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para sustentarlos.

Usualmente cría chivos, patos, pavos y cerdos para luego venderlos dos veces por mes en el mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para criarlos y venderlos, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

María Alicia es una mujer trabajadora, responsable, es muy conocida y estimada por los vecinos de la zona en donde vive. Su mayor anhelo es darle a sus menores hijo una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Alicia is 33 years old, married with two young children. She lives next to her family in the village of Huaca de Barro, Mórrope district, located one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. Like the majority of women in the area, María Alicia resorts to the raising and selling of penned animals in order to meet the economic needs of the home. Her husband works as an agricultural worker and the income he receives is not sufficient to sustain them. Usually she raises goats, ducks, turkeys and pigs in order to later sell them twice monthly at the Moshoqueque market in the city of Chiclayo. She would like to expand her business by buying more animals to raise and sell. For this reason, she has found it necessary to solicit for the first time, a loan of 1500 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa. María Alicia is a hard working woman, responsible and well known and respected by her neighbors in the area she lives. Her biggest desire is to give her young children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more animals in order to grow her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: glasses, linen, clothes

loans.name: Edit

texts.es:
Edit, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 29 años, es conviviente, tiene una hija llamada Daniela y tiene 2 años. Edit trabaja como psicóloga por las mañanas en el centro de salud de Belempampa los días lunes, miércoles y viernes desde las 8am hasta las 2:30pm. Edit tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos, ellas ofrece a sus amigas y familiares los cosméticos mediante un catalogo. Edit forma parte del banco Comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella requiere el préstamo de los 800 soles, que invertirá en pagar a la empresa que le vende los cosméticos. Edit se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
Edit is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman. She lives in Cusco is 29 years old, she is a cohabitant and has a daughter named Daniela who is 2 years old. Edit works as a psychologist at Belempampa's health center on Monday, Wednesday and Friday mornings from 8am to 2:30pm. Edit has a small business selling cosmetics. She offers cosmetics to her friends and family off of a catalog. Edit is part of the Communal Bank "Inti", which is part of the Arariwa Asociation. She needs a loan of 800 soles which she will invest in paying the enterprise which sells her cosmetics. Edit is very thankful for the opportunity granted to her through this medium and she promises to meet the payments according to the schedule. (Inti is a Quechua word that translated to English it means sun)

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay back the enterprise that sells her cosmetics

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA REBECA ES UNA PERSONA JOVEN, QUE SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA EN EL MERCADO 10 DE ENERO QUE ESTA EN LA ZONA DE PAMPAHASI, ELLA ES MUY CONOCIDA EN EL MERCADO YA QUE PREPARA UN DELICIOSO ALMUERZO NEGOCIO DONDE LE VA MUY BIEN.

LA OTRA ACTIVIDAD DE LA SRA. REBECA VENDE CALZADOS Y CHINELAS EN LA FERIA SAN LUIS DE EL ALTO Y ELLA SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR CALZADOS PARA NIÑOS Y JOVENES YA QUE COMIENZA LA ÉPOCA DE CLASES, SU ESPOSO, EL SR. MIGUEL, ES CARPINTERO Y TIENE SU TALLER EN SENKATA. 

ELLOS VIVEN EN LA ZONA COSMOS 79 DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO Y TIENEN UN PEQUEÑO HIJO Y SU DESEO ES VER A SU HIJO PROFESIONAL.
 
ELLA Y SU ESPOSO SON PERSONAS MUY RESPONSABLES CON SU FAMILIA Y SU TRABAJO ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDOS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a young person who sells food in the market "10 de Enero," which is in the Pampahasi area. She is very well-known in the market since she prepares a delicious lunch, and her business is doing very well. She also has another business activity, selling shoes and slippers in the San Luis Market in El Alto. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy shoes for children, since school season is starting. Her husband, Miguel, is a carpenter and has a workshop in Senkata. They live in the Cosmos 79 neighborhood in the city of El Alto, and they have a small son. They hope to see their son become a professional. She and her husband are very responsible people, both with their family and with their work. They are very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shoes for school season

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul tiene 55 años, es casado y pertenece al banco comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa. Raul se dedica a la producción de artesanía. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más material para la elaboración de su artesanía y así esta forma ayudar a su familia.  
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
Raul is 55 years old he is married and belongs to the Communal Bank "Inti" of the Arariwa Association. Raul is dedicated to craft production. It has been 25 years since e started elaborating art crafts and he has done very well thanks to the commitment that he puts into his business. This member requires a loan to purchase more material to elaborate his crafts and in this way help his family. This member is very thankful for the opportunity granted to him through this medium and promises to meet the payments according to the schedule. (Inti is a word in Quechua that translated to English means Sun)

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more raw materials to produce crafts

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna, de 38 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo José (40) y sus 3 hijos; José (17), Jesús (14) y Cristian (12).
Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de golosinas en la puerta de su casa, para lograrlo adaptó una pequeña vitrina donde ofrece sus productos a sus vecinos y amigos. Este negocio es nuevo, pues ella trabaja como teleoperadora por las tardes y esto no le permite cuidar de sus hijos, por lo que ha decidido dejar ese trabajo para dedicarse del todo a su nuevo negocio. Actualmente, ella atiende su pequeño puesto por las mañanas y sus hijos lo hacen por las tardes.
Giovanna quiere implementar su negocio con otros productos comestibles, pues por su zona no hay una bodega cercana y está segura de que tendrá buenas ventas y ganancias. Para ello, posteriormente acondicionará la cochera de su casa para su futura tienda.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser muy responsable en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas porque quiere seguir progresando. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de variada mercadería para surtir su puesto y empezar a ampliarlo.
texts.en:
Giovanna is 38 and lives in a home she owns with her husband José (40) and her children José (17), Jesús (14) and Cristian (12). This hardworking woman sells candy at the door of her house. In order to make this work she has created a small shopfront where she offers her products to neighbors and friends. This is a new business for her, as she works as a telephone operator in the afternoons. This job does not allow her to fully care for her children, so she has decided to quit and to put all her efforts into her new business, Currently she works at her small store in the mornings and her children work there in the afternoons. Giovanna wants to expand her business with other foodstuffs, because in the area where she lives there is not a grocery store nearby and she is sure that her sales and earnings will be good. She is planning to renovate the garage of her house in order to set up the store there. This is her first loan with MFP [the lending field partner] and she promises to be very responsible in her repayments because she would like to continue moving ahead. The money she is asking for will go towards the purchase of a variety of merchandise to better stock her store and to begin to expand it.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly, de 40 años, tiene muchas ganas de progresar. Vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Manuel (40) y sus 3 jóvenes hijos; Luz (21), Liz (15) y Manuel (12).
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, es por eso que cuando se le presenta la oportunidad de un nuevo negocio lo toma, ya que sabe que todo lo realizado con esfuerzo y trabajo siempre tiene su recompensa. Por ello, cuando empezó con la venta de ropa de dormir y polos no tuvo temor, es una muy buena comerciante y trabaja dejando las prendas al crédito.
Por otro lado, también vende productos de belleza de una marca reconocida, y como si fuera poco, durante los fines de semana madruga para preparar tamales (platillo a base de maíz) y venderlos afuera de una panadería de la zona donde vive. 
Estas tres actividades que desempeña le gustan mucho porque se distrae y le generan buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten ayudar en los gastos del hogar.
Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un puesto de ropa en un mercado de su localidad, para tener un lugar estable.

Este es el 4to préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual con el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que quiere acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ropa para empezar con la venta por  temporada de verano, ya que tiene muchos pedidos por cumplir.
texts.en:
Nelly, de 40 años, tiene muchas ganas de progresar. Vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Manuel (40) y sus 3 jóvenes hijos; Luz (21), Liz (15) y Manuel (12). Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, es por eso que cuando se le presenta la oportunidad de un nuevo negocio lo toma, ya que sabe que todo lo realizado con esfuerzo y trabajo siempre tiene su recompensa. Por ello, cuando empezó con la venta de ropa de dormir y polos no tuvo temor, es una muy buena comerciante y trabaja dejando las prendas al crédito. Por otro lado, también vende productos de belleza de una marca reconocida, y como si fuera poco, durante los fines de semana madruga para preparar tamales (platillo a base de maíz) y venderlos afuera de una panadería de la zona donde vive. Estas tres actividades que desempeña le gustan mucho porque se distrae y le generan buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten ayudar en los gastos del hogar. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un puesto de ropa en un mercado de su localidad, para tener un lugar estable. Este es el 4to préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual con el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que quiere acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ropa para empezar con la venta por temporada de verano, ya que tiene muchos pedidos por cumplir. Nelly, 40 years old, has a lot of desire to progress. She lives in her own house with her husband Manuel (40) and her children; Luz(21), Liz (15) and Manuel (12). She is an enterprising and hard working woman, and because of this, when an opportunity to start a new business presents itself, she takes it since she knows that she can accomplish anything with a lot of effort and she knows that hard work always has its reward. Because of this, when she started selling sleepwear and polos she wasn’t afraid, she is a good saleswoman and works selling her clothes to her clients on credit. She also sells a recognized brand of beauty products and if that weren’t enough, on the weekends she wakes up early to prepare tamales (a corn flour based dish) and sells them outside a bakery in the area where she lives. She loves these three activities that she performs because they keep her occupied and they generate good earnings that allow her to help with household expenses. For the future, she plans on installing a clothing shop in a market in her neighborhood in order to have a more stable place to sell. This is the fourth loan she has had from MFP and she promises to be punctual with each payment when the amount is due since she would like to have access to loans in the future. With the money that she’s asking for she will buy a larger quantity of clothes in order to start selling summer clothing since she already has a lot of orders she needs to fill.

Translated from Spanish by Shane Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcelo es un cliente nuevo que hace un par de años la Universidad Catolica le dio la oportunidad de atender la cafeteria de una de las carreras, el señor al ver que la gran demanda de comida que existe por los estudiantes y catedraticos  decidio comprarse equipo para ofrecer comida rapida ya que por los alrededores no existe ningun lugar donde poder comer,  el señor necesia el dinero para llenar la cafeteria con mercaderia y tambien para comprar los ingredientes para la elaboracion e pollo frito, hamburguesas y sandwichs, el Sr. Marcelo Trabaja junto con su esposa quien le ayuda en la atencion de la cafeteria.

El Sr. Marcelo esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Marcelo is a new client. A couple of years ago, Catholic University gave him the opportunity to manage a cafeteria at one of its campuses. Marcelo saw a great demand for food among the students and faculty, so he decided to buy the equipment needed to offer fast food since there were no other places to eat.

He needs the money to restock the cafeteria with merchandise and also purchase ingredients for preparing fried chicken, hamburgers, and sandwiches. Marcelo works with his wife, who helps with managing the cafeteria. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & ingredients for his cafeteria

loans.name: Justo Pastor

texts.es: Justo Pastor tiene 60 años, su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de billar. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor este no es el primer financiamiento que ha solicitado pues han sido experiencias maravillosas para su negocio. Todos los días llegan a su vivienda diferentes personas que van a entretenerse por lo que el realiza torneos para que los jóvenes se diviertan sanamente, Justo piensa en sus clientes y trata de proporcionar a el mejor servicio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de gaseosas, cigarrillos, golosinas, nuevos tacos y tapizar ciertas mesas. Su deseo es mantener su negocio activo ya que este es su medio de vida.
texts.en:
Justo Pastor tiene 60 años, su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de billar. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor este no es el primer financiamiento que ha solicitado pues han sido experiencias maravillosas para su negocio. Todos los días llegan a su vivienda diferentes personas que van a entretenerse por lo que el realiza torneos para que los jóvenes se diviertan sanamente, Justo piensa en sus clientes y trata de proporcionar a el mejor servicio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de gaseosas, cigarrillos, golosinas, nuevos tacos y tapizar ciertas mesas. Su deseo es mantener su negocio activo ya que este es su medio de vida. Justo Pastor is 60 years old. He offers a billiards service in order to make a living. He’s worked in this business for more than 10 years, so he is a hardworking and enterprising man. This isn’t the first financing he has sought out since these loans have been fantastic experiences for his business. Everyday different people come to his home to entertain themselves so he organizes tournaments so youth can come and have a good time in a positive way. Justo is always thinking about his clientele and he tries to provide the best service possible. He is seeking financing in order to purchase sodas, cigarettes, candies, new tacos, and to refurbish certain billiard tables. He hopes to keep this business running since it is how he makes a living.

Translated from Spanish by Shane Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 40 años, vive feliz en su casa propia al lado de su pareja Elías (48) y de sus 5 hijos: Elías (23), Kayser (18), Karin (16), Ángela (15) y Anaí (2).
Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de comida, al principio lo hacia en un puesto ubicado cerca de su casa, pero no obtenía buenas ganancias, hasta que su hijo mayor ingresó a trabajar en una fábrica y le dio la idea de ofrecer pensión diaria en su trabajo.
Actualmente cocina con la ayuda de sus hijas mayores y después reparte las porciones a más de 40 personas en el centro laboral de su hijo. Las ganancias quincenales que percibe son muy buenas, es por eso que está muy contenta y con muchas ganas de salir adelante; lo que no le gusta es trasladar todos los envases de comida hasta la fábrica, pues es cansado, pero vale la pena. Y como es una mujer muy luchadora que piensa en grande, para el futuro le gustaría instalar un puesto de venta de comida en el trabajo de su hijo.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que quiere seguir trabajando con esta entidad para seguir progresando. Rosa tiene pensado destinar el dinero del préstamo en la compra de mercadería como aceite, arroz, azúcar, menestras, entre otros; para tenerlos almacenados y seguir cocinando sus platillos sin problemas.
texts.en:
Rosa, aged 40, lives happily in her own house along side her partner Elías (aged 48) and their 5 children; Elías Jr. (23), Kayser (18), Karin (16), Ángela (15) and Anaí (2). For seven years she has been dedicated to selling meals. At first, she did it from a stand located near her house, but couldn't obtain good earnings, until her elder son got a job in a factory and gave her the idea of offering daily meals in his work place. At present, she cooks with the help of her older daughters, distributing the portions among more than 40 people in her son's work center. The bi-weekly earnings she receives are very good. It's for this reason that she is very content and has a great desire to get ahead. What she likes least is carrying all the food containers to the factory every day, which tires her out, but it's worth the trouble. And, since she is a very determined woman who thinks big, in the future she would like to install her meal-selling business inside her son's place of work. This is the second loan she has requested from MFP and she promises to be punctual in her payments, since she wants to continue working with this entity in order to continue progressing. Rosa wishes to use the loan to buy merchandise such as oil, rice, sugar, and dried vegetables, among other things, to have them at hand, in order to continue cooking her dishes without problems.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FOOD INGREDIENTS FOR COOKING MEALS TO SELL

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
El señor Ronald y su hermano Aldo son dos jovenes emprendedores que tras haber trabajado tres años en una peluqueria de mascotas tuvieron la idea de abrir un negocio en el que se pueda brindar al cliente este tipo de servicio pero a domicilio nombrando al mismo PELUQUERIA MOVIL LUCKY, actualmente la empresa cuenta con cuarenta a cincuenta clientes fijos que solicitan el servicio quincenal y mensualmente ademas de contar con sesenta clientes  informales que solicitan el credito irregularmente pero los señores llevan cuenta de estos, mercado al cual se dirigen es exclusivamente  la zona sur y entre los clientes destacados podemos nombrar a una conocida conductora de television quien fue una e sus primeras clientes.

El destino del credito es para la compra de material de trabajo para el lavado y corte de pelo de los clientes de la peluqueria caN..

Esta muy agradecidos con Emprender y KIva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Ronald and his brother Aldo are two young entrepreneurs. After working three years at a pet grooming salon, they decided to open a business in which they would provide this type of service at the client’s home. They named their business “Peluqueria Movil Lucky” (Lucky Mobile Pet Grooming), which currently has 40-50 established clients that request service on a biweekly or monthly basis. In addition, they have another 60 informal clients who request service on credit on an “as needed” basis, so these individuals are counted as part of their client roster. Their target market is only in the southern district and among their most distinguished clients is a famous television host who was one of their first customers.

Ronald will use this loan to purchase supplies needed for washing and grooming his clients’ dogs. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for his pet grooming business

loans.name: Fernando Bladimir

texts.es: El Sr. Fernando G. es trabajador de la alcaldía municipal trabaja en los viveros sembrando plantas y revisando que este bien siempre todas las plantitas, el dinero lo solicita para comprar arroz, azúcar, Aceite y jabones ya que tiene en su casa una pequeña venta. Es casado su esposa atiende el negocio tiene una familia de seis hijos dos en edad escolar y los otros trabajan por su propia cuenta ha tenido dos créditos con Ceprodel siente que si le han servido de mucho ya que con estos se ha ayudado en tener su negocio y en mejorar su casa y se siente muy agradecido con Ceprodel por brindarle estos crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Fernando G. is a worker at town hall. He plants and oversees the municipal gardens. The loan he is requesting is for the purchase of rice, sugar, cooking oils, and soaps, as he has a small store in his home. He is married, and his wife tends to the business. He has six school-aged children, and the others work for themselves. He has had two loans with Ceprodel, and he feels these have helped him greatly to support his business and make improvements to his home. He is very thankful to Ceprodel for providing these credits.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil and soaps.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz, es soltera, vive en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 30 años y trabaja como profesora pero también tiene un pequeño negocio de pintado de platos de madera. Beatriz nos cuenta que compra platos de madera de los artesanos de la ciudad de Calca y después de pintarlos los distribuye a las tiendas del Centro Comercial Artesanal del Cusco. Beatriz forma parte del banco Comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella requiere el préstamo de los 1000 soles, que invertirá en comprar platos de madera. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone su negocio. Beatriz se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
 
(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
Beatriz is single, and lives in the city of Cusco. She is 30 years old and works as a teacher. She also has a small business selling painted wood plates. Beatriz tells us that she buys the plates from artisans in the city of Calca, she paints them, then distributes her works to the stores located in Cusco’s main handicrafts center. Beatriz is a member of the “Inti” cooperative bank of the Arariwa Association. She needs a loan of 1,000.00 Peruvian soles to invest into the purchase of the wood plates. She has dedicated herself to this business for 10 years, and things have gone very well for her thanks to the efforts she puts into her enterprise. Beatriz is very grateful for the opportunity provided through this medium, and likewise commits to repay her loan as scheduled. (“Inti” is a word in Quechua that, translated, means “sun”.)

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beatriz needs a loan of 1,000.00 Peruvian soles to invest into the purchase of wood plates.

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.es:
La joven Martha S. tiene la edad de 30 años, casada y madre de 2 niños, es comerciante desde hace 9 años, anteriormente vendía tarjetas y recargas telefónica en su casa de habitación y desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropa americana, ya que ella cuenta con la facilidad de que su mamá viaja y le trae la mercadería. Ella espera en un futuro invertir más y llegar a establecer una tienda de ropa en su casa de habitación.
Martha es el quinto crédito que se le otorga, trabaja con Ceprodel desde hace 3 años y ella nos expresa que han sido de mucha ayuda tanto para su negocio, como para hacer unas mejoras en su casa de habitación, por lo cual se siente muy satisfecha porque le ha permitido que mejore su nivel de vida
texts.en:
Martha S. is 30 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. She has been a merchant for 9 years, having previously sold cards and phone chargers out of her home. For two years now, she has been selling American clothing door-to-door. She has this opportunity because her Mother travels and brings her back the merchandise. She hopes to invest more into her business in the future and establish a clothing store in her home. This is the fifth loan granted to Martha, and she has been working with Ceprodel for 3 years. She tells us that this access to credit has been a great help to her business, as well as in making some improvements to her home. She feels very satisfied, since this financial assistance has helped her to improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (women's shirts, sandals, pants, purses).

loans.name: Sara Ruth

texts.es: La Sr(a).  Sara G. G.. Se dedica al destace de cerdos para elaborar ricos nacatamales es madre de tres hijos en edades escolares su estado civil es acompañada en esta actividad tiene mucha experiencia de más de 18 años
texts.en:
La Señora Sara G. G. butchers pigs and makes delicious nacatamales (a traditional food of banana leaves filled corn mash stuffed with meat and steamed). She is the mother of three school-aged children and lives with her partner. She has a lot of experience in this kind of work and has been doing it for the last 18 years.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pork and leaves to make nacatamales

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela es una madre D. familia D. 55 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector La Compuerta del distrito D. Oyotún, ubicado a dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Trabaja ofreciendo servicios D. sonido musical y animación para fiestas y actividades D. todo tipo. Ella nos comenta que es muy conocida en la zona donD. vive y que su negocio incluso le ha permitido viajar a zonas aledañas. Angela nos cuenta que este negocio nació D. una inicativa D. comunicación comunal D. la zona. Cuando empezaron se dedicaba a a perifonear diversos avisos a los vecinos del lugar. Poco a poco el negocio fue creciendo y ahora tienen un equipo que les permite ofrecer un servicio D. buena calidad.

El negocio se ha constituido con la principal fuente D. ingreso familiar, Angela piensa ampliarlo con la compra D. un amplificador más. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro D. su objetivo.

Angela es una mujer trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una mujer D. confianza.
texts.en:
Angela is a mother who is 55 years old who lives with her husband and children in the La Compuerta sector of the district of Oyotun, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo. She works offering services as a DJ for parties and activities of all kinds. She tells us that she is very well known in the area where she lives and her business has even let her visit neighboring areas. Angela tells us that this business was born from a communal communication initiative in the area. When they started, she would pass out different flyers to the residents of the area. Little by little, the business grew and now she has equipment that allows her to offer a high quality service. The business has become the main source of family income. Angela plans on growing it with the purchase of another amplifier. This is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles that she plans on using to achieve her goal. Angela is a hard working and responsible woman. Her greatest wish is to keep growing as a business woman to improve the quality of life for her family. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her a trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sound amplifier to improve her business.

loans.name: María Olga

texts.es:
María Olga tiene 34 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus cuatro hijos en el sector Huaca de Barro, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia la llevó a dedicarse al negocio de crianza y venta de animales. Usualmente cría aves de corral y cerdos en un terreno abandonado ubicado en la parte exterior se su casa, María Olga los alimenta con granos y hierbas naturales para luego ir a vanderlos al mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de chiclayo dos veces por semana.

Los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para mantener a su familia, por lo que desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una madre luchadora y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es darle a sus hijos una educación de calidad que les garantice un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
María Olga is 34. She is separated and lives with her four children in the Dacha de Barro sector in the Mórrope district. It is located one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. The need to get her family ahead caused her to devote herself to the business of raising and selling animals. She usually raises poultry and pigs on an abandoned piece of land outside of her house. María Olga feeds them grains and natural herbs. She later sells them twice a week at the Moshoqueque market in the city of Chiclayo. The income that she gets is not enough to support her family. That is why she wants to expand her business by purchasing more animals. For the first time she is asking the Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,500 PEN, which will help her achieve her objective. She is a fighter and a hard-working mother. Her greatest desire is to give her children a quality education that will guarantee a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animals to expand her business

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es: La señora María Josefa S. A. es maestra de educación `primaria es madre  soltera de cinco hijos y cuatro de ellos en edad escolar antes de tener este oficio era de limpieza y aduce que muchos padres de familia no confían en ella para que le eduquen a sus  hijos ella actualmente se sigue preparando para maestra de educación física lo cual lo hace los días sábado.
texts.en:
María Josefa S. A. is a primary school teacher. She is a single mother with five children. Four of the children are school-age. Before this occupation her job was cleaning. She states that many parents do not have confidence in her to teach their children. She is currently continuing to prepare to be a physical education teacher. She does this on Saturdays.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blocks, concrete, and pay for labor

loans.name: Maria Clara

texts.es:
Maria Clara es una madre de familia de 30 años que vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en el caserío Las Juntas, distrito de Pacora, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Ella nos comenta que tuvo que empezar a trabajar en este negocio porque lo que su esposo percibe como trabajador agrícola no le basta para solventar los gastos familiares. Actualmente cría ovejas, pavos y patos, los cuales comercializa luego en el mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Debido a la demanda por los animales, María Clara ha decidido ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para ofrecerlos en venta, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María Clara es una madre luchadora, trabajadora y muy entregada  a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, así como una buena educación que les permita triunfar en el futuro.
texts.en:
Maria Clara, age 30, lives with her husband and their three children in the Las Juntas settlement in the Pacora district. It is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. She raises and sells small animals. She tells us that she had to start working in this business because what her husband makes as a farm worker is not enough to cover the family expenses. She currently raises sheep, turkeys, and ducks. She then sells them in the Moshoqueque market in the city of Chiclayo. Due to the demand for the animals, María Clara has decided to expand her business by purchasing more animals to offer for sale. That is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,500 PEN that will help her achieve her objective. María Clara is a fighter and a hard-working mother who is very devoted to her family. Her greatest desire is to be able to give her children a better quality of life such as a good education, which will allow them to triumph in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animals to expand her business

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 54 años, es divorciado, tiene dos hijos (Claudio y Mitzu) y pertenece al banco comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa. Hugo es director de teatro y Mino de la escuela de taller “JUGLAR”, ya son 30 años con su trabajo.  La escuela de teatro tiene una línea pedagógica donde enseñan a confeccionar disfraces, mascaras y nariz de papayo.  El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más material para la elaboración de sus disfraces y mascaras. 
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
Hugo is 54 years old, he is divorced and he has 2 children (Claudio and Mitzu). He belongs to the "Inti" communal bank which is part of the Arariwa Association. Hugo is the director of a theatre and of a school of "JUGLAR" workshops, which he has been doing for 30 years. The theater school has an educational arm where they teach the making of costumes and masks. Hugo needs a loan to buy more materials for the making of costumes and masks. He is very grateful for the opportunity given to him through Kiva and is committed to repaying his loan on time. (Inti is a word from the Quechua language that means "sun" in Spanish)

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make costumes and masks

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Flor tiene 49 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de su madre, ubicada en el sector Punto Cuatro del distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Flor es propietaria de una pequeña bodega en la cual ofrece a sus vecinos y clientes productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Debido a que la zona es netamente agrícola y los ingresos no son estables, ella ofrece los productos con facilidades de pago. Flor nos comenta que la idea del negocio nació de la necesidad de manejar una fuente de ingreso que les permita a ella y a su madre solventar los gastos familiares.

Debido a la demanda que posee su negocio, Flor desea ampliarlo con la compra de más productos de primera necesidad y bebidas pero no cuenta con el suficiente capital para realizar esta acción, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

Flor es una mujer trabajadora, honesta y que siempre trata de ayudar a sus vecinos cuando se le necesita. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su madre una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Flor is 49 years old, is single and lives in her mother's home, which is located in the Punto Cuatro sector in the Mochumí district, 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Flor is the owner of a small bodega, or general store, where she sells groceries and basic necessities to her neighbors and clients. Because her business is in an agricultural zone and people's incomes are not always stable, she offers products on a payment plan. Flor tells us that the idea for the business arose due to the need for an income source that allowed her and her mother to cover the family expenses. Due to the demand for her business, Flor would like to expand by buying more basic necessities and drinks but she does not have enough capital to do this. That is why she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 nuevo soles, which will allow her to achieve her objective. Flor is a hard-working, honest woman who always tries to help her neighbors when they need it. Her greatest desire is to provide her mother with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks and other basic necessities in order to expand her business

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
El señor José G. se dedica al trabajo de agente de seguridad en un colegio del municipio de San Rafael en Managua. Está comprometido con el bienestar de su familia por lo que ha tomado la decisión de comprar un terreno o espacio para construir su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida propia y de su familia.

Por esta razón es que está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de dicho terreno y así iniciar a construir la vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. José G. G. works as a security guard at a school in the municipality of San Rafael in Managua. He is dedicated to the well being of his family, for this reason he has decided to buy a piece of land on which to build a home. He intends to improve his own living conditions and the living conditions of his family. He is taking out a loan to invest in the purchase of land and to start building his home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construccion materials like blocks, sand and cement

loans.name: Rosa María De Lourdes

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el sector La Compuerta del distrito de Oyotún, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace más de diez años. Cría diversos animales: aves de corral, cerdos y cuyes, los cuales ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona donde vive. Este negocio le provee de ingresos necesarios para solventar sus gastos personales y sacar adelante a su familia.

Rosa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para críar, así como también en la compra de alimentos, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Rosa es una mujer muy conocida y estmida por los vecinos del lugar donde vive. Ella es muy responsable y trabjadora. Adicionalmente trabaja apoyando en un colegio del lugar.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings in the La Compuerta sector of Oyotún District, two hours from the city of Chiclayo. Rosa has been raising and selling animals for more than a decade. She raises a variety of animals, including poultry, pigs and guinea pigs. She sells her animals to the buyers who frequently visit her neighborhood. This business allows her to generate the necessary income to cover her personal expenses and help her family get ahead. Rosa would like to expand her business by buying more animals to raise as well as more animal feed. She is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1200 Peruvian Soles in order to achieve this goal. Rosa is a very well-known woman who is held in high esteem by her neighbors. She is very responsible and hard-working. She also works as support staff at a local school.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: To buy animals to expand her business

loans.name: Rommel José

texts.es: El Sr. Rommel M. H.  es conductor de buses de la ruta pochomil Managua tiene trece años de experiencia en esta actividad su familia es dueña de  rutas que viajan transportando pasajeros de pochomil  a Managua, es soltero y su objetivo con este préstamo es la adquisición de un vehículo.
texts.en:
Rommel M. H. is a bus driver on the route from Pochomil to Managua. He has thirteen years of experience in this business. His family owns a passenger transport line on the Pochomil to Managua route. He is single and his goal with this loan is to buy a new vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a vehicle

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, es casada, vive en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 51  años. Luz alterna sus actividades del hogar con su trabaja de profesora en la escuela “Bernabé Cobo” del distrito de San Jerónimo del departamento del Cusco. Luz nos cuenta que su esposo es pintor  desde los 12 años y que es ex alumno de los “Mendivil” (Creadores de los cuellos largos), ella aprendió viendo como su esposo pintaba y ahora es profesora de la “Escuela Cuzqueña” en el área de imaginaria donde enseña a pintar Waltas (Bebes amarrados a la espalda de su mamá).  Luz en sus tiempos libres pinta Waltas para después venderlos en la ciudad de Lima, ella forma parte del banco Comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella requiere el préstamo de los 1500 soles, que invertirá en comprar óleo, cola, tela y pinceles. Ya son varios  años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone su negocio. Luz se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
 
(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
Luz is married, is 51 years old, and lives in the city of Cusco. Luz alternates her household activities with her job as a teacher at the “Bernabé Cobo” school in the San Jerónimo district in the department of Cusco. Luz explained to us that her husband has been a painter for 12 years and is a former student of the Mendivils [a family of statue sculptors], (creators of a style of long-necked statues). She learned by watching her husband paint, and now she is a teacher in the subject area of statuary in the “Cuzco School” style, and she teaches how to paint waltas (babies strapped to their mother’s backs). In her free time, Luz paints waltas and then sells them in Lima. She is part of the “Inti” communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa [Kiva Field Partner]. She needs a loan of PEN 1,500.00, which she will use to buy oil paints, glue, fabric, and brushes. She has been in this business for several years and things have gone well for her because of the effort she puts into her work. Luz is grateful for the opportunity that is granted to her through this program, and she promises to repay according to the established time line. (“Inti” is a Quecha word which translated to Spanish means “sun.”)

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oil paints, glue, fabric, and brushes

loans.name: Optimistas I Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo denominado “Las Optimistas” el cual está ubicado en el municipio de Tolcayuca, a unos 40 minutos  de la cd. de Pachuca, Hgo., el grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes; están representadas por la Sra. Alberta M. que se dedica a la venta de comida afuera de las escuelas.
La Sra. Mary (María Elena P. Rodríguez), estudio la primaria, tiene 44 años de edad, tiene tres hijos (de 15,14 y 10 años), su esposo siempre se ha dedicado al campo. La sra. Mary elabora ropa tejida de temporada y, en esta ocasión el crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar estambre y tela para la elaboración de ropa y cobijas para los “Niños  Dios” que ella arregla para el 2 de febrero, día de la candelaria la cual es una bella tradición mexicana. Para ella el éxito es que sus hijos puedan terminar alguna carrera.

Las Sras. Mariana, Gabriela, Julia, Lidia y Elvia se dedican a la venta de comida; la Sra. Leonor tiene una tienda de abarrotes, María Teresa vende chamarras y abrigos y la Sra. Alejandra se dedica a la venta de zapato por catalogo.
texts.en:
This is the group called “Las Optimistas” [The Optimists] and it’s located in the municipality of Tolcayuca, which is 40 minutes from the city of Pachuca, Hidalgo. The group is made up of 11 members. They are represented by Alberta M., who sells food outside schools. Mary (María Elena P. Rodríguez) studied through primary school. She is 44 years old, she has three children (15, 14, and 10 years old), and her husband has always worked in the fields. Mary makes seasonal knit clothing and this time she is going to use the loan to buy yarn and fabric for making clothing and blankets for the “Niños Dios” [sculptural figures of the Christ Child] that she makes for 2 February, the day of Candlemas, which is a beautiful Mexican tradition. For her, success would be her children being able to complete their education. Mariana, Gabriela, Julia, Lidia, and Elvia sell food; Leonor has a small grocery store; María Teresa sells jackets and coats; and Alejandra sells shoes from catalogs.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yarn and fabric

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa B. is a married woman who supports her family by buying and selling sweet potatoes and bananas. She lives in Barangay Suba Calatrava, Negros Occidental, with her 57-year-old husband Romeo, who helps his wife with their business and piggery. They have seven children, aged from 20 to 34 years old, five of whom have their own families while the other two are still single.
Elisa has been a member of Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, since 2001. She has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her buy and sell business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8,000 PHP.
Elisa is now borrowing 25,000 PHP to buy and sell more sweet potatoes and bananas. This will be her fourteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 23,500 PHP, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Elisa aspires to improve her family’s living conditions and ensure the family's future's wellbeing by following the 'Dungganon' way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more sweet potatoes and bananas

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna R. is a 46-year-old married woman who lives in Payao, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns a living through her general store while her husband does other things. The couple has three children between the ages of 13 and 23. Two of their children are currently in school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.
Lorna joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been able to increase the family income from her general store. Now, she earns an average monthly income of 12,000 PHP from her business activities.
Lorna is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP was used to fund operations for her general store, and this had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now on her twenty-first loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use for her general store. Lorna is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family – to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia M. is a 47-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Mahilum, Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns a living by making native products (such as bags, wallets, fruit baskets and many more) out of pandan leaves. Apolonia’s husband, Jerry, 46, helps to run the business. They have three children between the ages of 10 and 24. One of their children has a family already, while the other two are currently in school and help their parents with the business as part of their daily chores.
Apolonia joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2005 in the hope of helping her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been able to increase the family income from her business. Now she earns an average monthly income of 10,000 PHP from her business activities.
Apolonia is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 9,500 PHP was used to fund her business, and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, she is borrowing her tenth loan of 11,000 PHP, which she intends to use to make more products from pandan leaves. Apolonia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family – to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Tamunang Joseph

texts.en:
Born in 1948, Tamumang Joseph is married to Nkenti Grace and they have brought forth three children. Due to the fact that it is too difficult for him to take care of the family single-handedly and provide the children’s basic care, and also that his wife could not do it alone, he decided to join GHAPE in 1998. Also, he has been having a lot of marital problems with his family and this has made him sad all the time, but he is appreciative of the fact that he is alive.

Tamumang’s desire is to give his children love and education. He states that he feels better each time he provides something small for his children. His inability to get investment capital which could constantly generate income for him to meet his children’s needs is what motivated him to obtain a loan from GHAPE.

Given the loan, Tamumang plans to buy a motorcycle to start a transportation business. He knows this business will succeed because he is located at a good business site and he has a good rider for the motorcycle. He plans to use the generated profits to sponsor his children in school and to cater for the basic needs of his family.


About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO (non-governmental organization) based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to start a transportation business

loans.name: Ngang Julie

texts.en:
Julie was born on 08/07/1966. She is married to Angoudu Emmanuel and is blessed with three children under 15. Julie is a hardworking lady who has faced many challenges in life, such as ill health and being unable to care for her children. All these challenges led her to decide to become a GHAPE member in 2008. In this same year, she received her first loan of 40,000 XAF, which she repaid promptly.
With this loan of 200,0000 XAF, Julie plans to buy seven tines of corn, five tines of beans, four tines of garri, and five buckets of coco yams. The loan repayment will start from the day the loan is disbursed. Julie is sure that her business will succeed because she has been doing it for a long time, has a good business location, and a lot of customers. Her neighbors are happy to buy from her because the distance they have to travel to market is reduced, and they can buy from her late at night. She plans to use her profits to invest back into the business, look after her son, and give good medical attention to herself and her children. She prefers loans from Kiva partner, GHAPE, because of the social services GHAPE offer and the convenient method of repayment.

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, garri and coco yams for resale

loans.name: Enos Nambiro

texts.en: Enos C. Nambiro O. runs a poultry farming business in Malanga, Busia district. Before he started this business in 2008, he was employed at a security firm. He went into poultry farming to generate income for his retirement. Enos is 60 years old, married and a father of six, as well as the guardian of two other children. He would like a loan of 20,000 KES, which he will use to expand his business and venture into lumbering.

loans.use: To expand his business and venture into lumbering

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rose Auma

texts.en: Rose Auma O. is married and blessed with three children. She runs a tailoring business in Manyole, Busia district. She started this business in 2009, and buys her stock thrice a month from Nambale town. She would like a loan of 10,000 KES, which she will use to expand her business by increasing her stock. Her plan is to ensure economic stability for her family, with a special concern for the education of her children and orphans.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her tailoring business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Petronilla Ajiambo

texts.en: Petronilla Ajiambo M. is 65 years old, married, and a mother of four children. She lives in Manyole, Busia district. Petronilla has a business trading in cereals. She started this business in the year 2006 as a source of income generation. She would like a loan of 10,000 KES, which she will use to expand her stock base of cereals such as maize, green grams, etc.

loans.use: To expand her stock of cereals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Everlyne Wambani

texts.en: Everlyne Wambani S. is married and a mother of three children. She is a retail shop owner in Nambale, Busia district, and started this business in 2007. She buys her stock twice a week. Her current plan is to expand her retail shop by increasing her stock. Her future plan is to be self-empowered as a woman. She would like a loan of 15,000 KES.

loans.use: To increase her stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Selina Adhiambo

texts.en: Selina Adhiambo B. is 42 years old, married, and a mother of four children. She has a cereals business in Nambale, Busia district. She started the business in the year 2000, before which she was a farmer. She buys her stock twice a month from Busia town. Selina would like a loan of 20,000 KES to expand her business by increasing her stock. Her future plan is to expand her business into a cereals retail store.

loans.use: To increase her stock of cereals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dorcas Nabisino

texts.en: Dorcas Nabisino M. is married and the mother of five children. She has a second-hand clothes business in Nambale, Busia district. She started this business in 1999, fresh from employment as a clerk. She buys her stock from Nairobi, Kisumu and Mombasa markets. Dorcas would like a loan of 20,000 KES, which she will use to restock her business. Her main plan in life is to achieve self-reliance as a woman.

loans.use: To restock her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary Auma

texts.en: Mary Auma W. is 46 years of age, married and blessed with seven children. She is a grocery business woman in the Nambale market, Busia district. She started this business in the year 2007 before which she was a farmer. Mary buys her stock daily at Nambale from local farmers and resells them.  She would like a loan of Kshs. 10,000 which will go into expansion of her grocery business.

loans.use: To expand business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Beatrice Clay

texts.en: Beatrice Clay K. owns a retail shop in Nambale, Busia district. She started this business in the year 2007 after a previous business as a door-to-door vendor. She buys her stock once a week from Busia town.  Beatrice would like a loan of Kshs. 10, 000 to use in increasing the stock in her shop.  She joined Kiva partner K-MET in order to empower herself both health-wise and education-wise. Her future plan is to to achieve self-reliance and guarantee education for her children.

loans.use: To increase her business stock.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Filis Atemi

texts.en: Filis Atemi W. is 44 years of age, married and the mother of four children. She lives in Nambale, Busia district where she runs a clothing business alongside a poultry one. She started both businesses in the year 2000 in order to generate income.  She would like a loan of Kshs. 30,000 which will go towards restocking her clothing business. Her future dream is to expand her clothing business into wholesale and to build rental houses.

loans.use: To restock clothing.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adija Ambani

texts.en:
Adija Ambani A. sells fruit in Nambale market, Busia District. She says she started this business in the year 1983 as a source of income.  She buys her stock from Busia market twice a week.

She is married and lives with four of her grandchildren as their guardian. She would like a loan of KShs. 20,000 which will go towards increasing her stock and the other part of the money will go to a poultry investment group project.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and invest in a poultry project.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Berta

texts.en:
Berta D. is a grocery business woman in Nambale market, Busia District. She started this business back in 1986 after quiting her fish business.  Benta is a jovial woman, 40 years of age, married and the mother of six children.

Benta buys her stock twice a week from Chwale town. She would like a loan of Kshs. 10,000 which will go to expanding her grocery business by increasing stock.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Judith Sakina

texts.en:
Judith Sakina L. is a poultry farmer in Manyole, Busia District, Kenya. She started her business in 2008 as a source of income generation after having lost her job. She is a also a mother of 6 children and married.

Judith would like a loan of KShs. 20,000 which will go to constructing new poultry structures to expand her business. Her future plan is to venture into raising goats.

loans.use: To build poultry Structure.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hassan Namatsi

texts.en:
Hassan Namatsi A. is famer in Nambale, Busia District. He ventured into the farming business in 2009 from a construction job. He buys his farm stock from Eldoret twice a year in tandem with the seasons of the year. 

Hassan is 52 years old, married and a proud father of 7 children. He would like a loan of Kshs. 20,000 to expand his business. He says this will go a long way in ensuring education for his children and guaranteeing his dream of doing so.

loans.use: Expand Farming Business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evans Thomas

texts.en:
Evans Thomas N. is 40 years in age, married and a father of five children. He is a resident of Manyole Division, Busia District. Evans runs a dairy farming business at his homestead. He started this back in 2006 as a source to generate extra income. He sells his milk twice daily; in the morning and in the evening. 

Evans would like a loan of Kshs. 20,000 which he intends to use to acquire feed, pesticide and vaccination drugs for the dairy cattle. His future dream is to buy more dairy cattle and expand his farm.

loans.use: Acquire feed for cattle and vaccination expenses.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Phidelis

texts.en:
Phidelis Wambane is a retail shop owner in Nambale town, Busia district. She is 49 years old, married and a mother of 5 children. She is also a former nurse who opted to go into business. Her retail shop buys stock for sale three times a week from truck that deliver goods at Nambale.

Phidelis is very passionate about business and already she is thinking of venturing into the poultry farming business. She would like a loan of Kshs. 10,000 which will kick start her poultry. Part of the money would go to expanding the retail store stock. In the future, Phidelis would like to start a tailoring business.

loans.use: Venture into Poultry Farming.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alex Nyongesa

texts.en:
Alex Nyongesa M. is a poultry farmer. He lives in Lwanyange, Busia district. he is 45years old, married and blessed with 6 children. Fredrick believes poultry farming business is the new big business venture in Western Kenya, besides the cereals and sugarcane businesses.
He would like a loan of Kshs. 20,000 improve his poultry structure thus create room for more chicks.

loans.use: improve poultry structure

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Festus Baraza

texts.en:
Festus Baraza M. runs a hotel business. He started this business in January 2009 and he says it's already paying back. He also adds that he was never good with school, so business was the only way to go besides farming. Festus is 30 years old, married and the father of seven. 

He would like a loan of 20,000 KES which will go toward improving his business. Festus’ dream is to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: Improve hotel business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Severio Okello

texts.en:
Severio O. O. is in the cereals business. He specializes in selling maize. He started this business in January 2009. Severio is a former teacher, and his cereals business was his retirement project. He is 64 years of age, married and the father of ten. 

Severio would like a loan of 10,000 KES which is to be used for the expansion of his business by increasing his stock of cereals.

loans.use: to expand his business by increasing his stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Beatrice E.w

texts.en:
Beatrice E.W. Makuha is a cereals businesswoman. She started this in the year 1996 and has never looked back. She moves from market to market with her stock, but her chief locations are the Malanga and Lugulu markets. She says that within these two she has a guaranteed customer base. She buys her stock twice a week at Busia town. 

Beatrice would like a loan of 20,000 KES to expand her business. Her future plan is to venture into poultry farming.

loans.use: Expand her stock of cereals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Michael Onyangto

texts.en:
Michael Onyango Ong’ayi is involved in the construction business in Malanga, Busia district. At 39 years old, he is the proud owner of a small construction company which has its operations in Malanga, mainly. Before he started the business, he was chiefly into farming. Michael is married and the father of four children. 

He would like a loan of 20,000 KES to boost his expansion plan, which is already underway.

loans.use: resources for his construction business expansion..

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: John Omondi

texts.en:
John Omondi O. runs a hotel business in Malanga, Busia district. He is 40 years of age, married and the father of four. He started his business in 1996, immediately after his high school graduation. He is also a former waiter, which is where he got his motivation for the hotel business.

He would like a loan of 30,000 KES which will help to boost his hotel business. His future plan is to expand into a bigger premises and buy an oven.

loans.use: to boost his hotel business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alice Nabwire

texts.en:
Alice Nabwire O. is a 46-year-old woman who runs a fish business in the Malanga market, Busia district. She is married and the mother of five children. She started her fish business in 1996 as a source of income generation and a source for school fees for the children, she says. Her fish is bought twice a week from Port Victoria, about 80 kilometres from Malanga. 

She would like a loan of 20,000 KES which she says will go toward increasing her stock base. Her future plan is to venture into rental houses.

loans.use: Expand fish stock base.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Timothy Omong'ni

texts.en:
Timothy Omong’ini Barasa started his farm business in the year 1998 in Malanga, Busia district. He is a former accountant by profession, married and 70 years old. Timothy speaks with a passion for farming, and he says it’s the only way left to feed the family and the only way to make money for other daily needs at his home. 

He would like a loan of 20,000 KES which will go for hiring labor, expanding the farming area and acquiring seeds for the coming rain season.

loans.use: Expand farming business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick A. is 35 years old, married and the father of five children. He runs both a farming business and a restaurant business in Malanga, Busia district. Initially he was in the cereals business, but ventured into farming full time along with his restaurant business, due to the natural relationship between the two. 

He would like a loan of 20,000 KES which will go into the expansion of his restaurant, needed because of a rise in the number of customers, and also to acquire seeds for the coming rainy season.

loans.use: Expand restaurant business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Richard N.

texts.en:
Richard N. W. runs a timber business at Malanga centre, Busia district. He is 25 years of age, married and the father of two children. He started his business in 2008 after having been employed at a local sugar factory. He started his timber business as a source of income for his young family. 

He would like a loan of 20,000 KES to be used for increasing his stock of timber. His future plan is to guarantee education for his children and economic stability for his family.

loans.use: Increase timber stock.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Andrew Javan

texts.en:
Andrew Javan O. is a teacher in Malanga, Busia district. He runs a dairy farming business in Malanga and supplies milk to the surrounding villages. He is 50 years old, married, and the father of six children.

Andrew would like a loan of KES 30,000 which will go to expanding his dairy business by acquiring another dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hesborn Joseph

texts.en:
Hesborn Joseph O. is a retail shop owner in Malanga, Busia district. From farming, he started this business in 1999 as a source of income generation for him and his family. He is married and blessed with four children.

Hesborn Joseph buys his stock from Busia once a week. He would like a loan of KES 20,000 which will be used to restock his shop.

loans.use: To restock his retail store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margaret Achieng

texts.en:
Margaret Achieng O. started doing business in 1987. Her first business was selling groundnuts (peanuts) to locals in Malanga, Busia district where she lives. She is currently running a cereals business selling maize and buys her stock from Uganda once every two weeks.

Margaret Achieng would like a loan of KES 10,000 which will go to expanding her business by increasing her stock.

loans.use: To increase her stock of maize

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fredrick Asuka

texts.en:
Fredrick Asuka O. is a poultry farmer who lives in Lwanyange, Busia district. He is 45 years old, married, and is blessed with six children.

Fredrick believes the poultry-farming business is the new big business venture in Western Kenya, besides the cereals and sugarcane businesses.

Fredrick would like a loan of KES 10,000 which will go towards the expansion of his poultry structure thus creating room for more chicks which means the expansion of his business.

loans.use: To expand his poultry building

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Charles Muyodi
