texts.en:
Charles Muyodi N. is a cereals business person in Malanga, Busia district. He has been a farmer for over ten years and started his cereals business in January 2009. He buys his cereal stock from Uganda twice a week. This is easy since Busia district borders the Ugandan Republic.

Charles Muyodi would like a loan of Kshs 20,000 which will partly go into the expansion of his cereals business and partly to farm preparation.

loans.use: To expand his business and prepare his farmland

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Everlyne Baraza

texts.en:
Everlyne Baraza A. is a 37 year old woman who is married and is the mother of six children. She is a farmer in Nambale, Busia district.

Before she ventured into farming as a business, Everlyne was solely a housewife, she says. She started farming so as to be part of the breadwinning team in her family.

Everlyne would like a loan of KES 10,000 that will go to expanding her farm business.

loans.use: To expand her farming business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces.
Felicitas es casada, tiene 58 años y 4 hijos, Felicitas tiene un puesto en el mercado artesanal D. la ciudad en donD. venD. artesanías variadas, además junto a su familia se dedica a la elaboración D. tejidos en telar como tapetes, pasadizos.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo D. 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cerámicas.
Felicitas sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the community bank "Los Sauces." She is married, is 58 years old, and has 4 children. Felicitas has a stall in the artisanal market in the city where she sells a variety of handicrafts. In addition, along with her family, she creates fabrics on the loom, such as rugs and carpets.

Felicitas seeks this loan of 1250 Soles to invest in the purchase of ceramics. She hopes to proviD. a good education for her children and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ceramics

loans.name: María Nela

texts.es:
La señora Maria Nela Martinez V. tiene 34 años de edad,  casada, Madre de tres niños, dos de ellos en edad escolar, comerciante desde hace  nueve años su negocio lo tiene ubicado a cuatro cuadras del Mercado central, ahi ella alquila ese local.
La señora V. anteriormente era ama de casa pero con el tiempo le fue gustando el trabajo de su esposo y ahora los dos administran ese negocio, habren el negocio a las ocho y media de la mañana y lo cierran alas cinco y media de la tarde de lunes a sabados.
Tiene cinco años de trabajar con ceprodel, este financiamiento ella lo necesitaba para comprar fertilizantes que ya no tenia en existencia en su negocio. Ella se esfuerza bastante en su negocio para sacar adelane a sus hijos y su vida personal.
texts.en:
Maria Nela Martinez V. is 34 years old. She is married and is the mother of three children, two of whom are school-aged. She has had her business for 9 years in a rented space 4 blocks from the central market.

Before, she was housewife, but with time she began enjoying her husbands work and now they both work together, opening the business at 8 a.m. and closing at 5 p.m. from Monday to Saturday.

She has worked with Ceprodel for 5 years. She seeks this loan to purchase fertilizers that her business doesn't currently sell. She works hard at her business so that she can create a better life for her children and for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers, insecticides, and fumigation spray

loans.name: Necida

texts.es:
Necida es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces.
Necida es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 1 hijo, Necida vende ropa variada a pedido, sus ventas los realiza a amigo y familiares, además Necida tiene una polleria en su casa actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 2 personas.
Necida necesita un préstamo de 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, buzos.
Los sueños de Necida son tener ahorros para la educación de su hijo y una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Necida is a member of the community bank "Los Sauces." She is in a common law marriage, is 35 years old, and has one son. She makes and sells a variety of clothes to-order to friends and family members. She also sells chicken from her home seven days a week with the help of two other people.

Necida seeks this loan of 750 Soles in order to invest in the purchase of polo shirts and sweatshirts. She dreams of saving money for her son's education and to open her own clothing shop.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of polo shirts and sweatshirts

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces.
Marina es soltera, tiene 34 años y 1 hijo, Marina tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días, además vende golosinas, artículos de escritorio, brinda servicios de fotocopiadora en el mismo local.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de accesorios para computadora.
Los sueños de Marina son ahorrar lo suficiente para su hijo y ampliar su local.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the communal bank called Los Sauces. She is 34 years old and raising her one son on her own. Marina runs an internet cafe from her home. In addition to selling internet access, she also sells sweet drinks, office supplies, and offers a photocopying service. Marina needs a loan to purchase computer accessories for her business. Her dream is to be able to save enough money to take good care of her son and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase computer accessories for her business

loans.name: Julie

texts.es:
Julie es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces.
Julie es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Julie junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de caña, producto que distribuyen a diferentes tiendas, su producto lo adquieren en la ciudad de Andahuaylas.
Julie necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de caña.
Los sueños de Julie son tener una tienda de abarrotes y casa propia.
texts.en:
Julie is a member of the communal bank called Los Sauces. She is 42 years old and married with 3 children. Julie and her husband have a business selling cane, a product they distribute to various shops. They buy the cane in the city of Andahuaylas. She needs a loan to purchase more cane. Her dream is to set up a small general store and to have their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more cane for her business

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Argentina Sanchez tiene un cafetin en una cooperativa de taxis, tiene 16 años de administrarlo en el vende comida y refrescos, gaseosas, golosinas ella solicito este financiamiento por que necesitaba surtir su negocio para poder ofrecerles a los cientes el producto que ellos mas buscan, la señora Sanchez tiene 56 años de edad sus hijos ya estan casados, ella no tiene a nadie mas a sus cargo solo vive con su esposo que el trabaja en un taxi propio.
Siempre ha trabajado  pero antes era ama de casa, cocia, rremendaba ropa que le llevaban en la actualidad   lleva con ceprodel tres años de estar trabajando abre su negocio a las seis de la mañana mi casa pasa sola ya que ella se mantiene todo el día en el  cafetin, le gusta tener su propio negocio
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina Sanchez has a small cafe located inside of a taxi cooperative. She's been running her small restaurant for 16 years. Rosa is requesting this loan to stock her cafe with a greater variety of the things her customers want. She is 56 years old and her children are already married and independent. She lives with her husband, who drives his own taxi. She says that she has always worked, but before she had her business, she was a housewife, cooking and mending clothing. She's been with Ceprodel for 3 years, and she opens her cafe at 6am every day. Rosa says she likes having her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sodas, cooking oil, rice, beans, and other products for her small restaurant.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jose es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces.
Jose es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Jose vende artefactos pequeños, edredones, ollas de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes, también viaja a otras provincias a comercializar sus productos.
Jose necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas y cubrecamas.
Los sueños de Jose son vender por mayor y brindar un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose is a member of the community bank "Los Sauces." He is 35 years old and is married with two children. He sells small items, comforters, and pots, made-to-order for his clients. He also travels to other provinces to sell his products.

Jose seeks this loan of 2000 Soles to invest in the purchase of pots and bedspreads. Jose dreams of selling his items wholesale and securing a better future for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pots and bedspreads

loans.name: Erlinda Isabel

texts.es: La señora Erlinda Isabel C. U.  tiene un negocio en el Mercado central de venta de verduras y frutas con 10 años de experiencia es Madre soltera de tres hijos solo el pequeño en edad escolar, la señora C. U. solicito financiamiento por que deseaba surtir su negocio mas ahorita que para ella es temporada buena por verano,  empieza a vender a las seis y media de la mañana se esfuerza en su negocio para sacar adelante a su ultimo hijo
texts.en:
Erlinda Isabel C. U. sells fruits and vegetables in the central market, and has done so for the last 10 years. She is a single mother of three children. The youngest is school-aged.

She seeks this loan because she would like to stock her business as the summer is a good season. She begins selling at 6:30 a.m. She works this hard in her business so that she can help her youngest child advance.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nadia

texts.es:
Nadia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces.
Nadia es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Nadia junto a su esposo se dedican al transporte de carga, tiene 2 carros, Nadia se encarga de las cobranzas.
Nadia necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de combustible.
Nadia sueña con ampliar su empresa, construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nadia is a member of the community bank "Los Sauces." She is 30 years old, and is married with two children. Nadia and her husband work in cargo transportation, and they have 2 vehicles. Nadia is in charge of collecting the funds.

She seeks this loan of 1250 Soles to invest in the purchase of fuel. Nadia dreams of growing her business, constructing her home, and providing a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fuel

loans.name: Sandra María

texts.es:
La señora Sandra María G. tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos el cual tiene desde hace cuatro años en el mercado central de Chinandega. Vende shampoo, gelatinas para el cabello, talco para bebes,jabones, entre otros.También ella vende otros productos como cuadernos, lápices y mochilas.

Es madre de un niño de tres años y su conyuge le ayuda a atender el negocio. La razón por la que está solicitando el crédito es para la compra de cosméticos para la venta. Es por esta razón que está solicitando el crédito para surtir sus estantes y también comprará los utiles escolares como cuadernos, lápices y mochilas.

Espera que el crédito sea otorgado para así invertirlo a lo inmediato en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra María G. B. has had a business in the Mercado for four years. She sells a little bit of everything: toys, shampoo, hair gel, baby powder, records, notebooks, pencils, backpacks, etc. She has a three-year-old son. Her partner helps her see to the business. She used to work in Costa Rica with her husband, and they decided to save up to start their own business like all the boy's family. Now, she has her own business. Thanks to the funding Ceprodel has given them, her inventory has grown quite a lot. She requested this funding because she needed to supply her business more and buy school supplies for the beginning of classes.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora María de Jesús L. G. es Madre de tres hijos de estado civil casada, tiene una tienda cerca del Mercado central y otra en su casa de habitación que se la administra su esposo, en estas tiendas ella vende lo que es ropa para dama y para caballero de marcas finas, ropa para niños y otros productos para tiernos que ella misma los elabora.
Ella tiene 10 años de tener esta tienda pero primero quien puso la tienda fue el esposo con capital de ambos luego decidió poner una de niño pero cerca del mercado en esta ella alquila una pieza y empezó a hacer decorar artículos para tiernos, tiene dos trabajadores con ella, abren el negocio a las ocho de la mañana y lo cierra a las seis de la tarde ella se esfuerza por tener su negocio con bastante mercadería ya que de este sustenta su hogar y sus dos niños.
La señora L. G. tiene tres años de trabajar con estos financiamientos y ella manifiesta que le gustan bastante por que le dan la oportunidad de mantener su inventario y darle vuelta a su inventario rápido con tasa de interés bastante cómodas y el personal bien amable.
texts.en:
Mrs. María de Jesús L. G. is the mother of three children and she is married. She has a store in the Central Market and another one in the house where she lives which is administered by her husband. In these stores she sells fine brand clothing for women, men and children, as well as other baby products that she makes. She has had the store for 10 years; however, her husband was the first one to establish the store with capital from both of them. She then decided to setup a store for children but closer to the market where she rents a space; she started making decorated articles of clothing for babies. She has two people working with her; they open the business at 8:00 am and they close at 6:00 pm. She works hard to keep her business with plenty of merchandise, since it provides support for her home and children. Mrs. L. G. has been working with these loans for 3 years, and she expresses that she likes them a lot because they give her the opportunity to maintain her inventory and turn it fast; she also likes the comfortable interest rates and the staff is nice.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes, shoes and materials to make products for babies (e.g., diaper bag)

loans.name: Ana Basilia

texts.es:
La Señora Ana Basilia R. es madre de cinco hijos todos en edad escolar, tiene un tramo ubicado en el sector Madera del mercado central, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio el elabora parte de los productos que ella vende en su negocio, también ella vende piñatas que ella misma elabora.
La señora R. tiene tres años de trabajar con ceprodel ella nos comenta que le gusta trabajar con estos financiamientos ya que le ayuda bastante a surtir su negocio y a sacar adelante a sus hijos ella y su esposo son personas trabajadores luchadoras por el pan de cada día y por llevarles el sustenta a su hogar.
Viene a vender a las ocho de la mañana y lo cierra hasta que cierran el mercado diario hasta los domingos tienen un taller en su casa y ellos elaboran roperos, chineros, gaveteros sencillos. Este financiamiento ella lo solicito por que a ella le gusta trabajar con nosotros ya que le facilitamos el crédito rápido a corto plazo y con un interés bajo y necesitaba comprar una Madera que le vendían barata.
texts.en:
Ana Basilia R. is the mother of five school-age children. She has a stall located in the Madera (wood) sector of the central market. Her husband helps her with the business; he makes some of the products that she sells in her business. She also sells piñatas that she makes herself. Mrs. R. has been working with Ceprodel for three years. She tells us that she likes to work with this funding since it helps her to supply her business and to help her children move forward. She and her husband are determined people who work hard for their daily bread and work hard to support their household. She opens the stall at eight in the morning and closes it when the market closes everyday, even on Sundays. They have a workshop at home, and they make simple wardrobes, china cupboards and dressers. She requested this funding because she likes to work with us since we quickly issue her short-term credit with a low interest rate, and she needed to buy some wood that was being sold cheap.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood products (wheels, cradles, handicraft products, etc.)

loans.name: Ester Beatriz

texts.es: La señora Ester vive en un barrio de la capital que se llama 380. Tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, su negocio es un cafetín que tiene en su casa de habitación vende hot dog, hamburguesa, repostería, frescos, gaseosas, jugos, café y alquila teléfono, pues gracias a Dios ha ido incrementando su negocio ahora con ayuda de sus dos hijos que están trabajando y que ha logrado hacer clientela. Con el préstamo anterior logro comprar dos puertas para la sala. Ahora desea comprar materiales de soldadura y poder poner el portón de metal en la entrada de su casa para reguardar la seguridad, ya que la delincuencia asecha en el barrio, lo cual es una necesidad el poder terminar esta obra. Sus planes a corto plazo es poder hacer aparte el local para el cafetín ya que desde la cocina de su casa despacha lo cual desea dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Y espera lograrlo con los financiamiento que Afodenic otorgue
texts.en:
Mrs. Ester lives in a neighborhood called 380 in the capital city. She is 61 years old and the single mother of three children. Her business is an eatery setup in her house. She sells hot dogs, hamburgers, pastries, drinks, sodas, juices, coffee and also rents her phone. Thank God, her business has been growing with help form two of her children and they have many customers. With the previous loan, she was able to buy two doors for her living room. Now she wishes to buy welding materials to build a metal gate at the entrance of her house to improve her security; since crime threatens the neighborhood, completing this work is a necessity. Her short-term goals are to build a separate space for her eatery (since she now cooks in her home’s kitchen) and provide better service for her customers. She hopes to accomplish her goals with the loan granted by Afodenic.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy welding materials to build a gate at the main entrance of her house

loans.name: German Antonio

texts.es: El señor German tiene la edad de 49 años de edad, vive en un barrio Hialeah, junto a su familia con tres hijos los cuales estudian, junto a su esposa se han esforzado para dar a sus hijos una vivienda, la cual la han logrado hacer toda de concreto, su esposa trabaja como domestica para poder apoyar  a sus hijos ya que todo esta caro y solo con el sueldo de el no nos alcanza. Don German trabaja como  conductor desde hace ocho años, cuando inicio comenzó en la empresa como vigilante pero luego le dieron el puesto de conductor en donde devenga un salario mejor, la empresa que trabaja se llama Xochiquetzal en donde trabajan con programas sociales y tiene que viajar a los diferentes departamentos del pais. Con este financiamiento quiere entechar la parte del caraje para hacer un cuarto y gastar menos ya que tiene casi cerrado para esta obra comprara: zinc, perlines, arena, cemento, para comenzar la construcción el cual si no le ajusta el dinero espera ir terminándolo poco a poco oh con el siguiente financiamiento que le den ya que para el se le hace difícil poder construir por que no le alcanza el dinero. Es por eso que  se ha beneficiado con estos préstamos de Afodenic ya que puede pagar en plazos de nueve a doce meses en donde la cuota se le hace baja y accesible para su bolsillo.
texts.en:
German is 49 years old and lives with his wife in a neighborhood called Hialeah. Their 3 children attend school. German and his wife have worked hard to provide a home for their children. His wife works as a maid to help support the children, as everything is so expensive and German's salary is not enough to cover their costs. For 8 years, he's worked as a driver for a company. When he started out, he worked as a security guard, but later they gave him a job as a driver and a better salary. German works for a company called Xochiquetzal, and he has to travel to many areas of the country. With this loan, he would like to buy materials such as zinc, sand, and cement, so that little by little, he can make repairs on their home. It's difficult to do this work because there is not enough money. He has benefited from the Afodenic loans, which he can pay in installments from 9 to 12 months, making it possible for him to pay the money back.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase zinc, sand and cement to make repairs on their home

loans.name: Eusebia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia del Carmen L. L., es madre soltera, comerciante desde hace 14 años, tiene a su cargo tres hijos, su tramo esta ubicado en el mercado central, abre el negocio a la seis de la mañana y lo cierra a las cinco de la tarde hasta los domingos, a veces le Viene ayudar uno de sus hijos, ella inicio su negocio con ayuda de su hijo el mayor que esta fuera del país.
Antes mi negocio se veía pequeño por que casi no tenia inventario pero ahora lo he acondicionado bastante con los financiamientos que ceprodel me a brindado, ahora tengo mas inventario, gracias a Dios a los financiamientos que me han otorgado y a mi negocio hemos podido salir adelante.
texts.en:
Senora Eusebia is a single mother of 3 children and has run her own shop in the central market for 14 years. She opens the shop at 6am and closes at 5pm every day except Sunday. Sometimes one of her children help her with the business. She began this business with the help of her oldest son, who is outside of the country. Eusebia says that her business used to be much smaller because she never had enough inventory. With the help of the Ceprodel loans she has been able to grow. She says she now has more inventory, and thanks God for the loans she's been given, which have enabled her to continue.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, corn, and other products for her small store

loans.name: Juan Rafael

texts.es: El señor Juan tiene la edad de 44 años, habitante del barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, casado, con dos hijos estudiantes, su esposa trabaja de secretaria en el ministerio de educación. Don Juan se desempeña como contador,  desde hace veinte años, el cual logro terminar una carrera técnica debido a que sus padres eran de pocos recursos económicos. Para el ha sido difícil poder terminar su casa ya que ahorrando junto con su esposa lograron comprar un terreno en donde han venido construyendo poco apoco, aun le falta levantar las paredes totalmente de su vivienda, como hacer baño y el inodoro ya que no están en las mejores condiciones de higiene pero le ha sido difícil poder hacerlo ya que todo esta caro y a pesar de su salario fijo de ambos se le ha hecho dificultoso ya que la canasta básica esta muy costosa. Es por eso la necesidad de este financiamiento para poder terminar de cerrar su casa y hacer el baño que le urge ante de la temporada de invierno. Lo que mas quisiera es poder terminar su carrera en la universidad para poder tener mejores beneficios en su trabajo. Da las gracias a la institución por dar este financiamiento el cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, piedrin, tablas, clavos entre otros y poder comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Juan is 44 years old and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of the capital, Managua. He is married and has 2 children who are both students. His wife works as a secretary in the Ministry of Education. Juan has worked as an account for 20 years. He was only able to finish technical studies because his parents had few financial resources. It has been difficult to finish building his house. He and his wife saved enough to buy land where they have been constructing their home little by little. They have yet to complete the walls and the bathroom, which aren't in the best condition. But it has been difficult to do this because everything is very expensive. Despite their salaries, the cost of living is very high. This is why Juan needs financing to finish his house and bathroom before winter. What he would like most is to be able to finish his studies at a university level, which would allow him to get more out of his career. He thanks the institution for this financing, with which he will buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, gravel, tiles, and nails, among other materials. He will now be able to finish building his home.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, gravel, tiles, and nails to finish construction on home.

loans.name: Nidia Lucia

texts.es: Doña Nidia tiene 55 años de edad, ha sido una madre de familia muy dedicada al trabajo para poder apoyar  sus tres hijos, los cuales cursan sus estudios, desde hace varios años se dedica ala venta de ropa, cosméticos,  ropa interior, trabaja con la Avon algunos por encargo y siempre mantiene productos, en estos últimos meses le ha tocado colocar parte de la mercadería, pero no se deja de vender, da al crédito de la quincena y al contado. Sus planes es invertir en cosmético como: cremas para cuerpo, cutis, perfumes para dama y caballeros, estuches de sombra, pintura de labios, maquillaje, vanidades, medias para damas, comprar ropa variada para niño y damas y poder aumentar su inventario para aumentar las  ventas. Lo que quiere hacer a futuro es comprar vitrina para poder ofertar mejor  sus productos ya que tiene sus cosméticos en el mueble de la sala el cual será para ella una buena inversión para su negocio que espera con el apoyo de la institución lograr.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nidia is 55 years old and has been a housewife dedicated to the work of supporting her three children which go to school. For many years now, she has been selling clothes, cosmetics, and underwear. She also works with Avon products; she sells to order but she also maintains some stock; in the last few months she has had to invest to buy some merchandise, but the products continue to sell; she sells on a two-week credit or cash, Her plan is to invest in cosmetics such as body lotions, face creams, perfumes, colognes, eye shadow, lipsticks, make-up, and compacts; also stockings, assorted clothes for children and women; she wants to increase her inventory to increase her sales. In the future, she wants to buy a display cabinet to present her products better since she how keeps her cosmetics on the living room furniture; this will be a good investment for her business that she hopes to accomplish with the support from this organization.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics such as body lotions, face creams, perfumes, colognes, eye shadow, lipsticks, make-up, and compacts; also stockings, assorted clothes for children and women

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Es Sr. Víctor Manuel Q. trabaja en una fabrica en la elaboración de puros de tabaco en el Municipio de Condega. El solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de ladrillos para piso ya que esta terminado de construir su propia casa.

Este cliente tiene aproximadamente 4 años de trabaja en esta fabrica de puro, empieza sus labores desde la 7 de la mañana y las finaliza a las 5 de la tarde de los días lunes hasta el medio día del sábado.

El Sr. V. es casado y no tienen hijo. El espera que con la compra de los materiales de construcción como son los ladrillos para piso llevar a cabo casi en su totalidad la construcción de su casa de habitación la que ha construido con su propio esfuerzo y el de su esposa. 

Este ese el crédito numero 3 que el Sr. V. ha tenido en Ceprodel en un periodo de 2 años. Estos créditos le han beneficiado positivamente ya que el no cuenta con los ingresos suficiente para financiar la construcción de su vivienda por lo que a través de dichos créditos ha logrado su metas con es la de una casa propia.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel Q. works in a factory in the municipality of Condega that produces cigars from the Tabasco region. He is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to purchase bricks for the floor of the house he is building. This client has worked in the factory for about 4 years. He works from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m., from Monday to midday Saturday. Mr. V. is married and doesn't have any children. With the purchase of construction materials, such as bricks for flooring, he hopes to complete construction on the house that he and his wife have been building through their own hard work. This is the third loan that Mr. V. has had with Ceprodel over the course of 2 years. These loans have positively impacted him since he doesn't have enough income to finance construction on his house. Through these loans he has achieved his goal of owning a home.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bricks and cement for flooring.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Antonio V. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo a poner el techo en una parte de su casa. 
Nuevamente esta solicitando su cooperación para este nuevo crédito, para colocar el techo de madera en mejor condición  poner el techo en la otra parte de la cocina y salas de la casa.
Planea pagar el crédito con una partes del ingreso es el que obtiene de árbitro en un campo de deportes, ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Antonio V. is grateful for your cooperation in the previous loan. It helped him put a roof over a part of his house. He is asking for your cooperation again for this new loan to place a wooden roof in better condition; to put on a roof on the other part of the kitchen and rooms of the house. He plans on paying for the loan with parts of his income he receives as a referee at the sports field. This is his family's source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of the wooden roof

loans.name: Petrona Ermelinda

texts.es:
La Sra., Ermelinda Calderón es comerciante del Municipio de Condega, ella se dedica a atender su negocio, es una pequeña farmacia de medicinas naturales en este mismo Municipio.

Ella solicita este crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de de comprar material como es el Zinc para mejorar las condiciones del techo de su pequeña empresa. Con este mejoramiento ella tiene como proyecto seguir mejorando y así ir prosperando para una mejor atención a su clientela. Ella empezó este negocio hace 15 años, comienza diariamente con sus labores a la 8 de la mañana y atiende hasta las 4 de la tarde de lunes a sábado. Ella es soltera y no tiene hijos.

Ella espera que una ves aprobado el crédito en Ceprodel llevar a cabo el mejoramiento de su vivienda y así seguirá futuramente hasta haber completado totalmente el mejoramiento.

Este es el crédito numero cinco que tiene en Ceprodel en un ciclo de 6 años con el que espera cumplirsu proyecto y es importante señalar que ella expresa que con dichos financiamiento ha logrado mantener su sacar adelante su negocio ya que ha permitido irlo ampliando y  ofrecer productos mas completo que satisfagan la demanda.
texts.en:
Hermelinda Calderón is a businesswoman in the Condega municipality. She runs her business, a small pharmacy with natural medicines, in the same municipality. She is asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy material like zinc to improve the conditions of the roof of her small business. With this improvement, which is her project, she will continue improving. She will prosper by giving her customers better attention. She started her business 15 years ago. She starts her work everyday at eight in the morning. She works until four in the afternoon from Monday through Saturday. She is single, and she has no children. She expects that, once the loan is approved by Ceprodel, she will carry out the improvement on her house. That way she will continue on until she has completely finished the improvement. This is her fifth loan with Ceprodel in a period of six years. She expects to finish her project. It is important to point out that she says that with these loans she has been able to maintain and get ahead in her business. They have allowed her to expand and offer more complete products that satisfy her customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy metal sheeting

loans.name: Margarita Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Margarita J. es comerciante del mercado central de Chinandega desde hace quince años donde tiene un negocio de venta de productos de uso doméstico como productos de madera como sillas, ollas de aluminio, perchas, entre otros.

Es madre de tres niños, dos en edad escolar, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo ya que el también trabaja en un taller. Es importante destacar que ella y su esposo se esfuerzan por sacar adelante a sus hijos y que no les falte nada y puedan tener comida y techo donde vivir.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de los productos de uso doméstico tanto de madera y de aluminio para así ofrecerlos en el negocio y obtener los ingresos para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Margarita Verónica J. G. has been a businesswoman in this market for 15 years. She has a business selling various products like glasses, plates, aluminum pots, wood chairs, and hangers, etc. She has three children; two are school-age. She has her husband’s support because he also works in a shop. She has worked with Ceprodel for three years. She and her husband put forth great effort to get their children ahead and to make sure they do not need anything (food, a roof over their heads). She opens her business at nine in the morning, and she closes it at four in the afternoon everyday, even on Sundays. She always takes money out to invest in her business. She takes advantage of paying in cash and is able to get reductions and discounts.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy aluminum pots and plastic products

loans.name: Caridad Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Caridad R. A. es una comerciante del Municipio de Condega, donde ella alquila módulos a otros comerciantes.

Ella solicita este crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de unas láminas de de gypsun para realizar unas divisiones en su casa y así tener más módulos y por ende alquilarlos. 

Ella empieza este negocio con la necesidad de obtener mejores ingresos y decide hacer varias divisiones en una parte de su casa la cual es muy amplia y alquilarlos a comerciantes que no tienes donde establecer sus negocios, estos módulos han tenido muy buena aceptación pues se encuentra en una parte céntrica de este municipio. Cabe señalar que ella ha tenido este negocio dese hace 12 años y recibe por ellas cuotas mensuales. La Sra. Caridad es una mujer casada, profesional, contadora y tiene 5 hijos los que son totalmente independiente y también se dedica al cuidado de su mama que es una Sra. De bastante edad.
texts.en:
Caridad R. A. is a businesswoman in the Condega municipality. She rents modules to other business people. She is asking Ceprodel for this loan to buy some gypsum sheeting to make divisions in her house. That way she will have more modules, which she will rent. She started this business with the need to get better income. She decided to make various divisions in a part of her house, which is quite large. She rents the units to business people who do not have a place to establish their businesses. These modules have been very well accepted; the location is in the central part of this municipality. She has had the business for 12 years, and she receives monthly payments. Caridad is married, professional, and an accountant. She has five children, and they are all completely independent. She also takes care of her mother who is quite elderly.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gypsum sheeting

loans.name: Leonardo De La Concepción

texts.es:
El Señor Leonardo de la Concepción M. es cliente activo de este mercado desde hace 20 años tiene un negocio de venta de productos ferreteros y conforme a las temporadas le mete a su negocio diferentes productos para aprovechar las ventas.
El señor M., es casado solo tiene un hijo a su cargo y su esposa, trabaja fuertemente desde las siete de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde diario para llevar el sustenta a su casa.
Este financiamiento ella lo Saco para surtir su tramo de mochilas de diferentes estilos ya que empezaba la temporada de clase.
texts.en:
Leonardo de la Concepción Murguía has been an active client in this market for 20 years. He has a business selling hardware products. He carries different seasonal products in his business to take advantage of the sales. Mr. M. is married and is raising one child. He and his wife work very hard everyday from seven in the morning until five in the afternoon to support the household. This loan is to stock his backpack shop with different styles now that the school season has started.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hardware products and backpacks for classes

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora María Auxiliadora L. tiene 55 años edad madre soltera tiene un hijo a su cargo por el cual ella se esfuerza en su negocio trabajándolo de lunes a domingos de seis y media de la mañana a cinco de la tarde para sacarlo adelante.
La señora L. antes de tener su negocio era ama de casa, pero mi hijo que esta fuera del país me brindo una ayuda económicamente y decidí poner mi negocio de venta de frescos y pan con mantequilla, ahora en mi tramo vendo papeles de regalos, gaseosas, productos Diana agua helada.
Tiene cuatro años de trabajar con nosotros en los cuales los financiamientos que ella ha solicitado es para surtir su negocio, comprando mercadería a precios cómodos no agarrando créditos a proveedores
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora L., age 55, is a single mother with one child. Her child is why she puts forth great effort in her business. She works from Monday to Sunday from six thirty in the morning until five in the afternoon to get her child ahead. Mrs. L. was a housewife before she had this business. Her son, who is outside of the country, gave her economic support. She decided to set up her business of selling refreshments and bread and butter. Now she sells gift paper, soft drinks, Diana products, and chilled water in her small shop. She has worked with us for four years. The loans she has requested in that time have been to stock her store. She buys merchandise at good prices and does not take loans from the providers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and costume jewelry

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Benito S. le esta haciendo falta reparar el techo ya que esta en muy malas condiciones. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de rapare el techo ya que tiene miedo que les pueda pasar algo a su familia.
Don Benito trabaja para una agencia aduanal en el departamento  de administración, con una parte de este ingreso planea pagar el crédito.
El señor Benito ya ha tenido tres préstamos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente.  
Las personas que aparecen en la foto es una de las hijas del señor y sus nietos quienes viven en la casa, ya que el señor Benito se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
The roof of Benito S.’s house needs repair because it is in very bad condition. He is asking for a loan to be able to buy the material and pay the person to make the repairs because he is afraid that something could happen to his family. Benito works for a customs agency in the administration department. He plans on using part of his earnings to pay the loan. Benito has had three loans with FVP, which he has paid back punctually. The people in the photo are one of his daughters and his grandchildren, who live in his house. Benito was working on the day of the visit.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel the roof

loans.name: Carlos Benito

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 59 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada con una de sus hijas y su nieto. Carlos 
de dedica a la ventas,  en su bodega. El inicio el negocio con un capital pequeño obtenido 
a través de sus ahorros y créditos, el negocio lo tiene hace 3 años y hace 2 años 
comenzo con la  venta de pan teniendo buena acogida e incrementando sus ingresos. Carlos 
atiende el negocio de manera amable y amena lo que ha permitido fidelizar a sus 
clientes, Carlos viene apoyando a su hija en la educación de su nieto, ya que ella es 
madre soltera, el sueño de Carlos es que su hija pueda tener su casa propia y que su 
nieto tenga una mejor educación,por ello requiere el crédito para comprar su mercaderia e iniciar con la campaña escolar.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 59, lives in a rented house with one of his daughters and his grandson. Carlos works in sales in his convenience store. He started the business with a small amount of money he had through savings and loans. He has had the business for three years. Two years ago he started selling bread. That was well received and increased his earnings. Carlos takes care of his business in a friendly and pleasant way. That has allowed him to gain loyal customers. Carlos is helping his daughter with the education of his grandson because she is a single mother. Carlos’s dream is that his daughter will be able to have her own house and that his grandson has a better education. To do so he needs a loan to buy merchandise and start off the school season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es:
Al negocio del señor Benjamín E. le está haciendo falta herramienta ya que le acaban de meter a su taller y le robaran su toda la herramienta del trabaja que tenia.
Ahora no tiene como terminar de reparar los carro que tiene que entregar es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo, para comprar la herramienta mas importante y si poder entregar los carro a tiempo. Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del taller de mecánica que tiene.
Don Benjamín ya ha tenido cuatro créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntualmente.
texts.en:
Benjamín E.’s business needs tools. They just entered his shop and stole all of the work tools that he had. Now he does not have a way to repair the cars that he has to repair and deliver. That is why he is asking for a loan to buy the most important tool. That way he will be able to deliver the cars on time. He plans to pay the loan with the earnings from the mechanic’s shop that he has. Benjamín has had four loans with FVP, which he paid punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a tool

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth de 52 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus 4 hijos; Lily (24), Alexandra (15), Axel (13) y Camila (8).
Desde muy joven aprendió el bordado en chompas y le gustó tanto que ahora este oficio es su mayor pasión. Para ello, compra chompas ya terminadas donde borda diferentes motivos o paisajes y luego las revende a un precio mayor. Elizabeth trabaja de manera independiente ofreciendo sus prendas a sus amigos y conocidos; estando muy satisfecha porque puede generarse buenas ganancias económicas.
Paralelamente vende productos de belleza de tres diferentes marcas reconocidas, y por ello también gana el dinero que le  permite cubrir los múltiples gastos del hogar. Ella refiere que sus actividades son tranquilas y las puede desarrollar cuando quiere y no tiene presión. 
Para el futuro, tiene planeado instalar un bazar donde pueda ofrecer sus productos y sus chompas de manera más estable, sin tener que salir a las calles.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y asegura será puntual en los pagos de cada una de sus cuotas, además no quiere quedar mal con las integrantes de su grupo porque todas son muy  responsables. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más chompas para bordarlas, además también comprará productos de belleza para revenderlos a mayor precio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52. She lives in her own house with her four children. Lily is 24, Alexandra is 15, Axel is 13, and Camila is 8. When she was very young she learned to embroider sweaters. She liked it so much that this craft is now her biggest passion. She buys finished sweaters and embroiders different motifs or scenery. She then resells them at a higher price. Elizabeth works in an independent manner offering her clothes to her friends and acquaintances. She is very satisfied because she is able to generate good earnings. She also sells three different well known brands of beauty products. With this she also earns the money that allows her to cover the many household expenses. She says that her activities are peaceful, and she is able to work at them when she wants without pressure. In the future she plans to set up a bazaar where she can sell her products and her sweaters in a more stable manner without having to go to the streets. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She guarantees that she will be punctual making each one of her payments. Also, she does not want to cause problems for the members of her group because they are all very responsible. The money she is now requesting will be used to buy more sweaters to embroider. Also, she will buy beauty products to resell at a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more sweaters to embroider

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina, de 46 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus 4 hijos: Jesús (24), Joseph (18), César (15) y Lidia (13).
Cada día es nueva jornada vendiendo de manera ambulante diferentes productos, los cuales varía de acuerdo a la temporada. Por ejemplo, durante la época escolar vende accesorios del uniforme escolar, y durante el verano vende lentes de sol. 
De esa manera se gana la vida caminando por las calles, lo que le gusta es que obtiene buenas ganancias y lo que le desagrada caminar todo el día bajo el intenso sol, además como ambulante debe ofrecer sus artículos con miedo que los policías que prohíben el comercio ambulante le decomisen su mercadería; pero aún así le gusta su trabajo porque le permite sustentar sus gastos familiares.
Como es una mujer muy trabajadora, para el futuro tiene planeado instalarse en un puesto fijo en algún centro comercial donde pueda ofrecer sus diferentes productos con mayor tranquilidad.

Este es el 6to préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere quedar mal con las integrantes de su grupo, pues quiere seguir progresando para cumplir con todos sus sueños. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para seguir vendiendo y ahorrar el dinero para su futuro puesto.
texts.en:
Ernestina is 46, and she lives in her own house with her four children. Jesús is 24, Joseph is 18, César is 15, and Lidia is 13. Each day is a new journey selling different products, which vary according to the season, as a traveling salesperson. For example, during the school season she sells school uniform accessories. During the summer she sells sunglasses. This is the way she earns a living walking up and down the streets. What she likes is that she gets good earning. What she does not like is walking all day underneath the hot sun. Also, when she sells on the street she is fearful that the police that prohibit street selling will confiscate her merchandise. Even so, she likes her work because it allows her to pay the family expenses. As a very hard-working woman, in the future she plans to set herself up in a fixed stand in a commercial center where she can sell her different products with greater tranquility. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She promises to be punctual with her payments because she does not want to cause problems for the members of the group. She wants to keep progressing in order to make all of her dreams come true. The money she is now requesting is to buy merchandise to keep selling and saving the money for a future stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 45 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Marco (50) y sus dos hijos; Bárbara (19) e Isaías (7).
Desde muy joven le gustó preparar distintos tipos de comidas y postres, lo que le sirvió para que desde hace 2 años empezara con el negocio de venta de comida en un puesto ubicado en uno de los mercados de su zona. Esta actividad la realiza con la ayuda de otra señora, y está muy satisfecha porque obtiene buenas ganancias cada día. Los productos que ofrece son queques, dulces, bebidas y otros comestibles. María quiere trabajar mientras tenga fuerzas, es por esta razón que luego de terminar con este trabajo, al caer la tarde, se dirige hacia otro puesto en otro mercado donde sigue vendiendo comida; es cansado, pero sabe que mientras pueda lo hará, ya que quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 
Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene pensado ampliar su negocio e instalar un restaurante, pues su sueño es llegar a tener una cadena de restaurantes en diferentes distritos de la ciudad.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente cada cuota, ya que quiere seguir accediendo a más prestamos en adelante. María tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de comestibles para abastecer sus negocios y ofrecer mayor variedad de platillos.
texts.en:
Maria is 45, and lives in her own home with her husband, Marco (50), and her two children Bárbara (19) and Isaías (7). Since she was very young she liked to make different types of food and desserts. This has helped her because 2 years go she began a business selling food in a stand in one of the markets in her area. She runs this business along with another woman and she is very happy because she makes good money every day. The products that she sells are muffins, sweets, drinks and other foods. Maria wants to work while she still has the strength. That is why after she finishes at this stand, she moves to another stand in the afternoons where she continues selling food. It’s tiring, but she knows that as long as she can, she will continue so that can give her family a better quality of life. And as an entrepreneur, in the future she would like to expand the business and set up a restaurant. Her dream is to end up with a chain of restaurants in different areas of the city. The is her first loan with MFP and she promises to be punctual with her payments because he would like to be able to access more loans in the future. Maria is planning on using the money to buy foodstuffs to supply her businesses and offer a greater variety of dishes. .

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products, ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemí, de 35 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su madre y sus 3 hijos: Zarai (9), David (6) y Jordi (5).
Desde hace un año, esta laboriosa mujer se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos comestibles en una pequeña tienda que implementó en su casa; para ello habilitó un espacio y en ese lugar atiende todos los días desde muy temprano.
Lo que más le agrada de esta actividad es que puede interactuar con sus vecinos y amigos y de esta manera no se le hace tan tedioso trabajar, además le genera buenas ganancias económicas que hasta el momento le han permitido sacar adelante a su familia.
Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca y gana muy bien por las ventas.
Para el futuro tiene planeado implementar una tienda más grande de comestibles donde tenga todo tipo de productos, una especie de minimarket donde pueda atender y administrar el negocio.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, como en las anteriores oportunidades lo ha hecho. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mercadería para su tienda y también productos de belleza para tenerlos almacenados y venderlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Noemí, 36 years of age, lives in her own house in the company of her mother and three children: Zarai (9), David (6) and Jordi (5). For a year now, this hard-working woman sells an assortment of groceries in a small store setup in her house; she set aside an area where helps her customers every day since early in the morning. What she enjoys the most from this business is that she can interact with her neighbors and friends, and she does not feel the work is boring; additionally, it generates good profits that have allowed her get ahead in life with her family. In parallel, she sells beauty products from a well-known brand and the profits from her sales are very good. In the future, she plans to setup a bigger grocery store with a big assortment of products, like mini super market where she can help the customers and manage the business. This is her sixth loan with MFP and promises to make her payments on time, as she did with the other loans. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy merchandise for her store, and beauty products which she will keep in stock and will sell them at a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar, de 35 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su pareja Ángel (38) y sus dos pequeños  hijos; Jocelyn (13) y Luis (6).
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la confección de polos, buzos y chompas en el  pequeño taller que acondicionó en su casa. Allí trabaja con dos personas que le ayudan a realizar los pedidos grandes que le hacen algunos centros educativos. Recuerda que al principio trabajaba en un taller para otra persona, hasta que pudo ahorrar y empezar a comprarse sus propias máquinas y en la actualidad este productivo negocio le genera muy buenas ganancias. Aunque es cansado y algo rutinario, está muy satisfecha con los resultados porque le gusta y puede apoyar a su cónyuge en los gastos de la casa.
Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora, con muchas ganas de progresar, para el futuro tiene planeado implementar el puesto que tiene en un mercado de su localidad con la ropa que ella fabrica y así espera empezar a vender lo que con tanto esfuerzo confecciona.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura que cumplirá con el pago de cada cuota con mucha responsabilidad. Pilar tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de material para empezar a confeccionar uno de sus pedidos grandes de buzos y chompas, con ello espera obtener muyt buenas ganancias económicas.
texts.en:
Pilar, age 35, lives in her own house along with her partner Ángel (age 38) and their two young children, Jocelyn (13) and Luis (6). For five years she had been involved in the manufacture of polo shirts, track suits, and jerseys in the small workshop she set up in her house. There, she works with two people who help her fill the big orders that are given to her by educational institutions. She recalls that, at first, she was working for another person until she was able to save and begin buying her own machines. Currently, this productive business provides her with very good earnings. Although the work is tiring and sometimes tedious, she is very satisfied with the results because she likes it and is able to provide help to her partner with the household expenses.

As a very enterprising woman with a great desire to progress, for the future she has plans to open a stall in a local market with the clothing that she makes and, thus, hopes to sell what she manufactures with so much hard work.

This is the first loan that she has had with MFP, and she is certain that she will be very responsible and able to pay each installment. Pilar is planning on investing the money that she is applying for in the purchase of material in order to begin filling one of her big orders for tracksuits and jerseys which she hopes will provide very good profits.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics for making clothing

loans.name: Predislindo

texts.es:
Predeslindo, de 47 años, es un hombre feliz y con muchas ganas de progresar. Vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa Virginia (46) y sus 3 jóvenes hijos; Jessica (27), Gisela (23) y Joani (17).
De muy joven aprendió a fabricar muebles, al principio miraba a los maestros en los talleres y así pudo captar muy bien la técnica. Han pasado 20 años desde entonces y este oficio le genera muy buenas ganancias económicas, ya que por su experiencia tiene clientes que lo recomiendan con otras personas, pues las sillas, sillones, mesas y armarios que fabrica son muy buenos y resistentes.
Predeslindo está muy satisfecho porque ha podido salir adelante desempeñándose en un trabajo que le apasiona y donde trabaja solo, en la tranquilidad de su taller.
Como es un hombre de mucha proyección, tiene pensado para el futuro ampliar su negocio y contratar ayudantes para poder atender mayor cantidad de pedidos.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está seguro que cumplirá puntualmente con el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que quiere salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Para ello, tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de tubos, pintura, madera y demás materiales para lograr culminar con los pedidos de muebles que tiene.
texts.en:
Predislindo, 47 years of age, is a happy man and is eager to get ahead in life. He lives in his own house in company of her wife Virginia (46) and three young children: Jessica (27), Gisela (23) and Joani (17). From a young age, he learned to make furniture; in the beginning he would observe the master craftsmen in the workshops and was able to learn the technique very well. It has been 20 years now and this trade generates good profits for him; because of his experience, his customers recommend him to other customers, since his chairs, sofas, tables and armoires are of good quality and strong. Predislindo is satisfied because he has been able to get ahead working in a trade that he is passionate about and where he works by himself, in the peace and quiet of his workshop. Since he is a man that is always planning ahead, he plans to expand his business and hire assistants to fulfill a higher quantity of orders. This is his first loan with MFP and he is sure he will make his payments on time, since he wants to get ahead by working hard. For this purpose, he plans to invest his loan in buying tubes (metal furniture), paint, wood, and other materials in order to fulfill the furniture orders he has now.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalía, de 31 años, tiene muchas ganas de progresar. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su madre y sus dos hijos; Steven (6) y Dayana (5).
Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca; al principio trabajaba ayudando en esta labor a una amiga, pero después de un tiempo empezó a hacerlo de manera independiente y se ha dado cuenta que así obtiene mayores ganancias, además puede comprar promociones y venderlas a mayor precio.
Por otro lado, tiene un puesto de golosinas que es atendido por su madre y ella lo hace los fines de semana cuando hay mayor demanda, obtiene buenas ganancias invirtiendo poco dinero. Rosalía cree que si sigue así, en el futuro podrá concretar su sueño de instalar una tienda donde pueda ofrecer sus golosinas, sus productos de belleza y otros productos.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura que cumplirá puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas porque quiere seguir accediendo a otros préstamos, tampoco quiere quedar mal con sus compañeros de grupo, quienes le han brindado confianza. Rosalía tiene pensado invertir el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de mercadería para su puesto de golosinas, también adquirirá algunos productos de belleza que tendrá en stock para atender el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosalía, age 31, has a strong desire to progress. She lives in her own home along with her mother and her two children: Steven (6) and Dayana (5). For the last two years she has sold beauty products for a well-known brand. She began this work by helping a friend, but after a while she began to work independently and realized that she could make a better income that way. Also she could buy promotional products an sell them at a higher price. At the same time, she has a small candy shop that her mother tends to, and she herself comes on the weekends when demands is highest. She earns a good sum and invests a little of the money. Rosalía believes that if she continues in this way, she will be able to make her future dream of opening a store where she can sell candy, beauty supplies, and other products come true. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she is sure that she can make her payments on time because she wants to be able to have access to other loans. Nor does she want to fall out of favor with the other members of her group, those who have shown confidence in her. Rosalía has planned to invest the money that she is requesting in buying merchandise for her candy stand. She will also obtain more beauty supplies to have in stock so she can fulfill her clients' requests.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena A. is a 35-year-old married woman who lives in Sto. Catinggib, in the village of Sua-ay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through fish vending and hog fattening. Lorena’s husband works as a fisherman and helps her in running the business. They have three children who are between 2 and 15 years old. The two older children go to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Lorena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in fish vending and hog fattening activities. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 20,000 from her business activities. Lorena is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 20,000 was used to fund operations of her fish vending and hog fattening businesses and it had a positive impact on both the businesses and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 20,000 for her 14th loan which she intends to use to continue sustaining her fish vending and hog fattening business activities. Lorena is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah G. is a 52-year-old married woman who lives in Sto. Catinggib, Barangay Sua-aym, Himamylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by fish vending. Leah’s husband helps her in running the business. They have four adult children, some of whom are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Leah joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a fish vending business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 21,000 from her business activities. Leah is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 18,000 was used to fund operations of her fish vending business and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 18,000 for her 17th loan which she intends to use to continue supporting and sustaining her fish vending business. Leah is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business and to purchase a boat engine

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia S. is a 48-year-old single woman who lives in Barangay Minapasok, Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store and a videoke place. Videoke is the local term for karaoke to distinguish that the singer can actually follow the lyrics on a TV screen as opposed to the old karaoke which only played the music and the singer used a songbook to view the lyrics. Lucia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 in the hope that she would be able to help improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by running a general store and a videoke place. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 6,400 from her business activities. Lucia is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund operations of her videoke and general store, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 10,000 for her 18th loan which she intends to use to maintain her videoke machine and sustain her general store. Lucia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store and her videoke business

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en: Florentina C. is a 43-year-old married woman who lives in Fatima Village, Barangay Riza, San Carlos City. She earns her living as a wholesaler and retailer of Pepsi products, running a general store, and renting out gowns and accessories. Florentina’s husband, Escolastico, is a Pepsi sales agent and they have four children who are between 20 and 26 years old. Two of their children are already working and the two younger children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Florentina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income with the earnings from her three businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 19,600 from her business activities. Florentina is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 17,000 was used to fund operations of her businesses and it had a positive impact on both the businesses and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 20,000 for her 17th loan which she intends to use as working capital for her businesses. Florentina is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna B. is a married woman who supports her family by running a general store and selling fruits and vegetables. She lives in Barangay Masulog, Canlaon City, Negros Occidental, with her husband and their four children who are 26 to 34 years old. Three of their children have their own families and the one who is still single is gainfully employed. Myrna has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, and at her fruits and vegetables vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 18,000. Myrna is now borrowing PHP 11,000 so that she is able to add additional working capital to her general store and her fruits and vegetables vending business. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Myrna aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita M., age 52, is a married woman who lives in Brgy M., Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by making native handicrafts such as bags, wallets, and fruit baskets from pandan leaves. Teresita’s husband Gregorio, age 50, helps run the business. They have six children between the ages of 13 to 25 years old. Two have their own families, two help her in the business, and one is currently attending school.

Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the family's quality of life. With the help of the loans she has received from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by making and selling her native handicrafts. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 4,800 from her business activities.

Teresita is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund operations of her business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is applying for her tenth loan in the amount of Php 11,000, which she intends to use to support her business. Teresita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. ("Dungganon" is a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable.") Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress away from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their most ambitious dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Topurchase materials for making native handiwork products for sale

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie P. is a 46-year old married woman who lives in Brgy Mahilum, Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by making native handicrafts such as bags, wallets, baskets, etc. from pandan and by fishing.

Vergie’s husband Jose, who is 47 years old, is a fisherman and sometimes helps her run the business. They have 2 children who are 16 and 18 years old. The older one helps her parents in business and the younger one is currently going to school.

Vergie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by making native products made from pandan leaves and from fishing. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 8,000 from her business activities.

Vergie is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 9,500 was used to fund operations of her native products and fishing, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 12th loan, the amount of Php 10,500, which she intends to use to sustain the operations of her handicrafts production and also help fund the fishing operations of her husband.  Vergie is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia Alinabon  is a 50-year old married woman who lives in Brgy Culipapa, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through fishing and fish vending.

Lydia’s husband Aproniano is a fisherman and Lydia sells his catch. They have 7 children whose ages are between 12-35 years old, 5 already have their own families. The 2 youngest are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Lydia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 of June in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by fishing and fish vending business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 20,000 from her business activities.

Lydia is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 25,000 was used to fund operations of her fishing and fish vending business, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 8th loan, the amount of Php 27,000, which she intends to use to buy fishing materials and to fund her fish vending business.  Lydia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine B. is a 31-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy. Culipapa, Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by fishing and fish vending. Her husband, Romy, is a fisherman and Josephine sells his catch in their community and in the nearby public market. They have two children who are 12 and 13 years old and are currently going to school. Josephine joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in July, 2006, in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their income with her fishing and fish vending business. Now she earns an average monthly income of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business activities. Josephine is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 25,000 PHP was used to fund the operations of her fishing and fish vending business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions.
