Now she is applying for her 8th loan, for 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use to fund the operations of her fishing and fish vending business. Josephine is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma J. is a 41-year-old married woman who lives in Payao, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living running a general store. Elma’s husband helps her with the business. They have two children who are 12 and 16 years old. Both children are currently going to school and also help their parents with the business as part of their daily chores. Elma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their quality of life. With the help of loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their income with her general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business activities. Elma is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 22,000 PHP was used to fund the operations of her general store and it had a positive impact on both the business and her family’s living conditions. Now she is applying for her 19th loan in the amount of 22,000 PHP which she intends to use to buy more stock for her store. Elma is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia H. is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in Pob 1, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling dressed chicken and frozen food products. Cynthia’s husband Ruel works, but also helps her in running the business. They have four school-age children.

Cynthia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by selling dressed chicken and frozen food products. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000 from her business activities.

Cynthia is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 was used to fund operations of her dressed chicken and frozen food products business. It had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 11th loan in the amount of  PHP 19,500, which she intends to use to sustain her dressed chicken and frozen food products business.  Cynthia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia S. is a single woman who supports her family by running a general store, providing an electronic reloading service and buying and selling rice. She lives in Sto. Mapait, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, electronic reloading and rice retailing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 13,000.

Delia S. is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can continue to sustain the growth of her general store, electronic reloading and rice retailing businesses. This will be her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Delia S. hopes to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha C. is a 46-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Marcelo Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store, farming and selling pigs.

Editha’s husband, Dionesio, is a 62-year-old retired teacher who now helps to run the business. They have six children whose ages are between 17-29 years. Five of the children have their own families and only one is still going to school.

Editha joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by operating a general store, farming and selling pigs. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000 from her business activities.

Editha is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 was used to fund operations of her general store, farming and pig selling businesses, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 13th loan in the amount of PHP 13,500, which she intends to use on her general store, farming and pig selling business.  Editha is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia P. is a 47-year-old married woman who lives in Payao Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by raising hogs and chickens.

Eugenia’s husband is gainfully employed but also helps her run the business. They have four children who are between 14 – 20 years old. They are all currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Eugenia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1996 of July in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by raising hogs and chickens. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000 from her business activities.

Eugenia is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 was used to fund operations of her hog and poultry business, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 20th loan in the amount of PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to continue supporting the operations of her hog raising and poultry businesses.  Eugenia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa M. is a 59-year-old married woman who lives in San Jose Valing, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store.

Ninfa’s husband, Jose, helps her run the business. They have four children who are between 21-31 years old. All of their children are college graduates and now help support the family's needs.

Ninfa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000 from her business activities.

Ninfa is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 was used to fund operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 20th loan in the amount of PHP 29,500, which she intends to use on her general store.  Ninfa is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo C. is a 58-year-old married woman who lives in Pinucotan, Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store and a sugarcane farm.

Amparo’s husband, Celso, is a 62-year-old carpenter and they have 10 children who are between 18 and 41 years old. Eight of the children already have their own families. The remaining two are single and help their parents in the business.

Amparo joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by operating a general store and a sugarcane farm. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000 from her business activities.

Amparo is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 12,500 was used to fund operations of her general store and sugarcane farm, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 18th loan in the amount of PHP 13,500, which she intends to use on her general store and sugarcane farm.  Amparo is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Taman Hamidullah Group

texts.en:
This is the Taman Hamidullah group consisting of four female members. Bebe Hawa who is the group leader is a tailor. She would like to take a loan for her business to progress and to go on with this business in a better way.
The second member is Tamana. She wants to take a loan for her husband who sells apples from a cart. With the loan, he wants to purchase more kinds of apples. 
The third member is Fahima. She would like to take a loan for her husband’s retail shop. He wants to complete his stocks. 
The last member is Zeba Gul who wants to receive a loan for her son’s tailoring business.  He would like to purchase a new sewing machine and to expand his business.
They all have requested a group loan of 28,000 Afghani.

loans.use: To expand and progress her business

loans.name: Zakia Group

texts.en:
This is the Zakia group. It has two female members. Wahida is the group leader. She is 40 and married with four children. She wants to take this loan for her husband who has a photo shop. There he takes all kinds of photos, both black and white and colored ones. With the loan, he wants to purchase more cameras.
The other member is Aziza who wants to take a loan for her husband’s retail shop. With the loan, he plans to purchase more inventory for his shop. 
The both have requested a group loan of 20,000 Afghani. 
They would like to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase cameras

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane R. is a 36-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Bulwang, Mabinay, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by manufacturing herbal products and food supplements.

Mary Jane’s husband, Rochel, is a 36-year-old truck driver who earns PHP 12,000/month. They have three children who are between 12 and 18 years old. The children are currently going to school and help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Mary Jane joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in herbal products and food supplements. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000 from her business activities.

Mary Jane is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 was used to fund operations of her herbal products and food supplements business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her sixth loan in the amount of PHP 20,500, which she intends to use on herbal products and food supplements. Mary Jane is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy machine for production & additional working capital

loans.name: Zakia Afghan Group

texts.en:
This is the Zakia Afghan Group. Hooma is the loan group leader. This group has four members who are engaged in different businesses. They requested a group loan of 42000 Afghani to complete their inventories. 

Hooma wants a loan for her husband, who has a general store. With this loan, he wants to buy some things like pens, notebooks, and pencils. The second member of Zakia Afghan group is Froozan, who wants to take a loan for her brother, who has a general store. With this loan, he wants to buy more necessary things for his shop. The third member is Laila, who has a beauty salon. With this loan, she wants to buy more cosmetics and other necessary things for her beauty salon. The last member is Zakia, who is a tailor. With this loan, she wants to complete her inventory. 

They would like to thank from all lenders and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy pens, notebooks, and pencils for her husband's general store

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
The woman who is pictured is Rashida, the daughter of M. A.. She is married and the mother of 6 children, three sons and two daughters. Her youngest son is a first-year college student and the others are students at school. 

Rashida wants a loan for her husband who owns a small charcoal shop. With this loan, he wants buy more charcoal for his shop to expand his business, because he is responsible for all the house expenses. He also has to pay for the school fees and expenses of his children. 

Rashida is happy with her Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Atebar Khan Group

texts.en:
This is the Atebar K. Group. Hakima is the group leader. She is married and the mother of 8 children. She lives in Kabul Afghanistan. With hard work, she assembled a loan group that has three members. Each one is engaged in a different business. 

Hakima wants a loan for her son who sells fresh vegetables in his shop. With this loan, he wants to complete his inventory. Frishta wants a loan for her husband who repairs car batteries. Rabia wants a loan for her husband's general store. With this loan, he wants to buy more food for his shop. 

They requested a group loan. Each member needs 14000 AFN and to further their work and be a good client of Kiva and AFS. Hakima ensures that they can repay the loan on the time and she can control the whole group. She would like to thank everyone that helps Afghanistan and its poor people with this loan.

loans.use: To buy fresh vegetables for her husband's shop

loans.name: Shahid

texts.en: Shahid M. is a 43-year-old trader who has been selling sewing supplies in his own shop since 1996. He is married and a responsible father of two sons. He started his business with $100 in capital and now his monthly income is now approximately $300. This business is the only income in Shahid`s family and it is a stable income that allow him to cover his family's needs. But his main dream is to provide the best education for his sons, and to achieve this, he need to earn more money to accumulate some savings. Shahid has applied for 1600 AZN to purchase more sewing supplies to increase his profit.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing supplies to sell

loans.name: Jeyhun

texts.en:
Jeyhun T. is a 33-year-old tailor who has been running his business for the past 10 years. As soon as he finished the special tailoring school, he started as a tailor's assistant and, after a year, he opened his own tailoring studio.  He prepares different kinds of clothes for men, but his best and favourite project is making men's suits. 

He is married and has a daughter. He wishes to provide the best for his family and especially for his beloved daughter. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 1600 AZN to purchase a modern sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en:
Mehman B. sells men's clothes. He opened his own store in 2001 to provide income for his family. This business is the only source of income for Mehman's family. 

His store is located in the center of his village and is very popular among local people. He is married and has 4 sons. He dreams that, one day, one of this sons will continue his business, but for now, Mehman has to do everything he can to develop and expand his business. For this purpose, he has applied for 1600 AZN to purchase more clothes for the upcoming spring season. Mehman and his family are counting on you for your help.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal clothes

loans.name: Valimammad

texts.en:
Valimammad M. is a 45-year-old man who sells women's clothes in the central bazaar in Qiyasli Village. He is married and the only breadwinner for his 8 children. 

Valimammad started his business more than 20 years ago and he is very experienced in the last fashion novelties. That’s why the items he buys always sell out very quickly. Valimammad buys clothes from Baku, the capital of Azerbaijan. He goes there very often, because demand is high, but he does not have enough turnover capital to buy all of the clothes that he needs. 

With the new loan, he plans to buy clothes once in a month and to purchase more at once, rather than spent a lot of effort, energy and money to make the trip three times each a month, as he usually does. He has applied for 1600 AZN to purchase women's clothes for the spring season and increase his turnover.

loans.use: To purchase women seasonal clothes

loans.name: Allahyar

texts.en:
Allahyar A. is a 47-year-old man who sells different kinds of men and women clothes as well as hair colors and some perfumes. He has been in business for the past nine years. He rents a place next to a woman's beauty salon, so a lot of women customers come to buy something before they go to the salon. This clever move makes Allhyar a successful entrepreneur and helps to cover his family's needs. 

Allhyar's dream is to build his own store one day and, as a first step to approach his dream, he has applied for a 1600 AZN loan. Let’s do our best to help this hardworking man.

loans.use: To purchase more women's clothes and expand his business

loans.name: Alibala

texts.en:
Alibala N. is a 56-year-old man who runs his own barber shop in Agsu city. He is married and has two children who are independent adults now.

Barbering is the only source of income for Alibala and his wife. He thinks that now that his children are grown up and his income allows, he can improve his workplace and make small repairs. For this purpose he applied for 1,600 AZN.

loans.use: To make repairs to his barber shop

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
Vugar M. is a 49-year-old man who runs his own store where he sells women’s and men’s clothes and cosmetics. He has eight years of experience in this field. This shop is the only source of income for Vugar`s family. He has three children.

As Vugar’s shop one of the best in the area where he lives, demand for the products he sells is very high. Now he would like to expand his business and purchase more seasonal clothes and some perfumes to increase his profit. For this purpose he applied for 1,600 AZN.

Vugar promises to pay back his loan on time and appreciates everyone who can help him to obtain this loan.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothes and some perfumes

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en:
Jehad is a promising cook in Kfeiret village in Jineen district. Two years ago he started his cooking project to provide weddings and engagement parties with catering services.

Jehad is a 37-year-old husband and the father of an eight-year-old son. His late father left him a small monthly income which doesn't cover living expenses so he thought of starting this promising job.

A loan from FATEN is what Jehad needs to expand his business since, through his two years in business, he found how successful it is. He needs this money to buy more cooking equipment as well as to hire a staff of cooks to help him in high seasons which is usually spring and summer.

Jehad is known for his nice disposition, his commitment and his good, tasty cooking.

loans.use: To buy cooking equipment and to hire cooks

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 24-year-old young man who studied medical laboratory science and started his own medical lab a year ago. His lab is the only one of its kind in Rummaneh village in Jineen District; therefore almost all the citizens of his village are the lab’s customers. Thaer appears in the photo at his laboratory.

After one year of being in business Thaer decided to buy a needed device to use in his laboratory and that's what he is going to use the loan from FATEN for.

Thaer is an ambitious young man who runs a small chicken farm besides the laboratory. He is also thinking of renewing the loan when the current one ends to improve his laboratory so as to serve a larger number of customers.

loans.use: To buy a device for his laboratory

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin R. is a 34-year-old entrepreneur who is married with two children. He has ten years of experience in selling women’s and children’s clothes and has his own store in his home city, called Agsu. He is very experienced in choosing clothes which are in very high demand.

From the day his first child came into this world he gave his word that his children will never be without bread and he has kept that word and tries his best every day to provide the best education and the best food for his beloved kids. He goes to work at 6 a.m. and finishes his work late at 10 p.m.

Elchin applied for 1,600 AZN in order to purchase more spring clothes. Let’s do our best to help this man who gave his heart to his children.

loans.use: To purchase women's spring clothes

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en: Mrs. Bonifacia H. is from the village of Upper Sto. Nino, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 56 years old and married with two children. As of now both are already working. Bonifacia owns a rice field of almost three hectares (7.5 acres) and, aside from that, has animals. Both she and her husband are farmers and there are times that her husband drives a motorcycle to support their daily needs. Bonifacia joined PMPC to gain access to financial support. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. The purpose of that loan was to buy fertilizer for her rice field. As of now, Bonifacia has a new loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC and it’s her 4th loan from the cooperative. She obtained this loan to purchase a new set of chemicals for her next crop. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for her farm

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Riza G. is from the village of Punta Liloy. She is 35 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Riza owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Riza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Riza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lourdes Tagaloguin Group

texts.en: Lourdes T. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old and is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lourdes T. Group. Lourdes is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. texts.en:

While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Amy is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Amy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Amy is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie A. is a married woman who supports her family by manufacturing pots and other products made of clay. She lives in Barangay Tuburan, in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental with her husband who works as a security guard, and their 4 children who are between ages 4-15.  Three children still attend school.

Rosalie has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business manufacturing clay products, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 11,200.

Rosalie is now requesting a PHP 15,000 loan in order to manufacture more clay products. This will be her 11th loan with NWTF-Project Dungganon. Rosalie aspires to improve her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace O. is a 38-year-old married woman who lives in Barangay Linao, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns a living through her general store, buying and selling rice grains, and swine fattening.  Grace’s 41-year-old husband Larry works as a laborer and carpenter.  They have 2 children ages 11 and 17 who currently go to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Grace joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income with the general store and swine fattening. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000.

Grace is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 was used to fund operations for her general store and had a positive impact on both the business and her family living conditions. This will be her 24th loan and she will use the PHP 24,000 to further grow her business.  Grace is working hard to achieve her dreams for her family,  to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.name: Asanbekova Mahabat`s Group

texts.ru:
Нашего клиента зовут Асанбекова Махабат. Ей 45 лет, она замужем и является матерью 2 детей:10 летнего сына и взрослой девушки, также по совместительству она также бабушка очаровательного внука. Сын учится в школе. Супруг Махабат работает охранником в местной школе, он также активно участвует в бизнесе, а именно занимается реализацией откормленного скота на рынке Узгена. Для Махабата откорм скота является дополнительным источником дохода, также она работает главой местной сельской управе. Учитывая ей управленческий опыт не трудно догадатся, что она и собрала эту группу солидарности. кредит будет использован для закупа 2 овец для последующего откорма. 

Базархан 42 года, замужем уже на протяжении 20 с лишним лет. Супруг занимается животноводством. У нее 6 детей, самому старшему сыну 20, находится в России на заработках, а самому младшему сыну 13 лет, он школьник. Все дети трудоспособного возраста в свободное от учебы время присматривают за скотом. Кредит будет использован для закупа МРС. 

Дамира замужняя женщина 30 лет. У нее трое дочерей, двое старших учатся в местной школе. Супруг занимается частными работами на дому местного населения. У них есть свое хозяйство по выращиванию КРС и МРС, также она занимается реализацией молочных продуктов. Кредит будет использован для закупа МРС. 

Айзат 30 лет, она также замужем. У нее имеются 4 детей. Супруг работает на местном скотном рынке, занимается перепродажей живности. Данный кредит будет использован для увеличения товарооборота по семейному бизнесу. В среднем каждый месяц они перепродают 4-5 коров, и около 10 баранов. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 250 долларов.
texts.en:
Our client's name is Mahabat A.. She is 45 years old, she is married and is a mother of two children: a ten year old son and a grown young lady. She is also a grandmother of a charming grandson. Her son goes to school. Mahabat's husband works as a security guard in a local school, he is also actively part takes in the business by selling the fed cattle on the market of Uzgen. For Mahabat the feeding of cattle is a source of additional income, she also works as a head of the local village government. Considering her governing experience it's not difficult to guess that she has brought together this solidarity group. The loan will be used to buy two sheep for consecutive feeding. Bazarhan is 42, she has been married for twenty something years. Her husband does animal husbandry. She has six children, her oldest son is twenty years old and is working in Russia, and her youngest son is thirteen, he is a pupil. All working age children look after the cattle at their free time from studies. The loan will be used to buy small cattle. Damira is a married woman of 30 years of age. She has three daughters, two of them go to the local school. Her husband does handy man jobs for local residents. They have their own business growing large and small cattle. She also sells milk products. The loan will be used to buy small cattle. Aizat is 30 years old, she is also married. She has four children. Her husband works on the local cattle market, he resells livestock. This loan will be used to increase commodity circulation in their family business. They resell on average 4-5 cows and 10 sheep each month. Their monthly income is around $250 US dollars.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Kurmanbayeva Jumagul`s Group

texts.ru:
Жумагул является лидером этой группы, ей 32 года, замужем и мать 1 дочери. Супруг в данное время занимается торговой деятельностью в городе Тараз, Казахстан. Жумагул занимается перепродажей скота на местном рынке. В среднем каждую неделю ее товарооборот составляет 20 000 сом. В обороте у нее 4 коровы и 10 овец. Половина кредита будет использована для того, чтобы начать новый бизнес, а именно реализацию носков, оставшаяся часть инвестирована в текущий бизнес. В будущем она планирует довести еженедельный товарооборот до 100 000 сомов. 

Нурзат 19, пока не замужем, но собирается в скором будущем. Она живет вместе с матерью и 3 братами. После окончания школы, Нурзат хотела продолжить образование в ВУЗе, однака из за отсуствия денег, ей пришлось ненадолго отложить свою мечту и занятся бизнесом. У ее семьи есть земельный надел, где они выращивают пшеницу, кукурузу, семечки. За счет дохода от сельского хозяйства она смогла оплатить стоимость образования и поступила в экономический факультет. Кредит будет использован для закупа двух коров для дальнейшей отправки на пастбище. После окончания ВУЗа, она планирует устроится на работу в один из местных банков.

Замирбеку 35 лет. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. Супруга домохозяйка. Замирбек занимается реализацией риса в Узгене. Стоит отметить, что узгенский рис славится далеко за пределами не только области, но всего Кыргызстана. Кредит будет использован для закупа 100 кг риса, а также чтобы купить 2 овца. 

Рахат 35 лет, она замужем и мать 3 детей. Супруг работает таксистом по местному маршруту. Сама она занимается сельским хозяйством, а именно выращиванием семечек, риса, пшена. Собственный земельный надел расположен недалеко от ее дома, что очень удобно. Кредит будет использован чтобы купить 300 кг семена пшена, а также удобрения для весеннего посева. 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Jumagul is the leader of this group. She's thirty-two years old, married and has one daughter. Her husband works as a salesperson in the city of Taraz, Kazakhstan. Jumagul sells livestock on the local market. On average, her weekly turnover is 20000 soms. That mainly includes four cows and ten sheep. Half of the loan will be used to start a new bussiness selling socks, and the other half will be invested in the current bussiness. In the future, Jumagul plans to increase her weekly turnover to 100000 soms. Nurzat, 19, is'nt yet married but plans to in the near future. She lives with her mother and three brothers. After finishing school, Nurzat wanted to continue her education in college, however, due to the lack of money, she was forced to postpone her dream and begin working. Her family owns a plot of land, where they grow wheat, corn and sunflower seeds. With the profits from their bussiness, she was able to pay for college and is studying to become an economist. The loan will be used to purchase two cows. After finishing college, she plans to find a job in one of the local banks. Zamirbek is thirty-five years old. He has a wife and two children. His wife is a housekeeper. Zamirbek sells rice in Ozgen. It should be noted that Ozgen rice is praised well beyond the borders not only of the region but of Kyrgyzstan as well. The loan will be spent on purchasing 100 kilograms of rice and two sheep. Rahat is thirty-five years old, married and is a mother of three children. Her husband works as a taxi driver on a local route. Rahat grows sunflower seeds, rice and millet. Her field is located close to her house which is very convenient. With the loan she plans to obtain 300 kilograms of millet seeds and fertilizer for the spring sowing.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 50% of loan will be used to start up new business: socks trade, other 50% for animal sales

loans.name: Maky Afghan Gul Group

texts.en:
This is the Maky Afghan Gul group, which has four members. Abdul Fata is the group leader. He has a general store and he will use the loan to expand his business and to get ahead. 
The second member is Palwasha who would like to receive a loan for her husband’s fruit cart. He plans to buy more and different kinds of fresh fruit to attract more clients.
The third member is Afghan Gul who wants to take a loan for her son who needs to buy a machine to make candy.
The last member is Mah Khanom who needs to buy wood for her bakery business.
They are all glad and admire this loan process and have requested a group loan of 30,000 Afghani.

loans.use: To expand and progress his business

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora C. is from Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is 43 years old and married with seven children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari store. Her husband is a farmer  who supports their daily basic needs. Her store serves as their other source of income.

In 2009, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 5,000PHP from PMPC. She used it to renovate her store. As of now, she has a new loan of 7,000PHP taken from PMPC and its being used for additional capital. It's her third loan from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda A. is a 38-year-old married woman who lives in Tabao Rizal, San Enrique, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through her eatery and food vending.

Melinda’s husband, Juty, who is 42 years old, works as a carpenter.  They have four children, with three of them currently in school and helping out in the business as part of their daily chores.  Melinda's greatest worry is their special child.  

Melinda joined the Kiva field partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her eatery and food vending business. Now she earns an average monthly income of $173 from her business activities.

Melinda is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP was used to fund the operations of her eatery, which had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, in her 14th loan cycle and borrowing 5,000 PHP, she intends to use the money on her eatery and food vending business.  Melinda is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma M. is a 56-year-old married woman who lives in Prk. Malabago, Pinaginpinan, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through operating her general store and by the buying and selling of rice and corn.

Alma’s husband, Nelson, who is 57 years old, helps his wife in the business and also maintains a job where he earns about $226 month.  They have two children who are 28 and 32 years old and have their own families.

Alma joined the Kiva field partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in September of 2006 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store and through the buying and selling of rice and corn. Now she earns an average monthly income of $226 from her business activities.

Alma is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP was used to fund the operations of her general store and the buying and selling of rice and corn.  It had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now borrowing her 7th loan, in the amount of 21,000 PHP, she intends to use it on her general store and also on her business of buying and selling rice and corn. Alma is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Zhora

texts.en: Zhora G. is 24 years old and he is a student. Zhora lives in Tsovagyugh village, Sevan area. He studies in the Yerevan State University Economics department. His extramural courses and annual tuition fees amount to about $800. At the same time Zhora and all his family (father, mother and brother) are engaged in farming. They breed cows, sheep, chickens and bees. Zhora needs a 1,100,000 AMD loan to buy fodder for his cows and other farm animals. He plans to spend the expected profit on his education.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his cows and other farm animals

loans.name: Anh's Group

texts.en:
Ánh Thị Đào (id: 010107050016) is a 34-year-old female living in Văn Thượng village. She is married with two school-age children. Starting in 2000, she has been selling eggs. The job generates an average monthly income of around $219. In 2006, she joined in SEDA activities (SEDA is a Kiva field partner) to gain access to financial resources. Her loans, which were used to support her business, are always repaid punctually. In the next round, she would like to borrow 4,142,000 VND more (or $225) to invest in her business, in the hope that it will make a profit so that her family may afford to buy more furniture.

 Other borrowers in her group include: 
 Tiền Thị Nguyễn, 38 years old (id: 010103110013). She wants to take out a loan of 5,014,000 VND (or $270) to sell fish. 
 Loan Thị Hoàng, 34 years old (id: 010107050014). She also wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (or $270) to sell fruits. 
 Vinh Thị Đặng, 60 years old (id: 010107050012). She needs to borrow 5,014,000 VND (or $270) to invest in raising pigs. 
 Hằng Thị Hoàng, 28 years old (id: 010107050015). She would like to take out a loan of 4,142,000 VND (or $225) to raise chickens.

loans.use: to invest in her business

loans.name: Chak

texts.en:
Mrs. Chak L. is 45 years old and a resident of a commune in Siem Reap province. She currently stays at home to plant crops on her land located near her house. She has been engaged in the farming business for more than eight years. 

She has a partner in her husband, who is skilled in decorating wooden furniture by hand. People hire him to produce beds, chairs, windows and other furniture for fees. The couple helps each other in order to feed their five children. Four are married and live separately, while the other one is single and lives at home. 

Chak L. will use her first loan to buy accessories which will allow her husband to continue to perform his good service.

loans.use: To buy accessories.

loans.name: Avelinda's Group

texts.en:
Avelinda A. is from the town of Villa Cruz, San Mateo. She is 48 years old. Avelinda is the group leader of an eleven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Avelinda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Avelinda owns and operates a business of raising pigs to sell. Avelinda has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $87 a month from this activity.

Avelinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and by engaging in business activities. Avelinda is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine T. is a 48-year-old married woman who lives in Prk Sampaguita Brgy Camugao, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through her general store and pig-fattening businesses.

Josephine’s husband, Antonio, who is 50 years old, is a policeman.  They have four children between the ages of 4 and 16. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Josephine joined the Kiva field partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 1995 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in their general store and pig-fattening businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of $315 from her business activities.

Josephine is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 16,000 PHP was used to fund operations for her general store and pig-fattening businesses which had a positive impact on both businesses as well as on the family’s living conditions. Now, in her 21st loan cycle, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital. Josephine is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie L. is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in Sagua Banua, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through her photography business.

Rosemarie’s husband, Jemmy, who is 44 years old, helps in running the business by going to different schools and by catering different occasions where video or photography is needed.  They have four children between the ages of 6  and 17 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Rosemarie joined the Kiva field partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in the photography business. Now she earns an average monthly income of $203 from her business activities.

She is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP was used to fund operations for her photography business, which had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now in her 14th loan cycle, Rosemarie is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use for their photography business.  She is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for business

loans.name: Ha's Group

texts.en:
Hà Thị Hoàng was born in 1964 (id: 010107050001). At present, she is living in Văn Thượng village with her husband and two children. Hà has been selling fast food to customers in the local community to make a living for about 10 years; she has an average income of $203 a month. Since 2006, she has participated in SEDA activities and has always been very punctual with her loan repayments. At this time, there’s a need for her to take out a loan of 5.014.000 VND (or $270) to invest more in her business. Hà is hoping to earn more money in order to buy household appliances.

 Moving forward to her group, it includes: 
 Dinh Thị Hoàng is 38 years old (id: 010107050003). She would like to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or $270) to sell flowers. 
 Mai Thị Hoàng is 38 years old (id: 010107050006). She also wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or $270) to offer tailoring services. 
 T.ềm Thị Nguyễn is 38 years old (id: 010107050005). She would like to take out a loan of 5.014.000 VND (or $270) to invest in selling clothes. 
 Hòa Thị Nguyễn is 53 years old (id: 010107050025). She wants to borrow the same amount, 5.014.000 VND (or $270), to raise pigs and sell vegetables.

loans.use: to invest more in her business.

loans.name: Rodrigo's Group

texts.en:
Rodrigo C. is from the town of San Miguel, Ramon. He is 55 years old. Rodrigo is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rodrigo C.'s group.

Rodrigo is married. To make a living, Rodrigo owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling junk & other waste material for local businesses and community members. Rodrigo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Rodrigo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodrigo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell. Rodrigo is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional waste & junk materials to sell. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Rodrigo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional waste & junk materials to sell

loans.name: Paz Melly

texts.en:
Paz Melly M. is a 50-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Tapi, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by being a candy manufacturer.

Paz’s husband, Florentino, works as a farmer but sometimes helps out in his wife's business. They have four adult children aged between 20 and 30 with one currently going to school and they also help out in the business as part of their daily chores.

Paz joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in candy manufacturing. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 32,000 from her business activities.

Paz is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 29,500 was used to fund the operations of her candy manufacturing and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Borrowing the amount of PHP 29,500 for her 17th loan, she intends to use the money on her candy manufacturing. Paz is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. Paz is with her husband in the picture.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru: Одинаев Раджабали проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 53 года. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Двое сыновей работают строителями. Одинаев Раджабали имеет среднее Техническое образование по специальности "Шофер". Торговлей занимается более 10 лет. Он продает на своей торговой точке сельскохозяйственные продукты. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Rajabali O. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 53 years old; married with 8 children. Two of his sons are construction workers. Rajabali has secondary technical training as a cab-driver. He has been a salesman for over 10 years. He sells agricultural produce at his stand. He is requesting the loan to increase his sales turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase sales turnover

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet N. is 54 years old and she lives in Barangay Manghanoy in the town of Moises Padilla. This is a village located near the base of Mount Kanla-on, an active volcano on Negros Island.  Her home is surrounded by the expansive rice fields that support the region. Juliet is married and has one son who has graduated from college already and is working in town. She has several businesses which have helped improve her quality of life.

Juliet makes her own native delicacies. In her basement, three sacks of peanuts rest against the wall. She boils and salts the peanuts and sells them in small bags. She also makes peanut butter which she sells in the market of Moises Padilla and other areas. She also makes baye-baye, a treat made from young coconut and young rice. It is originally from the town of Dumaguete in Negros Oriental but it is popular all over Negros Island.

She is going to use her loan of 20,000 pesos to buy some of the ingredients for making her native delicacies. A sack of flour costs Php 2,200, a sack of rice costs Php 1,750 and the sacks of peanuts are Php 875 apiece. She also has a piggery and pays Php 1,800 for a piglet. She has to purchase feed for fattening the piglet for sale in the market. From all of these businesses, she has an average monthly income of Php 20,000.

Juliet is also going to use her loan to purchase fertilizer and insecticides for her rice farm. She has a small farm of about 1 hectare with expenses of 25,000 pesos every four months. Every harvest period, she gets 110 sacks of palay, or unmilled rice, which she can sell for 66,000 pesos.  

Juliet is a member of good standing. She is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making delicacies, and fertilizer and insecticides for growing rice

loans.name: Khean

texts.en:
The smiling person shown in the picture is Mrs. Khean D., 22 years old, who lives in the province, Siem Reap. She owns a small store in the village which is full of her fellow villagers, and she uses this store to sell a few grocery items. She generates a profit of approximately US$2 a day to help provide her family with more stability by supporting her family’s daily expenses.

Her husband is the chief provider for the family, and he works as a building worker. This couple have a child. Khean D. always hires a taxi to deliver her inventory from the market to her store. She hopes to reduce this cost by taking out her loan with which, when added to her saving, she can buy a used motor vehicle which will enable her to transport her wares.

loans.use: To buy a used motor vehicle

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Yoeurn R., age 47, is a long-term businesswoman who currently resides with her other family members in a wooden house located in a commune, in the province of Siem Reap. Here she owns a small business buying and selling mature rice. In addition, she raises pigs fR. home to earn extra profit. She is married with four children, two of whom are married and the remaining two are single.

Her husband, the chief provider for the family, buys cows to fatten for a while before selling them to earn income. Yoeurn R. is requesting a loan to increase the financial capital for her rice and animal trading.

loans.use: To increase financial capital for her rice and animal trading

loans.name: Nol

texts.en:
Mrs. Nol Y. is 51 years old and married. To earn a living, she either gets fish from her husband’s fishing or buys fish from other fishermen and turns them into fish paste, which she then sells at the local market.

She and her husband help each other to feed four children, while the other three are married and have already started new homes. Nol Y. is taking out her loan to invest in raising pigs. She is hopeful that this will provide her with extra income and a higher standard of living.

loans.use: To invest in raising pigs

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 21-year-old young man living with his parents. He has four brothers and sisters.

After working for eight years selling clothes in a shop in his town Hasan decided to open a clothes shop in 2007 as his own business and to make his own career. His shop is situated in a busy area, so he gets a good number of clients passing by his shop. And he's always trying to present all the new collections to his customers.

Today, Hasan is requesting $1,000 to expand his inventory for the new season and to offer a bigger choice of clothes to his clients.

loans.use: To expand his inventory for the new season

loans.name: Noi's Group

texts.en:
Nối Thị Đồng (id: 010117140052) was born in 1955. At the present time she is living in Xóm Ngoài 1 with her husband and three grown-up children.

For about four years, Nối Thị Đồng has been raising poultry and selling vegetables to earn a living. Specifically, those jobs provide her with an income of approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

From 2005, Nối Thị Đồng has taken part in SEDA’s program and has repaid her loans punctually. Currently, she needs to borrow 7,630,000 VND (approximately 420 USD) to invest more in her business, wishing that it will turn a profit so that her family may have a sum of money to buy more furniture.

In regard to other members in her group:

Năm Thị Nguyễn (id: 010117140053) is 55 years old. She wants to take out a loan of 7,194,000 VND (approximately 395 USD) to sell clothes.

Hà Thị Nguyễn (id 010117140054) is 41. She also wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND (approximately 395 USD) to raise poultry and to open a forge.

Hưng Thị Nguyễn (id: 010117140005) is 53. She needs to take out a loan of 6,758,000 VND (approximately 370 USD) to invest in selling sugarcane.

Nhung Thị Nguyễn (id: 010117140055) is 39. She would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND (approximately 345 USD) to grow vegetables.

loans.use: To invest more in her businesses

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. SA. A. is a 36-year-old married womA.. She earns her daily income by selling grocery items to the neighbors who live near her home. She is able to generate $2 each day to meet the needs of her family.  SA.'s partner and husband is a fishermA. who currently fishes in and around Tunle Sap River. The family is blessed to two teenage children who are students in the local public school. SA. is looking for A. assistant to help with her business. She will improve her business by purchasing a larger inventory for her store.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Formarah

texts.en:
E. was born in 1970 and is the single mother of two children. She lives in mile three at Nkwen, Bamenda, Cameroon. E. lost the father in 2001, thus making life difficult for her and her children since her father was the sole breadwinner of the house and took care of the health and education of the children.

She plans to invest this money in clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for a long time, therefore giving her a good background in managing the business.

Her activity will help the community to obtain dresses at a reduced cost.  She plans to use the profit to buy feed, educate, and fight poverty at home.

About GHAPE

The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: To buy used clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Nga T. Thị Lại (id: 010117040008) is a 28-year-old woman living in Xóm Chợ of Đông Anh. She is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Nga runs a small business serving food to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for around three years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from this activity. Starting from 2008, Nga participated in SEDA to gain access to financial services to help better her business and family life. Nga has successfully repaid 7 previous loans of from SEDA. At the present time, she is requesting a new loan of 5.014.000 VND( or 270 USD), which again will be used to improve her business. She hopes to use the extra income generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in her group: 
Gia Thị Nguyễn (id: 010117040006) is 60 years old. She would like to borrow 7.194.000 VND (or 385 USD) to support her business of serving food. 
Minh Thị Nguyễn (id: 010117040009) is 32 years old. She also wants to borrow 7.194.000 VND(or 385 USD)  to offer electronic equipment repair services. 
Bách Thị Nguyễn (id: 010117040007)  is 54 years old. She would like to take out a loan of 7.194.000 VND(or 385 USD)  to invest in dressmaking. 
Nga Thị Đoàn (id: 010117040005). She is requesting a loan of 7.194.000 VND (or 385 USD) to offer electronic equipment repair services.

loans.use: will be used to improve her business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 20-year-old married man. He is newly married and trying to make a good income for his family which he supports with his business. He has owned a clothing shop since 2008. He opened this business after seeing a need for such services in the region. He has a good number of clients. For this the reason he is planning to expand his work operation and enlarge his shop by purchasing an additional number of clothes. In order to do so, Ali is requesting a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies of clothes

loans.name: Sleiman

texts.en: Sleiman is a 40-year-old married man and has 3 children. He has owned a small shop in his village for the past 8 years. He sells a limited number of products and is concerned about satisfying his clients needs. He is raising his three unemployed children on his own and works hard to make a good income. Today, Sleiman is requesting a loan of $1,200 to expand his market inventory and present a wider variety of products to attract more clients.

loans.use: To expand his market inventory and present a wider variety of products

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 39-year-old widow and mother of one child. After the death of her husband, a friend of her who owns a clothing shop helped her by offering a job. She gave her a number of clothes to sell and earn a percentage of the sales. In 2008, after 5 years at this job, Abir started selling clothes from her home as a business and she has been doing a well. 

Today, Abir is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a supply of clothes for the new season to attract more clients and earn a good income.

loans.use: To buy a supply of clothes for the new season

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar M. is 28 years old and lives in Sevan with her husband, mother-in-law and two sons. One of her sons is school-aged while the other goes to kindergarten. Gohar is a teacher and worked in this profession for several month before leaving in order to take care of her children. In 2009, Gohar set up her own business in a rented space. She sells women's, men’s and children’s clothes. Gohar is requesting a loan of 800,000 AMD to expand her business by buying spring clothing to resell.

loans.use: To buy spring clothing to resell

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef  is 36 years old, married, and has three unemployed children. He has worked in transportation for the past 15 years and has owned his own van since 2000. Youssef offers transportation services for the whole of his region. Today, Youssef is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to perform maintenance on his van as it is in poor condition. This will enable him to continue his work properly and earn income for his family.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his van

loans.name: Latifath

texts.fr: O. Latifath est née en 1986 à Cotonou, capitale économique du BENIN. Latifath vit environs depuis 7ans à Avotrou, un quartier de Cotonou. Mariée à AFFOTON Foard, Latifath est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous deux scolarisés. Latifath vit avec son mari et leurs 2 enfants. Le couple se partage ensemble les charges familiales. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Latifath exerce d’une part comme activité principale la vente de divers produits vivriers (riz, boissons en plastique et en cannette, lait, conserve, huile, jus de fruits etc.) ; d’autre part Latifath vend également de l’alcool médical à 90°. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du BENIN, et au NIGERIA, pays voisin du BENIN, que Latifath s’approvisionne. Latifath effectue la vente de ses produits dans les environs de son domicile et à Dantokpa. Latifath n’a jamais fréquenté mais fait du commerce depuis 8 ans. Latifath est une cliente fidèle de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de 4 prêts qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Compte tenue de la restriction de ses revenues, Latifath désire obtenir un cinquième crédit dans le but de renforcer son capital et d’étendre ses activités.
texts.en:
Latifath O. was born in 1986 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been living for about seven years in Avotrou, a neighbourhood in Cotonou. Married to Foard AFFOTON, Latifath is mother of two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children, and they share household expenses. To assist her husband, Latifath’s main activity is to sell food products (rice, bottled or canned soft drinks, milk, oil, fruit juice, etc.). She also retails medicinal alcohol (90°). Latifath gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace, and from a neighbouring country, Nigeria. She sells her products in the vicinity of her home and in Dantokpa. She has never attended school but has been active in retail for eight years. Latifath is an active member of ALIDé, and has already been granted four loans, all fully reimbursed. Given her limited financial means, she is requesting a fifth loan to bolster her working capital and extend her activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various food products (rice, pasta, canned goods, milk, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Dopé

texts.en: Dopé M. is 27 years old and sells a variety of grocery products in Lomé, Togo. She works in the Grand Marché, a popular, high-traffic area where she is able to serve many customers. Ms. M. began this business in 2007, and is asking for a loan from Kiva partner, WAGES, to restock her store. Specifically, she will purchase laundry detergent, rice, bottled water, cooking oil, condensed milk and tomato paste. Ms. M. is single and does not have children.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of grocery supplies

loans.name: Lương's Group

texts.en:
Lương Thị N. (ID 010103110006) was born in 1964. Currently, she lives in Thac Qua village with her husband and two adult children, all of whom are employed. For many years, Lương has been raising poultry for a living. She has an income of about 2,000,000 VND a month. Since 2007, she has participated in SEDA activities and has always been very punctual in making her loan repayments. She is now requesting her fifth loan of 5,450,000 VND to further invest in raising poultry, with the hope of increasing her income.

About the other members in her group
Hoa Thị N. (ID 010103110007) is 36 years old. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in selling fish in the market.
Sêu Thị N. (ID 010103110008) is 52 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise poultry.
Bé Thị Lưu (ID 010103110009) is a 51-year-old female. She would like a loan of 5,014,000 VND to improve her small grocery store.
Nhung Thị Trần (ID 010103110010) is 25 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to open a grocery store and raise chickens.
Thử Thị N. (ID 010103110011) is 34 years old. She is requesting a loan of 5,014,000 VND to raise pigs and sell wrought iron products.

loans.use: To further invest in her poultry business

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr: Née le 03 juin 1971 à karimama au Nord du BENIN, T. Félicienne vit depuis maintenant 12ans à Lom-Nava, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du BENIN. Mariée à BABA TOUNDE Joachim, un chauffeur, Félicienne est mère de 4 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Félicienne se joint à son mari pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Félicienne exerce comme activité la vente de tubercules d’igname, de patate douce et de l’oignon. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du BENIN, que Félicienne se ravitaille. Félicienne effectue la vente des produits à son domicile. Félicienne n’a pas été à l’école mais exerce son activité depuis 7 ans. Félicienne a déjà bénéficié de 4 crédits, auprès de ALIDé, qui ont tous été bien remboursé. Félicienne souhaite renforcer et élargir ses activités mais dispose de très peu de moyens pour y arriver, raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un cinquième crédit.
texts.en:
Born June 3, 1971 in Karimama (North of Benin), Félicienne T. has lived for the past twelve years in Lom-Nava, a neighbourhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Joachim BABA TOUNDE, a chauffeur, Félicienne is the mother of four children who all attend school. She joins forces with her husband to make ends meet. Félicienne sells yams, sweet potatoes and onions. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace, and sells her products from her home. Félicienne has not attended school, but has been commercially active for the past seven years. She was already granted four loans from ALIDé, all of which were repaid in full. Félicienne wants to strengthen and broaden her activities, but has very little means to do so, which is why she is requesting a fifth loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of yams and onions

loans.name: Marie Hélène

texts.fr: Marie Hélène N. est une femme de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Sainte Anne depuis 8 ans et a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à 16 fois de suite. Elle fait un petit commerce de couscous, de citron et d'huile de palme. Elle soutien son mari pour la prise en charge de la santé et scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Marie Hélène N. is a 44-year-old woman, married and mother of five children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” loan group in Sainte Anne for eight years, and has acquired quite some experience with credit loans, since she has benefited from 16 previous loans.
