She runs a small business selling couscous, lemons and palm nut oil. She assists her husband in ensuring their children’s healthcare and education.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her income-generating activity

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 46-year-old married man with seven children, of whom five are unemployed. He has worked as a farmer for the past 15 years. He cultivates all type of vegetables, according to the season, and he sells his products to the market. Youssef is well known in his region for his good quality products. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 USD to purchase farming supplies such as fertilizers, seeds and other supplies needed to cultivate his land.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies, e.g. fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Moynatou

texts.fr: A. Moynatou est née en 1960 à Cotonou, capitale économique du BENIN.  Moynatou vit depuis 10 ans à Lom-Nava, un quartier de Cotonou. Mariée à AFFOTON Kabinar, Moynatou est mère de 4 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec ses enfants et subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Pour soutenir son mari dans leurs dépenses, Moynatou exerce comme activité la vente d’alcool médical à 95°. C’est à pharmaquick, une pharmacie de Cotonou, et au NIGERIA, pays voisin du BENIN, que Moynatou s’approvisionne. Moynatou commercialise ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du BENIN. Moynatou n’a jamais fréquenté l’école mais possède 15 années d’expérience dans son domaine. Moynatou est une cliente fidèle de ALIDé car ayant déjà bénéficié de 4 crédits  qu’elle a d’ailleurs tous bien remboursé. Dans l’optique de renforcer son commerce et de multiplier ses revenues, Moynatou souhaite obtenir un cinquième concours financier.
texts.en:
Moynatou A. was born in 1960 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Kabinar AFFOTON, Moynatou is the mother of four children, all attending school. The couple lives together with their children and shares household expenses. To assist her husband with expenses, Moynatou has been selling medicinal alcohol (95°). She gets her supplies from Pharmaquick, a drugstore in Cotonou, and from neighboring Nigeria. Moynatou sells her product in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. She has never attended school but has 15 years experience in her domain. Moynatou is a regular customer of ALIDé as she has previously been granted four loans, all well reimbursed. With the view of reinforcing her business and increasing her earnings, she is requesting a fifth loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy containers of medicinal alcohol and small bottles

loans.name: Thơm's Group

texts.en: Thơm Thị

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Léonie

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du BENIN, H. Léonie vit depuis 11 ans à Gankpodo, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du BENIN. Mariée à GOUDJEMINDJI Moïse, un pêcheur, Léonie est mère de 6 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Léonie aide son mari à assurer les charges de la famille. Pour apporter sa contribution, Léonie exerce comme activité principale la vente de maïs de soja, et de fromage à  base de soja. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du BENIN, que Léonie achète ses produits. Léonie effectue de manière ambulante et à son domicile la vente de ses produits. Léonie n’a jamais fréquenté l’école mais exerce son activité depuis 5 ans. Léonie est une très bonne cliente de ALIDé en ce sens qu’elle a déjà obtenu 6 crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de son produit et de diversifier son activité, Léonie souhaite bénéficier un septième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Léonie H. settled 11 years ago in the Gankpodo area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Moïse GOUDJEMINDJI, a fisherman, Léonie is the mother of six children, all attending school. The couple lives together with their children, and Léonie helps her husband in dealing with family expenses. She generates income by selling soya-based cornmeal, and soya-based cheese. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Léonie sells her products both as an itinerant merchant and from her home. She has never attended school but has been working at her business for the past five years. Léonie is a very good customer of ALIDé, in that she was already granted six loans, all of which were repaid in full. She is now requesting a sixth loan, in order to increase her stock supply and diversify her activity.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock supply (soya-based cornmeal and soya-based cheese)

loans.name: Sabitiou

texts.fr: T. Sabitiou est née le 14 juin 1974 à Takon dans le département de l’Ouémé au BENIN. Sabitiou vit à Gankpodo, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du BENIN depuis 8 ans. Mariée à AGBANGLA Djamiou, Sabitiou est mère de 2 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le couple vit avec les enfants et assure ensemble les besoins de la famille. Pour apporter sa part contributive, Sabitiou  exerce comme activité la vente de divers produits vivriers (légumes, jus de fruits, boissons en canettes et en plastiques, les épices écrasés etc.). C’est à Lomé, capitale économique du TOGO, pays limitrophe du BENIN que Sabitiou s’approvisionne. Sabitiou effectue la vente de ses produits à Ganhi, un marché de Cotonou. Sabitiou n’a pas été à l’école mais exerce son activité depuis 10 ans. Sabitiou a déjà obtenu une fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Dans le souci de diversifier ses produits et d’étendre son activité, Sabitiou désire bénéficier d’un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Sabitiou T. was born June 14, 1974 in Takon, in the Ouémé department of Benin. For the past eight years, she has been living in Gankpodo, a neighbourhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Djamiou AGBANGLA, Sabitiou is mother of two children who are all in school. The couple lives together with their children and share in dealing with household expenses. To contribute her share, Sabitiou sells a variety of food products (vegetables, fruit juice, canned and bottled soft drinks, ground spices, etc.). She gets her supplies from Lomé, the economic capital of Togo, a country adjacent to Benin. She sells her products at the Ganhi market of Cotonou. Sabitiou has not attended school but has been doing business for ten years. She was already granted one loan from ALIDé, which was fully reimbursed. She is requesting a second loan so that she can diversify her offerings and expand her activity.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Diversify her products (vegetables, fruit juice, canned and bottled soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Chrorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chrorn P. is 59 years old and she lives in Cheav Bdei Khang Kaeut village, Takeo province.

Mrs. Chrorn P. and her husband, Mr. Mee Kry, are farmers who own 3-hectare (7.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice. In order to support the farm crop, they want to buy a water pump and dig a well, but they do not have enough money to do so. So, Mrs. Chrorn P. decided to ask for a loan to support this purpose.

This couple has three children, two of whom are farmers who support their parents’ farming and the other one is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and dig a well

loans.name: G. Régina

texts.fr: Née le 13 avril 1980 à Kessounou, dans un village du BENIN, K. G. Régina vit à Gankpodo, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du BENIN depuis 7ans environs. Mariée à DANDJINOU Olivier,  Régina est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Régina vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Régina exerce comme activité principale la vente de produits vivriers (pomme de terre, pomme fruits, légumes, cacahouète,  etc.). C’est à Lomé, capitale économique du TOGO, pays voisin du BENIN, que Régina s’approvisionne. Régina commercialise ses produits à Ganhi, un marché de Cotonou. Régina n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais possède 12 ans d’expérience dans son activité. Régina a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Régina souhaite développer son activité mais ne dispose pas suffisamment de ressources pour y parvenir, c’est la raison pour laquelle elle désire obtenir un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Born on April 13, 1980 in Kessounou, in a village in BENIN, Régina G. K. has been living in Gankpodo, a district of Cotonou, economic capital of BENIN for about 7 years. Married to DANDJINOU Olivier, Régina is the mother of two children who are both enrolled in school. Régina lives with her husband and their children. The couple are jointly responsible for providing for the family.

To help her husband with household expenses, Régina sells foodstuffs (potatoes, apples, vegetables, roasted peanuts, etc.) She buys her goods in Lomé, economic capital of TOGO, a neighboring country of BENIN. She sells her products in Ganhi, a Cotonou marketplace. She did not go to school, but has 12 years' experience in her business. She has already received and correctly reimbursed one loan from ALIDé.

Régina would like to expand her business but hasn't got sufficient resources to manage that, which is the reason why she is asking for a second loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expand her business selling potatoes, apples, vegetables and roasted peanuts

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne N., 45 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants est membre du Banc Villageois de Sainte Anne depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle a été 9 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit et développe un petit commerce de fruits et de jus naturels. Elle participe à la prise en charge de la santé et scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Jeanne N., 45, married and the mother of 4 children, has been a member of the Village Bank of Sainte Anne for four and a half years. She has received 9 consecutive loans and is working at expanding her little fruit and fruit juice business. She wants to participate in keeping her children healthy and in school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintain her little business

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef has worked as a farmer in his village since 1999. He owns a large piece of land and he cultivates it with all type of vegetables and fruits. He is involved in this occupation after learning it from his father because his village is specialized in this sector.

Youssef is married with four children who still go to school. He’s taking care of his family and his dream is to see his children graduate from school and university.

Today, Youssef is requesting $1,000 to buy farming supplies and tools for his business.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and tools

loans.name: Asma'

texts.en:
Asma' M. is an ambitious young woman from Rafah, a city in the Gaza Strip, who started her own project at her house. In the photo she is standing in her workshop in front of her sewing machines.

Asma' purchases cloth for sewing long robes which Hijabi Muslim women wear. This type of robe sells well in Gaza Strip.

Asma' started this project recently to help her husband who works for the local authority in Rafah and receives a small salary. Their combined income would provide the family, which consists of a one son and one daughter, with all that they need.

The project is succeeding due to the high demand for such robes. Therefore, Asma' has requested $1,500 to purchase the needed amount of cloth.

Please note that Asma comes from a religious family, therefore she covers her face in the picture shown here.

loans.use: To purchase cloth to sew

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola has a shop where she sells crates of drinks at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. Bola is 47 years old, married and has four children. Her youngest child is 6 years old. Her husband is a welder and he also supports the family. She hopes to change her children’s school to a better one. She hopes to give her children quality education.

Bola is requesting a loan 100,000 nairas to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She is a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) client. She says thank you and promises to repay her loan promptly.

LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Quyên's Group

texts.en:
Quyên Lệ T. (ID 010110080003) was born in 1982. Currently, she lives in Văn Thượng village with her husband and two school-aged children. Since 2004, she has made a living by doing carpentry. This work generates an average monthly income of around 3,000,000 VND. In 2008, she joined Kiva partner, SEDA, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. Quyên repaid her first loan of 4,142,000 VND on time. This loan was used to expand her business. Now, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to invest in her business in the hope that it will make a profit and enable her family to buy more furniture.

About the other borrowers in her group
Hảo Thúy Thị Vương (ID 010110080002) is a 30-year-old female. She is requesting a loan of 6,322,000 VND to sell clothes.
Hà Thị Nguyễn (ID 010110080001) is 34 years old. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to sell fruits.
Ái Thị Hà (ID 010110080005) is the eldest member of the group. She is a 40-year-old worker and wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to buy pigs.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en:
Philomina K. is a single parent and has five dependents. She has received senior high education.

Philomina sells agricultural products  like herbicides and pesticides to the farmers in Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. She uses her income in payment of school fees and utility bills.

Philomina will use the loan to purchase more agricultural supplies to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in her business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: To purchase more agricultural supplies to sell

loans.name: Angélique

texts.fr: Angélique D. est âgée de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 11 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Sainte Anne depuis 5 ans et a eu à bénéficier 10 fois de suite de crédit. Elle mène un petit commerce de jus de citron et de balais traditionnels. Elle participe à la prise en charge de la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Angélique D., 51, is married and the mother of 11 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Sainte Anne for 5 years and has received 10 consecutive loans. She has a little business selling lemon juice and traditional brooms. She wants to contribute to the well-being of her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her personal working capital

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel G. O. is twenty-seven years old, married, and has one child. His wife is a housewife and they hope to give their child a very good education.

Daniel’s business is located by the roadside at Manyatta Estate in Kisumu. He sells goods like sugar, cooking fat, detergents, bread, milk, etc., to the local people. He has been engaged in this business for the last three years and he works very hard, from early morning to late evening, to ensure continuity of his business in a market where there are many people doing the same business as his.

Daniel is using his loan to restock his business to expand it and hopes to open a bigger retail shop. He also dreams of building a permanent house and also giving his child a good education.

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of sugar, 10 cartons of bar soap, milk and cooking fat

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah has two grinding machines that she uses to grind foodstuffs including beans, corn, tomatoes and pepper. She also sells garri, rice and yam flour. A hardworking woman, Hannah leaves her home as early as 5 a.m.to buy foodstuffs in large quantities to sell to her customers at retail prices. In this business for a long time, she is now requesting a loan of NGN100,000 to purchase more food to sell.

Hannah, 50 years old, has five children and is married to a commercial driver who also supports the home. She is a client of LAPO, an organization committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Hannah says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia A. sells provisions such as Milo (a milk drink), powdered milk, fruit drink, biscuits (cookies) and other provisions at Elmina. She has received vocational education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a student.

Patricia has been selling provisions for some time now, supporting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Kalykova Ulmas' Group

texts.en: K. Ulmas, 46, is the leader of this group. She is widow with one married daughter who lives with her husband and is a housewife. Ulmas’ main source income is raising livestock. When her husband died, she needed to deal with something to earn money to earn a living. Frankly she didn’t have much choice. The best occupation was raising livestock and she bought one lamb for KGS 600 and later a calf, and so on. At the present time she has two cows, two calves and two sheep. Besides this business, she has a little shop where she sells tea, cigarettes, candles, etc. Due to her hard work she was able to accomplish all this! Ulmas’ loan will be used to buy six or seven lambs which she plans to sell later at a higher price. Her annual income from her livestock business is approximately $50 per month. Muhabbat, 50, is the mother of five children. Four of them are working and the youngest daughter goes to school. Currently Muhabbat is a housewife, but mostly she spent her time during the last few months opening a vendor kiosk in a shipping container, investing money that she received from her elder sons. She will use this loan to buy goods for her new kiosk. This kiosk is located near her house and it is very comfortable. Shakirjon, 48, is married. He sells secondhand goods and his wife helps him in his business. He has a son, who is a builder, and three daughters. He needs a loan to increase the turnover of his family business. He usually buys secondhand goods, including clothes, in the city and sells them in nearby villages. He has been in this business for fifteen years. Mahirahon is 50 years old and is divorced with three daughters. Her eldest daughter is married and the others go to school. Her daughters cook meals at home and sell them in the market to local traders. Mahirahon has a small business in the clothes trade. She will use this loan to increase her assortment of goods and prepare for the upcoming spring season. This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy six or seven lambs

loans.name: Minh's Group

texts.en:
Minh Thị Nguyễn (id: 010107050021) was born in 1955 and has two children. Currently, she is living in Văn Thượng village earning a living as a kindergarten teacher. Even though it doesn’t bring her a decent salary (only 2,600,00 VND in total), it’s the career that she has been following since her twenties.

Starting in 2006, in order to increase her income, Minh joined SEDA to borrow money for raising chickens. At the present time, she would like to take out a loan of 5,450,000 VND (approximately 300 USD) to invest in her business, hoping that it will make a profit so that her family may afford to buy more furniture.

Minh is leading a group that includes the following four other members:

Tuyết Ánh Thị Nguyễn (id: 010107050024) is 30 years old. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately 275 USD) to invest in selling flowers.

Doan Thị Hoàng (id: 010107050022) is 43 years old. She also wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately 275 USD) to invest in selling flowers.

Cúc Thị Hoàng (id: 010107050033) is 52 years old. She needs to take out a loan of 5,014,000 VND (approximately 275 USD) to invest in selling fast food.

Xuyên Thị Hoàng (id: 010107050023) is 40 years old. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately 275 USD) to buy groceries to sell.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Tamunang

texts.en:
Born in 1948, Tamumang J. is married to Nkenti Grace, and they have three children. As a man who is the bread-winner of the family and finding it very difficult to accomplish this task, he made up his mind to join GHAPE in 1998. Also, he has been having a lot of family problems. This made him sad all the time but he is appreciative of the fact that he is alive. His desire is to give his children love and education. He states that he feels better each time he provides something small to his children. His inability to get investment capital which could constantly generate income for him to meet his children’s needs is what motivated him to obtain a loan from GHAPE.

Given a loan, he plans to buy a two-wheel motor cycle; he knows this business will succeed because he is located at a good business site in the metropolitan town of Bamenda and he will be the rider of the motorcycle. Believing he has good management techniques, he knows he will be able to have good monthly income from his activity.

He plans to use the profits generated to sponsor his children in school and to cater to the basic needs of his family.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim has owned a beauty salon since 2007 although he has been involved in this occupation for the past fifteen years. He started working when he was very young after the death of his father. Today, he's married with one baby and he's able to take care of his family.

Ibrahim caters to a wide range of clientele in his village and its neighborhood. Today, he wishes to improve the decor of his salon and buy new equipment so as to be always up-to-date with the new haircuts and designs. In order to do so, he is requesting $1,000.

loans.use: To improve the decor of his salon and to buy new equipment

loans.name: Festo

texts.en:
Festo N. G. is forty-four years old, married and has two children. His business is located at Jua Kali in Kisumu. Jua Kali is the market in Kisumu which mostly has auto-spares businesses.

Festo owns a garage and sells auto spares and lubricants. He has been running this business for the last twelve years and his major challenge has been lack of enough space to do his business. There have been fire outbreaks also affecting his business big time and there are many people doing the same business as his and so customers are spoilt for choice.

Festo is using his loan to buy more auto spares and lubricants to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more auto spares and lubricants

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana T. operates a business selling provisions from a table in Elmina. She has received no formal education. She is single and has four children and is responsible for paying school fees for the children and other utility bills.

Diana has been selling provisions for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr: Anna DIATTE est une femme de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans et a eu une bonne expérience en matière de crédit et dans son domaine d'activité. Elle est vendeuse de jus de citron et d'huile de palme. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la santé et scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Anna DIATTE, 55, is married and the mother of 5 children. She has been a member of her Village Bank for 5 years and has had a great experience with loans and in her field of endeavor. She sells lemon juice and palm oil. Her goal is to participate in paying for her children's schooling and in keeping them healthy.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her little business

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha has worked as a home-based tailor since 1997. She is the mother of one child and started her small business to help her husband with the family's income and to pay for her child’s schooling. She cooperates with her husband to make their hard life situation better. In addition to tailoring, she also repairs clothes upon request of clients.

Today, Maha is requesting $1,200 to buy a new sewing machine for her business to replace her old one to offer a good quality of work to her clients.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Olabisi

texts.en:
Olabisi is 41years old, married and has four children. Her husband produces cellophane bags to support his home (cellophane is a thin, transparent sheet made of regenerated cellulose and used for food packaging).

Olabisi sells plastics in Lagos State, Nigeria. She also has a shop where she sells frozen foods like beef, chicken and fish. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

Olabisi is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more plastics to sell. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Olabisi says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Olabisi is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en:
Fumilayo is 29 years old, married and has a child aged 9 years. Her husband is a mechanic and he also sells motor spare parts to support the home.

Fumilayo sells groceries and drinks to make a living. She hopes to own a big supermarket in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She promises to pay back her Kiva loan promptly and she says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Fumilayo is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Marie Madeleine

texts.fr: Marie Madeleine F. est une femme de 60 ans, elle est veuve et mère d'un (1) enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Sainte Anne depuis 4 ans et a une bonne expérience avec le crédit. Son activité principale est l'élevage de volailles, par ailleurs, elle vend du jus de citron et de l'huile de palme. Son objectif est d'assurer les études et la prise en charge de son enfant.
texts.en:
Marie Madeleine F., 60, is a widow and the mother of one child for whom she is still responsible. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Sainte Anne for four years and has done well with loans. Her main business activity is raising poultry, but she also sells lemon juice and palm oil. Her goal is to make sure she can pay for schooling and other expenses for her child.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain her little business

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena A. is married and has one child. Helena has received no formal education. Her husband is a cleaner. Helena uses her income to support her husband in the payment of utility bills.

Helena sells gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava), powdered cassava (locally called kokonte) and powdered corn at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. In the photo Helena is showing what the powdered cassava looks like.

Helena will use the loan to purchase more gari and maize to process into powder for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more gari and maize to process into powder

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
NidA. is a 52-year-old married man with three children. He has owned agriculture land since 2000 where he cultivates agriculture products according to the season. He delivers the vegetables and fruit to the agriculturA. market to be sold. He’s thankful for his business; it allows him to have a better life situation.

NidA. also has an agriculture tent to help him always be able to process his work. Today, NidA. is requesting $1,100 to prepare a new agriculture tent needed to increase his business productivity.

loans.use: To prepare a new agriculture tent

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a husband and the father of four daughters and three sons. He is an employee of the government and his current job is not a fulfillment of his dream of working in his own business nor an answer to big family expenses.

Over the last year Muhammad purchased fifteen sheep to raise and sell. His aim behind taking a loan from FATEN is to increase the number of sheep he has to increase the income from selling them.

Muhammad's future plan is to establish a big farm with different types of livestock and to move from raising and selling them to breeding them and selling sheep products.

loans.use: To increase his number of sheep

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. sells smoked fish at Elmina. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. She has received junior high education.

Mary has been selling smoked fish for some time now and supports her husband in the payment of school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke and clothes to sell.

Mary hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more fish to smoke and clothes to sell

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en:
Titilayo is 45 years old and is married to Mr. A. who is a motor mechanic. They have three children who are still young and dependent but are excelling in their school work.

Titilayo makes lovely hairstyles for her customers and she also sells hair extensions and accessories. She is happy because during the holidays, her children assist her with sales in her stall.

Titilayo is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more hair extensions and accessories to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and accessories to sell

loans.name: Koffi Sosthène

texts.fr: Ce monsieur âgé de 52 ans est père de famille, l’activité génératrice qu’il exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille est le commerce de produits alimentaires tels que les tomates, l’oignon et autres, il exerce son commerce  près de l’abattoir du grand marché de lomé. Il a une  grande expérience dans ce commerce car il l’exerce depuis 1987. Son stock de tomates a diminué, de même que une partie des autres produits.Voulant se réapprovisionner il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 20 de piments et 80 sacs de tomates et d’oignons.
texts.en:
This gentleman is 52 years old and a family man.The income generating activity that allows him to provide for the needs of his family is grocery business such as tomatoes, onions and other items. He sells his items near the abattoir of the large market of Lome. He has great experience in this business having been in it since 1987. His stock of tomatoes and other items have gone down. In order to restock, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 20 bags of pepper, 80 bags of tomatoes and onions.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of pepper, onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Phillippe

texts.en:
Phillippe A. runs a hardware and construction supply store in Lomé, Togo. He is married and has three children.

Phillippe has been in this business since 2005, and is now asking for his first loan from WAGES. He will use this loan to purchase floor tiles and other products used for home construction.

Phillippe purchases his stock in Accra, Ghana, and this loan will help him restock his shelves in order to satisfy his customers’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase floor tiles and other products used for home construction

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 45 years old and the mother of four children. Her husband is a pastor and he also supports the home.

Catherine sells spiritual items like candles and olive oil and she also sells groceries. With these businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members. She opens her shop daily from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Her biggest priority is feeding the children and making sure their school fees are paid.

Catherine is asking for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more spiritual items to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders and to LAPO micro-finance.

loans.use: To purchase more spiritual items to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua E. makes and sells a local delicacy called Fante kenkey at Elmina (Fante kenkey is a variety of kenkey associated wth the Fante people of Ghana. It is fermented corn and cassava dough wrapped in plaintain or banana leaf).

Ekua has received no formal education. She is single and has two children. She is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills.

Ekua has been selling Fante kenkey for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to make kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize to make kenkey to sell

loans.name: Olubukola

texts.en:
Olubukola is 31 years old, married and has a child. She is a hardworking woman who makes lovely Nigerian clothing styles for both male and female. She also sells tailoring accessories like zips, thread and landings and has been in this business or five years.

Olubukola hopes to become an international designer in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you and promises to repay her Kiva loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying Clothing for Resale

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia E. is single and has three children. She has received senior high education.

Cecilia sells jewelry and used clothing at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. She uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills.

Cecilia will use the loan to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Alamhon

texts.ru: Шарипов Аламхон проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 35 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Шарипов Аламхон имеет среднее образование. В области торговли более 11 лет. Шарипов Аламхон продает женскую и детскую одежду. В этом ему помагает жена. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Alamhon S. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 35 years old, married and has 2 children. Alamhon has a secondary education. He has been working in the retail sales field for over 11 years. Alamhon sells women's and children's clothing. His wife helps him with this business. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Salama 1 Ndagire Agnes Group

texts.en:
N. Agnes is forty years old and is married with four children of whom three are schooling. She also has three dependents, also schooling.

Agnes is the group representative and she has owned a carpentry business for over two years. She is using the loan to purchase timber for her workshop.

Agnes is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to work hard, educate her children, and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase timber for her carpentry business

loans.name: Nayfe

texts.en:
Nayfe is a 33-year-old single woman. In 1999, she opened a women’s accessories shop selling items such as rings, bracelets, bags and other items in addition of bying some clothes. She's living with her parents and she provides, along with her two sisters, income for the family.

Nayfe always presents beautiful products to attract clients and augment her revenue. Today, she is requesting $1,000 to buy more merchandise as inventory and some gadgets to fill her shop with new items.

loans.use: To buy more accessories and some gadgets

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 47-year-old married woman with 2 young children. In 2006, with the help of her husband, she opened a home market shop to sell home accessories, supplies and tools. She provides all that is needed at her shop to satisfy the demand of her clients. And she always offers all the new products in the market. Today, Fatmeh is asking to borrow $1,000 to purchase new merchandise for her shop after having a good number of clients buy in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 58 years old and is divorced with 4 children. She is a friendly and hard-working woman. She sells foodstuffs like bags of garri (cassava flakes) to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to sell at wholesale prices to her customers in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is married to Peter Ng'ang'a who is a businessman. She is a mother of three: two sons and a daughter. She stays in Kikuyu which is a semi-urban town on the outskirts of Nairobi.

She operates a beauty shop in Westland’s where she sells beauty products. She has been in this business for the last nine years and she has gained a lot of experience. Her clients are mainly people celebrating weddings and other occasions.

Alice was introduced to KADET by her friend and has not borrowed from other sources. This is her first loan with KADET.  She plans to use the amount of money she has borrowed to expand the beauty shop into a salon.

She intends to operate a bigger business and even a school of beauty.

loans.use: Alice wants to expand her beauty shop into a salon.

loans.name: Nadwa

texts.en: Nadwa is a 50-year-old married woman and mother of 2 children. She has owned a small mini-market since 2008. She opened this small business to help her husband with the family's income and to improve their living situation. Her mini-market is situated in a busy area, so she has been able, over the years, to have a growing number of clients pass by her shop and buy all types of food products. Today, Nadwa is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more merchandise in large quantities, so she can increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise in large quantities.

loans.name: Jonathan Makau

texts.en:
Jonathan is a single gentleman aged 21 years. He is in the transport business where he uses his bicycle to transport people and goods to other places. This he has done for the past 3 years. He also used to sell cakes as his other source of income and also his secondary business. 

He was introduced to Kadet through a friend. He has applied for a loan which he plans to use to revive and expand his cake selling business. With the extra profit generated from the business he intends to purchase a motorcycle.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his transport business, purchase more motorcycles, and manage them. Jonathan’s parents could not afford to send him to college or university after high school, so the decided to start working in the transport industry with the bicycle he had so that he could further his education.

He is determined to make it in life. Jonathan describes himself as a hardworking man and likes to plan ahead of time.

loans.use: To revive his secondary business of cake selling.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Madeleine T. est âgée de 71 ans, elle est veuve et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois de Sainte Anne depuis 8 ans. Elle fait de l'abattage et vente de viande de porc. Cette activité lui procure de bénéfice qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins  personnels.
texts.en:
Madeline T. is 71 years old. She is a widow and the mother of a child. She's been a member of "Banc Villageois de Sainte Anne" for 8 years. She slaughters animals and sells pork. This business provides her with income which enables her to provide for her personal needs.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow her business

loans.name: Esther Waithiegeni

texts.en:
Esther is 31 years old and married to Francis, a business man. They have one daughter who is 3 years old. Esther has been selling clothes for the past six years. She also sells shoes as another source of income.

She was introduced to Kadet by an existing client. She is planning to expand her business by adding more clothes stock with the loan she is applying for. Esther intends to re-invest in the business with the extra profit generated from the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to open another store, increase stock and employ more young people. Esther describes herself as an ambitious and honest lady.

loans.use: To expand her business and add stock.

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en: Feryal is a married woman and has one child. After having her first baby, she decided to open an accessories and gadgets shop in 2005 after seeing a need for such services in the region. This market is very large and known, which is the reason why she opened such a business to make a good profit. Today, Feryal is asking to borrow $1,200 to develop her shop and buy more merchandise such as accessories, gadgets and bags to attract more clients.

loans.use: To expand her shop and buy more merchandise.

loans.name: John Kiberu

texts.en:
John is a single gentleman aged 27 years old. He has been working in the bicycle transport business for the past two years.

He was introduced to Kadet through an existing Kadet client. He is planning to purchase another bicycle and employ somebody else. With the extra profit generated from the business, John intends to purchase a motorcycle for transport.

His hopes and dreams are to buy a Nissan Matatu (Minibus) for transport and employ more people, especially young, jobless men who do not have much education to get employment elsewhere. John is hard-working despite insecurity in his area of operations. He tells of a story where he once carried a client who later robbed him and took off with his bicycle. He did not give up, but rather bought another bicycle and continued with the business. John describes himself as hardworking man who is God-fearing and honest.

loans.use: To purchase a bicycle.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Madeleine SAMB est une femme de 54 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8 ans et a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit. Elle fait de l'élevage et embouche porcine. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madeleine Samb is a 54 year old woman. She is married and the mother of 4 children. She's been a member of "Banc Villageois" for 8 years and has good experience in terms of loans. She does livestock farming and fattens pigs. She contributes to improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her self-financing capacity

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: Jacqueline S. est âgée de 56 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Saint Anne depuis 8 ans et a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à 16 fois de suite. Elle fait de l'abattage et vente de viande de porc. Elle vise à améliorer la conditions santé et scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jacqueline S. is 56 years old. She is married and the mother of 5 children. She's been a member of "Banc Villageois" for 8 years and has good experience regarding loans, having benefitted from it for 16 sucessive times . She does livestock farming and sells porc. She aims at improving the health conditions and education of her children.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain her business of selling pork

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr: Thérèse N. est une femme de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Saint Anne depuis 8 ans. Elle est vendeuse de fruits de saison tels que des oranges, des mandarines et de melons. Elle participe à l'amélioration de la santé et de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Thérèse N. is a 49-year-old woman, married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the «Banc Villageois » of Saint Anne for eight years. She sells seasonal fruits, such as oranges, mandarines, and melons. She participates in the improvement of her children's health and their schooling.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain her fruit-selling business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana  es cliente de la Institución desde el año 2004 se dedica a la venta de golosinas, su kiosco se encuentra ubicado en los patios de la EMI (Escuela Militar de Ingenieria) el mismo esta en la zona de Alto Irpavi, su familia esta conformada por su esposo el mismo que es portero de dicha Institución, y ocupan una pequeña casita con sus dependencias que la Institución les proporciona, ellos tienen 3 hijos menores, dos de los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar y dependen de ellos; la señora tiene una casita propia que se encuentra en la zona de El Alto donde  viven sus dos hijos mayores ya independientes, el credito que saca de la institución le sirve de mucho ya que con ello trabaja para aumentar su capìtal en el kiosco ya que con el mismo cubre los gastos familiares. el monto que esta solicitando es el que hace rotar por toda la temporada de clases en la EMI.siendo esta actividad la única que tiene, es conveniente la tasa preferencial para doña Juanita. 

Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Juana has been a client of the Institution since 2004. She sells sweets, and her kiosk is located on the campus of the EMI (Military School of Engineering), which is in the Alto Irpavi area. Her family is comprised of her husband, a doorman for that institution, and their three minor children. Two of the children are school-age and dependent upon them. They live in a small house that the institution provides. She has her own small house in the El Alto region. Her two grown and independent children live there. The loan that she gets from the institutions will do a lot. She will use it to increase her capital in the kiosk because the kiosk covers the family expenses. The amount that she is requesting is what she needs for the entire season of classes at the EMI. As this activity is the only one she has, she gets a good interest rate. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era.
Elena es soltera, tiene 42 años y 5 hijos, Elena viaja semanalmente a la ciudad de Pisco en donde vende cereales, papa, haba y arveja verde, productos que compra en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Elena necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa amarilla.
Los sueños de Elena son educar a sus hijos y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Nueva Era Communal Bank. She is 42, single, and has five children. She travels weekly to the city of Pisco, where she sells grains, potatoes, beans, and green peas. She buys these products in the wholesale market in the city of Ayacucho. Elena needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy yellow potatoes. Elena’s dreams are to educate her children and that her business grows.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy yellow potatoes

loans.name: Leonora

texts.es:
Leonora es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era.
Leonora es soltera, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Leonora viaja semanalmente a la ciudad de Pisco en donde vende cereales, papa, haba y arveja verde, tiene un deposito alquilado, productos que compra en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Leonora necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa, arveja y maíz.
Los sueños de Leonora son ampliar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Leonora is a member of the Nueva Era Communal Bank. Leonora is 39, single, and has three children. Leonora travels weekly to the city of Pisco, where she sells grains, potatoes, beans, and green peas. She has a rented shop. She buys her products in the wholesale market in the city of Ayacucho. Leonora needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy potatoes, peas, and corn. Leonora’s dream is to expand her business and to give her children a good education so that they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes, peas, and corn

loans.name: Janet Maria

texts.es:
Janet es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era.
Janet es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Janet en asociación con su hermano tienen local de lavado y engrase de carros, el cual esta en un local alquilado, Janet se encarga de la administración.
Janet necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de una maquina.
Los sueños de Janet son ampliar su negocio, independizar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Janet is a member of the Nueva Era Communal Bank. Janet is 28, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Janet, in association with her brother, has a car wash and oil change business in a rented space. Janet runs the business. Janet needs a loan for 2,000 PEN as part of a payment for a machine. Janet’s dreams are to expand her business, make the business independent, and to give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partial payment for a machine

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era.
Ana es casada, tiene 79 años y 1 hija, Ana venD. ropa, frazadas, edredones, sabanas, D. acuerdo a los pedidos D. sus clientes, la mayoría D. sus ventas son al crédito.
Ana necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ropa variada,
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the communal bank called Nueve Era, or New Era. She is 79 years old and married with one daughter. Ana sells clothing, as well as quilts, duvets and bedding depending on the requests of her customers. The majority of her sales are done on credit. Ana needs this loan to purchase a variety of clothing to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing for her customers

loans.name: Adela Natividad

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era.
Adela es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Adela junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía, sus productos los vende en el mismo lugar y también los vende en Huanta, además Adela vende leña.
Adela necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra y leña.
Los sueños de Adela son comprar un carro grande para transportar sus productos y tener un almacén propio en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Adela is a member of the Nueva Era Communal Bank. Adela is 42, married, and has four children. Adela and her husband make bricks by hand in the Compañía community. They sell their products in the same area. They also sell in Huanta. Adela also sells firewood. Adela needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy land and firewood. Adela’s dreams are to buy a large car to transport her products and to have her own store in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land and firewood

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es socia del Banco Comunal de Ladrilleros de Compañía, es de la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Claudia es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Claudia junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía, producto que vende crudo en el mismo lugar.
Claudia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra.
El sueño de Claudia es construir su casa.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the communal bank of Ladrilleros de Compania, a community located about 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Claudia is 40 years old, and married with 4 children. Together with her husband, she makes bricks and tiles, which they sell in the community of Compania. Claudia needs the loan to invest in a small piece of land, as her dream is to be able to build their own house.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a small piece of land

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio  es socio del Banco Comunal de Ladrilleros de Compañía, es de la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Eusebio es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Eusebio junto a su esposa se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía, producto que vende crudo en el mismo lugar.
Eusebio necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en el techado de su casa,
Los sueños de Eusebio son comprar un terreno en Ayacucho para construir su casa y comprar un carro para transportar el ladrillo.
texts.en:
Eusebio is a member of the Ladrilleros de Compañía Communal Bank in the Comañía community, which is 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Eusebio is 37, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Eusebio and his wife make bricks by hand in the Compañía community. They sell their products unprocessed in the same area. Eusebio needs a loan for 900 PEN to invest in the roof of his house. Eusebio’s dreams are to buy a piece of land in Ayacucho to build a house on, and to buy a car to transport the bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the roof of his house

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson es socio del Banco Comunal de Ladrilleros de Compañía, es de la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Nelson es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Nelson se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía, producto que vende en el mismo lugar.
Nelson necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de los peones.
Los sueños de Nelson son progresar económicamente y tener carros para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Nelson is a member of the communal bank Ladrilleros de Compania, a community located about 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Nelson is 30 years old and married with one child. Nelson makes bricks and tiles and sells them in Compania. He will use this loan to pay some of the workers. Nelson's dream is to save enough for a few trucks to transport the bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help pay some of his workers

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal de Ladrilleros de Compañía, es de la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Julia es casada, tiene 60 años y 10 hijos, Julia junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía, producto que vende crudo en el mismo lugar.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra.
Julia sueña con construir su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Ladrilleros de Compañía Communal Bank in the Comañía community, which is 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Julia is 60, married, and has ten children. Julia and her husband make bricks by hand in the Compañía community. They sell their product unprocessed in the same place. Julia needs a loan for 900 PEN to buy land. Julia dreams of building her house in the city of Ayacucho and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina es socia del Banco Comunal D. Ladrilleros D. Compañía, es D. la comunidad D. Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Celestina es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Celestina junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación D. ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad D. Compañía, producto que venD. en el mismo lugar y también lleva a las obras.
Celestina necesita un préstamo D. 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago D. los peones y leña.
Los sueños D. Celestina son tener capital propio y construir su casa en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Celestina is a member of the Communal Bank Ladrilleros D. Compana, a community located about 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Celestina is 50 years old, and married with 5 children. Together with her husband, she works making bricks and tiles which they sell in Compania and deliver to construction projects. Celestina will use this loan to purchase firewood and to help pay the workers. Her dream is save up enough money to build a house in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood for their brick business and help pay the workers

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal de Ladrilleros de Compañía, es de la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Rosa es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Rosa junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía, producto que vende crudo en el mismo lugar.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Rosa son mejorar su negocio y su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Ladrilleros de Compañía Communal Bank in the Comañía community, which is 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Rosa is 36, in a common law marriage, and has four children. Rosa and her husband make bricks by hand in the Compañía community. They sell their product unprocessed in the same place. Rosa needs a loan for 900 PEN to buy firewood. Rosa’s dreams are to improve her business and her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es socio del Banco Comunal de Ladrilleros de Compañía, es de la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Carlos es conviviente y tiene 28 años, Carlos se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía, producto que vende crudo en el mismo lugar.
Carlos necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra y pago de peón.
Los sueños de Carlos son tener capital propio y una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Carlos is a member of the Ladrilleros de Compañía Communal Bank in the Comañía community, which is 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Carlos is 28, in a common law marriage. Carlos makes bricks by hand in the Compañía community. He sells his product unprocessed in the same place. Carlos needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy land a pay a worker. Carlos’s dreams are to have his own capital and a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land a pay a worker

loans.name: Alfa Omega Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento ALFA Y OMEGA ya trabajo un ciclo en nuestra Institución, es un Banco que ya esta en su segundo ciclo esta conformado por 11 integrandes 9 Mujeres.y 2 Varones, las socias se dedican al comercio y venta D. verturas, cosmeticos, equipos D. computación y otros

La Sra.BERTHA es la presidenta del banco y tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar ella se dedica a la venta D. material plásticos y es una persona bastante dinámica, responasble y el dinero del prestamoutilizara para la compra D. mercaderia y  aumentara su capital D. trabajo.

La Sra. TANIA Ella es la secretaria en el Banco y tiene 1 hijo pequeño, es madre soltera y sola mantiene su hogar uno D. sus deseos es ver a su hijo profesional, se dedica a venta D. computadoras y con el prestamo ha logrado aumentar su capital D. trabajo y así para poder mejorar su negocio y su calidad D. vida.

La Sra. ROCIO Es la tesorera en el Banco y es una persona joven, ella estudia y tabaja  se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo, con el prestamo ha logrado comprar en cantidad sus productos que estaban en oferta como ser perfumes, desodorantes, talcos y otros, lo que permitirá mejorar sus ingresos económicos y es estudiante en la Universidad Escuela Hotelera administración turistica.

Todas las socias son personas responsables dinamicas trabajadoras que en muchos casos mantienen solas el hogar y estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The communal Bank of Emprendimiento ALFA and OMEGA is in its second cycle with 9 women and 2 men, all of the members work selling cosmetics, computer supplies and other products.

Bertha is the president of the communal bank and has 3 children who attend school. She works selling plastic products, and is a very dynamic and responsible person. Her portion of the loan will help her purchase merchandise and grow her business.

Tania is the secretary of the communal bank and is the single mother of one young child. One of her dreams is to see her son get a good education and have a profession. Tania works selling computer supplies and her portion of the loan will help her build her business and improve the quality of life for her and her son.

Rocio is the treasurer of the bank and is still quite young. She is studying still and working selling cosmetics. Her portion of the loan will be used to purchase beauty products she can sell such as perfumes, powders and cosmetics. This will help her generate income to pay for her studies towards a hospitality degree at the University.

All of the members are responsible and hardworking people. In many cases, they have to maintain their families on their own, and they are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the support and the confidence they receive through the loans.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to help grow their respective businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Advertise her small business

loans.name: Force To Go #1 Group

texts.en:
Gabriel G. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Force to Go #1. He is 35 years old, single, and has four children who are 2, 9, 11 and 14 years old. The oldest child is in 7th grade, and the youngest is in 1st grade. Gabriel himself was only able to complete school through the 10th grade.

Gabriel owns a footwear business in the Waterside market, which is the largest market in Monrovia. He has had this business for four years, and he attracts customers by selling quality goods in a friendly manner.

Gabriel plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more footwear. He hopes that one day he will be so successful that he will be able to open his own footwear store. Most importantly, he wants to be able to feed his children and see them get a good education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Gabriel is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more footwear.

loans.name: Mbaïta

texts.fr: Mbaïta K., 55 ans, mariée et mère d'un enfant est membre du Banc Villageois de SINATHIABA NORD depuis 2 ans et a eu à bénéficier de 4 prêts qu'elle bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle fait un petit commerce de bijoux et son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Mbaïta K., 55, is married and the mother of one child. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” of SINATHIABA NORD for two years, and has received four loans which she managed well and paid back regularly. She has a small business selling jewelry, and her goal is to build up her savings and participate in supporting her family.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build her small sales business

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
Ignacia, es casada, vive en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 65 años. Ignacia alterna sus actividades del hogar con su trabajo de venta de comida. Ignacia nos cuenta que esta encargada del comedor de trabajadores de la empresa “Backus”, ella prepara almuerzo para 150 empleados. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone su trabajo. Ignacia forma parte del banco Comunal “Yanapakuy” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella requiere el préstamo de los 700 dólares, que invertirá en comprar arroz, aceite y azúcar. Ya son varios  años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone su negocio. Ignacia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
 
(Yanapakuy es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa “ayudemos”).
texts.en:
65 year-old Ignacia is married and lived in the city of Cusco. She alternates her household tasks with her work selling meals. She is in charge of the workers’ dining area of the ‘Backus’ business where she makes lunch for 150 employees. She’s had the business for two years, and all is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Ignacia is a member of the Arariwa Association’s ‘Yanapakuy’ community bank. She needs a loan of $700 which will be used to buy rice, oil, and sugar. Ignacia is grateful for the opportunity to get a loan in this way and promises to repay the money according to the schedule. (‘Yanapakuy’ is a Quechua word meaning ‘Let us help’.)

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and sugar

loans.name: Marème

texts.fr: Marème F. est une femme mariée âgée de 43 ans et mère d'un enfant en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et a 4 expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait un petit commerce de bijoux et ses bénéfices lui servent à renforcer ses épargnes et à participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Marème F., aged 43, is a married woman who is a mother with one child to support. She has been a member of Banc Villageois for two years and has had four loan experiences. She has a small business involving jewelry, and she uses her profits for bolstering her savings and for helping to meet family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For advancing her small-scale commerce

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth es una cliente nueva que llega a la institucion por recomendación de clientes que ya trabajaron con la institucion, esta casada y tiene hijos pequeños, la señora  Elisabeth tiene su puesto en la laguna de cota cota donde vende comida (almuerzo y platos extras). La señora atiende el negocio con la ayuda de su esposo, pero la semana pasada este tuvo un viaje al exterior, la cliente necesita el dinero de este credito para la compra de mercaderia como: refrescos, garrafas, viveres y carne entre otros por que por las fiestas de carnavales la señora tiene mas ventas de platos extras( fricase y chicharron platos tipicos de la ciudad de La Paz y de Cochabamba hechos con carne de chancho).

La Sra Elisabeth es muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a new client, who comes to the institution recommended by former clients of the institution. She is married and has three, small children. She has a stand at Lake Cota Cota where she sells prepared meals. Her husband usually helps her with the business but last week he had to go abroad so she needs funds to buy merchandise like soft-drinks, caraffes, groceries and meats, among others because, during Carnival, her sales of extra dishes, like chicharron and fricase (two pork-based dishes typical of the cuisines of La Paz and Cochabamba) increase. Elizabeth is very hard-working and is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have put in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Khady Guèye

texts.fr: Kady Guèye S. est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et a une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité. Elle fait essentiellement de l'élevage de volailles et parallèlement elle vend du sucre et du poisson frais. Son objectif est de renforcer ses épargnes afin de prétendre à une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Kady Guèye SEN, aged 43, is married and the mother of one child. She has been a member of Banc Villageois for two years and has good experience in her business sector. Basically, she raises poultry, and concurrently she sells sugar and fresh fish. Aspiring to financial autonomy, she has a goal of bolstering her savings.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering and advancing her commercial businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy body lotions, perfume, beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying sewing machines

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA MARGARITA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO, QUE ES UNA ESPECIE DE ALMACEN PEQUEÑO, EN LA ZONA DE ALTO SAN ISIDRO. ELLA VIVE JUNTO A SU HIJA QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN EDAD ESCOLAR. MARGARITA ES UNA PERSONA CONOCIDA Y RESPETADA EN SU BARRIO YA QUE ES MUY AMABLE Y BRINDA UNA BUENA ATENCIÓN A TODOS SUS CLIENTES. ELLA ADEMÁS ES CONSIDERADA UNA BUENA MADRE YA QUE ELLA ESTA DIVORCIADA Y A PESAR DE ESO HA CRIADO A SU HIJA CON UNA BUENA EDUCACIÓN Y MUCHO CARIÑO. MARGARITA SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA PODER INCREMENTAR EL CAPITAL DE SU TIENDA YA QUE COMPRARÁ MATERIAL ESCOLAR POR QUE SE APROXIMA EL COMIENZO DE CLASES Y TENDRÁ MUCHOS PEDIDOS. UNO DE LOS MAYORES DESEOS DE ELLA ES VER A SU HIJA COMO UNA PROFESIONAL.

ESTA AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita has a neighborhood store. This is a type of small shop, in the Alto San Isidro area. She lives together with her school-aged daughter. Margarita is popular and respected in her neighborhood because she is very friendly and gives a lot of attention to all of her customers. Also she is considered to be a good mother. Despite being divorced, she has raised her daughter with much affection and has taught her to have good manners. Margarita is asking for the loan so that she can increase the capital for her store. She will buy school supplies because the start of classes is coming and she will have many orders. One of her biggest wishes is to see her daughter become a professional. She is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust offered her in granting her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies

loans.name: Rosa Adela

texts.es: D. Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora de 46 años de edad, casada y con tres hijos que procreo, vive en Villa Reconciliación en donde tiene su pequeño negocio que es la venta de ropa, zapatos, toallas, calcetas, aros, prénsamelos, trabas entre otros. Lo cual lleva varios años con esta venta lo cual comenzó con ayuda que su esposo dio, el trabaja como pastor evangélico, y tiene su propio salario, también ayuda a mucha personas. Al comienzo tenia un tramo en el mercado pero luego lo vendió y traslado su mercadería a su casa. Su vivienda es sencilla a un le falta repellar las paredes, pintar, hacer divisiones de la cocina. Aun no logra hacer estas mejoras, por falta de dinero ya que lo que ha prestado lo ha invertido en su venta de ropa el cual con sus ganancias puede sastifacer sus necesidades diarias. Con este financiamiento invertirá en ropa escolar como: falda, pantalones, camisas, calcetas, prensadores, bolsos, y otros para aumentar las venta y atraer clientes nuevos. A largo plazo es poder tener un local propio para su venta de ropa que espera lograr con estos financiamientos que han sido de muchos beneficios Ens. Vida personal como comerciante.
texts.en:
46-year old D. Rosa is a very hardworking woman. She is married and has three children. She lives in Villa Reconciliación where she has a small business selling clothing, shoes, towels, knitwear, earrings, barrettes etc. She’s had this business for several years. She started it with the help of her husband who is a protestant pastor. He has his own income and also helps many people. At first she had a stand in the market but later she sold it and moved her products to her house. Her home is simple: the walls need plastering; the house needs painting; and the kitchen dividing. However, she has not been able to afford these improvements as the loans she has had before have been used to buy clothing for her business. The income has been used to buy daily necessities. With this loan Rosa will buy school uniforms such as skirts, pants, shirts, sweaters, curling irons, bags, and other items to increase her sales and attract new customers. In the longterm she wants to obtain her own place to sell clothing. The loans have been of great benefit in her personal life as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing etc

loans.name: Crisoslogo

texts.es:
Crisoslogo tiene 65 años, es casado, tiene seis hijos, pertenece al banco comunal “Yanapakuy” de la Asociación Arariwa (Yanapakuy es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa “ayudemos”) y tiene un pequeño negocio familiar de venta de comida. Su esposa Ignacia nos cuenta que esta encargada del comedor de trabajadores de la empresa “Backus”, ella prepara almuerzo para 150 empleados. Ya son dos años que se dedican al negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen su trabajo. Crisoslogo requiere el préstamo de los 700 dólares, que invertirá en comprar arroz, aceite y azúcar.
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. 

(En la foto, el socio esta acompañado de su esposa).
texts.en:
Crisoslogo is 65 years old. He's married and has six children. He belongs to the communal bank "Yanapakuy" of the Asociación Arariwa (Yanapakuy is a Quechua word which translated to English means "Let's help"). He has a small family business selling food. His wife Ignacia tells us that she is in charge of the dining room of the employees of a business called "Backus". She prepares lunch for 150 employees. They have been doing this business for two years and it is going very well for them thanks to the effort they put into the work. Crisoslogo needs a loan of 700 dollars, which he will invest in buying rice, oil and sugar. He is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means and he is committed to making the payments according to the schedule. (In the photo, the member is accompanied by his wife).

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crisoslogo needs the 700 dollar loan which he will invest in purchasing rice, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying fruit

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye D. est une femme de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et a 4 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Son objectif est de développer son petit restaurant et de mener à la fois un commerce d'effets divers tels que du tissu et des bijoux.
texts.en:
Ndèye D. is a woman of 39 years. She is married and the mother of one child. She has been a member of Village Bank for 2 years and has benefitted from 4 loans. Her objective is to develop her small restaurant and to begin to also sell various merchandise such as fabric and jewelry.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow her restaurant and add merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA GRACIELA  SE DEDICA A COMERCIALIZAR ROPA DE TEMPORADA Y TAMBIEN TIENE UN PUESTO DE VENTA DE VERDURAS, EN UNA DE LAS CALLES MAS TRANSITADAS DE LA CIUDADA DE LA PAZ Y ELLA LLEVA SU MERCADERIA SEGÚN LOS PEDIDOS QUE LE HACEN A CAMIRI(PROVINCIA DE SANTA CRUZ). DOÑA GRACIELA TIENE SEIS HIJOS TRES DE ELLOS ESTUDIAN EN CASAS SUPERIORES Y TRES SON TODAVIA MENORES ESTUDIAN EN ESCUELAS, ELLA  ATIENDE EN LA MANUNTENCION DE LOS NIÑOS COMO TAMBIEN A SUS OTROS HIJOS. INGRESA AL PROGRAMA KIVA POR LA SELECCION QUE SE REALIZA PARA ESTE RUBRO Y TAMBIEN POR LA NECESIDAD QUE TIENE LA SEÑORA GRACIELA.
